Sèvèho Sévérin has very little formal education but learned to be a mechanic. Sèvèho Sévérin purchases motorcycles in Nigeria to resell from his home, which he has been doing for eight years. In order to meet his growing customer demand, Sèvèho Severin is seeking his first loan from Alidé.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycles in Nigeria to resell from his home.

loans.name: Martina Hilda

texts.es:
Martina, dueña de una pulpería expresa su agradecimiento por el apoyo que recibió al ser beneficiada con su crédito anterior el cual le permitió comprar productos para vender en su pulpería negocios muy populares y de ingresos diarios en la ciudad de León además que son de mucha necesidad entre la población de bajos ingresos. 
Actualmente doña Martina requiere de este financiamiento para comprar vitrinas para exhibir sus productos y tenerlos en mejores condiciones también para comprar granos básicos que son de consumo diario entre su clientela.
texts.en:
Martina owns a grocery store.  She expresses her thanks for the support she got when she was granted her previous loan that made it possible for her to buy popular products to sell in her grocery store and earn daily income in the city of León; besides they are very much needed among the low-income population.

Currently, Martina needs this loan to buy display cases to exhibit her products and have them in better conditions and also to buy basic grains that her customers consume daily.

loans.use: to buy display cases.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco de 48 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus padres,  se dedica a la agricultura siembra maíz y frijol y adicional a esto siembra hortalizas, tomates, chiles y ayote, tiene mas de 20 años de trabajar en la agricultura y ha ganado experiencia valiosa que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, el terreno donde siembra esta ubicado en una zona de alta incidencia agrícola y muy cercano a su vivienda, comercia en todos los alrededores de la comunidad y se ha hecho de mucha clientela que lo prefieren porque todo lo que vende es de primera calidad, a precios accesibles y con un buen servicio; francisco desea realizar  una nueva inversión que le permita aumentar la producción por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla, abono, insecticida, fertilizantes, controles de plagas, herramientas, etc. para obtener mejores cosechas y asi tener una mejor estabilidad económica con sus padres.
texts.en:
Francisco, 48, lives with his parents in his own house.  He works in agriculture growing corn and beans and also vegetables like tomatoes, chilies and squash.  He has been working in agriculture for more than 20 years and has gained valuable experience that makes it possible for him to obtain the best crops.  The land he farms is in an area of high agricultural concentration that’s very near his house.  He sells all around his community and has obtained a large clientele that prefers him because everything he sells is top quality at affordable prices with good service.

Francisco wants to make a new investment that will lead to increased production which is why he’s asking INTEGRAL for a loan to buy seeds, manure, insecticide, fertilizer, pest control, tools, etc. to obtain better crops so that he and his parents can have better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and tools.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina continúa viviendo en la ciudad de Huancarani y donde realiza sus actividades personales, económicas y familiares, ella continua con la venta de comida y con la agricultura. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias a su empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más productos de primera necesidad como por ejemplo fideos, azúcar, verduras, carne, arroz, aceite y otras cosas más. 

Alejandrina continúa en el banco comunal “Mamacha Rosario” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Alejandrina continues living in the city of Huancarani where she carries out her personal, family and business activities.  She continues to sell food and farm.  She has been doing this work for a number of years and is doing very well thanks to the effort that she puts into her work.

On this occasion, Alejandrina needs a loan to buy more basic household products such as noodles, sugar, vegetables, meat, rice, oil, etc.

Alejandrina still belongs to Asociación Arariwa's "Mamacha Rosario" community bank.  She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving and pledges to make her loan repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy more basic household products such as noodles, sugar, vegetables, meat, rice, oil, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente tiene un taller de enderezado y pintura desde hace varios años, vive con su compañera de vida  en casa de un familiar es un hombre muy trabajador responsable, honesto y honrado, tienen mucha clientela pues lo prefieren por su buen trabajo y los precios realmente accesibles, con las ganancias que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos que tiene en su hogar, el cliente esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de pinturas, esmaltes para vehiculos, herramientas, y todo lo necesario para seguir con su trabajo y así tener una mejor calidad de vida con su compañera de vida.
texts.en:
The client has had a bodywork and painting workshop for several years.  He lives with his life partner in a family member's house.  He's a very hardworking, responsible, honest, and honorable man.  He has a lot of customers who prefer him because of his good work and truly affordable prices.  With his profits he's able to pay some of his household expenses.

The client's requesting a loan to buy paint, car varnish, tools, and everything he needs to continue doing his job and have a better quality of life with his life partner.

loans.use: to buy paint, car varnish, tools, etc.

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en:
Kenneth is just one year shy of owning his business, L’s Pressure Washing Service, in New Iberia, Louisiana.  The vast array of services offered by this professional such as concrete pressure washing, mobile home washing, camper washing, and even simple automobile washing services give the residents of New Iberia great selection. 
 
Kenneth started his business 11 months ago and recently was referred to Accion Texas Inc. by a friend and active Accion client, Karen.  Karen’s positive words about Accion led Kenneth to apply for a loan.  The loan Kenneth received allowed him to upgrade his current water pressure system, complete vehicle repairs, and pay his part-time employee.

The quality of work done by Kenneth and his employee is superior, with great attention to detail.  Each work area they tackle is done with great pride and dedication.  You can see pictures of his pressure-cleaned spaces at Kenneth’s Facebook page.   https://www.facebook.com/LivingstonsPressureWashing?filter=3 

Kenneth hopes to increase his clientele and has high hopes of doing so by word of mouth, social media, and referrals.  Kenneth’s future plans include using his loan from Accion to hire an additional part-time employee to assist with the work load.

loans.use: to upgrade his current water pressure system, complete vehicle repairs, and pay his part-time employee.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
As an immigrant to the U.S., Maria is no stranger to hard work and ambition.  At 15, she and her family moved from Guatemala to El Salvador and then the US, searching to fulfill their dreams of self-sustainability and a better life. 

Years later, during the hardest part of the U.S. recession, every member of her family lost their jobs, and Maria was the only member of her family left with a full-time job.  She felt blessed for her opportunity, but wanted a way to help her family further.  As a single mother of two daughters, Maria also wanted to have time for her daughters to teach them the work ethic and values imparted to her. 
 
Maria used her business sense and skills to develop a business model that would address all of her family needs and help her achieve her personal goals.  Her motto has been, “You can always do more.  You can make money doing the right thing.”  Following her motto, she started her own business, Mayan Commercial and Residential Cleaning Services, in June 2012. 
 
Since then, Maria has been able to employ her family members, spend more time with her daughters and expand her business to cover three large commercial locations, servicing over 35,000 ft of retail space.  Maria shares that she enjoys the challenge, and that her deep commitment to integrity and her ambition to provide a better life for her family is what motivates her to succeed.  

Maria’s Kiva loan will be used to purchase a commercial carpet cleaning machine, which will enable her business to service large, retail flooring locations and provide an additional service to her growing clientele.  With your help, Maria can continue to make a positive impact on her family and her community.

“I’m so thankful for Kiva, and for the opportunities that Kiva lenders create.  To each of you, thank you for what you do.” – Maria, Mayan Commercial and Residential Cleaning Services

loans.use: to purchase a commercial carpet cleaning machine

loans.name: Denis

texts.en:
Denis is a permanent resident of Rugando in the western region of Uganda, married with seven children and 2 dependents of his brother who died of cancer five years ago. He grew up with only his mother as his father was not known to him, which made his life difficult. 

Being pushed by the need to survive and to support his mother, he started banana farming on a small scale on the land he got from his grandmother. This banana plantation was used as a source of food for the family and income for their survival. This business has grown, giving him an opportunity to support his family and dependents. He also managed to construct a house for his family. He is requesting a loan of UGX.4,000,000 to complete the house. He is excited that soon he will be in a position to house his children in modest accommodations.In the photo is Denis with his wife who signed the waiver form.

loans.use: To buy building materials

loans.name: Sarhad

texts.en:
Sarhad is a man of 54 years. Currently he is married. His wife is a housewife and she also helps Sarhad with the farm work. They have four children, ages 29, 26, 21 and 17.

Sarhad learned farm work from the time he was a child. His father imparted to him the practical knowledge of work in everything related to agriculture. Later he made it his everyday work so as to always be able to support his household. For 22 years he has been farming and raising cattle for milk production. His wife is a great help in this activity. When Sarhad goes out to sell, she feeds the animals or prepares the land where the crops are. In addition, Sarhad works as an accountant at the local supermarket and earns a salary there. 

The reason he is requesting a loan of 1,000 AZN is to purchase materials like cables and wire for the installation of electricity in his home. His dream is to improve his housing condition by applying finishes in his home and building a retaining wall. Sarhad is grateful to those who, through Kiva, can be part of this growth in his life, and he encourages them to continue supporting the business ventures of people who, like him, dream of having a better quality of life in their households.

loans.use: To purchase materials like cables and wire for the installation of electricity in his home.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia continúa viviendo en la ciudad de Huancarani de la provincia de Huancarani y donde realiza sus actividades personales y económicas, ella continua  dedicándose a la cosecha, cultivo y a vender cereales como   por ejemplo trigo, cebada, moraya seca, maíz y otras cosas más. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias a su empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

En esta oportunidad Celia requiere el préstamo para compra semillas y abonos, pues continua en el banco comunal “Mamacha Rosario” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Celia continues living in the city of Huancarani, in Huancarani province.  This is where she carries out her personal and business activities.  She continues growing, harvesting and selling cereals such as wheat, barley, 'moraya' (freeze-dried potato), corn, etc.  She has been in this business for a number of years and is doing very well thanks to the effort that she puts into her work.

On this occasion, Celia needs a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers.  She still belongs to Asociación Arariwa's "Mamacha Rosario" community bank and is grateful for the opportunity she is being given.  She pledges to make her loan repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Khim's Group

texts.en: Khim is 35 years old and a local villager from Kandal Province. She takes care of one daughter who is still in school. Nowadays, the household income consists of her wages working at a factory and the rice farming business managed by her husband. She helps with the family’s business during her spare time. She has been involved in this business for five years. With VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), Khim has taken out four loans and repaid back her past loans with success. She wisely utilized her previous loans to support her business and make good progress. Now, she leads a group of two to apply for a new loan. Khim, the group leader, will spend her loan portion to buy rice seed, insecticide, and to pay the plowing fee. She hopes that she can produce a good crop and make a good profit.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, insecticide, and to pay the plowing fee

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es: Orlando es una persona trabajadora y joven. Tiene su esposa y un niño de 5 años. Actualmente Orlando vive junto a su familia en una zona marginada de Cochabamba. Viven en su propia vivienda que adquirieron hace unos años, fruto del trabajo que realizan con el servicio de transporte. Actualmente Orlando necesita terminar de construir su vivienda, ya que aun no tiene los requerimientos básicos para que su vivienda mantenga las condiciones saludables donde su pequeño hijo y familia puedan llevar una vida digna. Entre sus planes futuros Orlando planea obtener un nuevo préstamo para amurallar su domicilio puesto que actualmente no tiene muralla.
texts.en: Orlando is a hard-working young man who is married and has a 5-year-old son.  The family currently lives in a poor area of Cochabamba in their own home that they managed to buy a few years ago as a result of Orlando's work providing a transport service.  Orlando currently needs to finish building his home as the house still doesn't meet the basic requirements for his young son and family to lead a decent life in a healthy environment.  Orlando's future plans include taking out a further loan to build a wall around his home as it currently doesn't have one.

loans.use: to carry out building work on his house

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es:
José, está soltero, vive con sus padres y hermana, no tiene familiares en el extranjero. El se dedica a  la venta de muebles de madera, lo realiza desde hace un año y lo lleva a cabo desde las 6:00am a 6:00pm, ventaja con la que cuenta es que ya  posee experiencia y no presenta ninguna dificultad, el oficio lo aprendió de su familia desde hace 8 años.
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar más mercadería para tener disponible para sus clientes tales como: camas, sillas, entre otros. Esta inversión le ayudara a brindarles un mejor servicio a sus clientes y crecer más en el negocio.  
Su sueño es obtener más mercadería y ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
José is single and lives with his parents and sister. He does not have any family members abroad. José makes a living selling wood furniture from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. each day. He has been working in this business for a year, but he already has much experience since he learned the trade from his family eight years ago. 

The loan José is requesting will allow him to buy more merchandise to have at the ready for his customers such as beds, chairs, and others. This investment will help him to offer better service to his customers and expand his business. José's dream is to obtain more merchandise and offer his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy beds, chairs, and other items.

loans.name: Heng's Group

texts.en: Heng, age 54 and a widow, is a citizen from the Kror Kor district of Pursat province. She has three children, two of whom are helping the family’s businesses. Heng makes a living by farming one and half hectares of rice as her primary business. She earns supplemental income by selling Cambodian noodles and catching fish for resale. The businesses she has operated for 12 years earns her about 19,700 KHR per day. She is a seven-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Her past loans have been fully repaid, enabling her to provide sufficient food for her kids. Now, Heng leads a group of five to apply for a new loan. As the leader, she will use a portion of her loan to buy fishing equipment and to fix her boat. She believes that she can triple her income so as she can upgrade her lifestyle even better than before.

loans.use: To buy fishing equipment and to fix her boat

loans.name: Ana Maricar

texts.en: Ana Maricar is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman and has four children. Ana Maricar has been engaged in farming for more than five years now as the only the source of income. Ana Maricar is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, she will be able to grow healthy crops thus allowing her to augment her harvest. In the future, Ana Maricar hopes to expand her farming business and make it a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children and to repay her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Isvelia

texts.es: La señora Isvelia vive en la población de Manco Kapac con su concubino. La señora Isvelia trabaja junto con su conyugué dedicándose al área agrícola, trabajan en su terreno propio, este terreno lo adquirieron con mucho esfuerzo después de  2 años de trabajo duro,  en este terreno producen piña y yuca, la comercialización la realiza a los intermediarios que generalmente vienen a comprar al lugar donde se cosecha el producto. La producción de piña va creciendo en el  lugar y genera buenos ingresos económicos, para ello la señora Isvelia y su concubino requieren el crédito para comprar plantines de piña para poder ampliar su producción, con este crédito la señora Isvelia podrá ser capaz de cumplir sus metas propuestas,  seguir creciendo económicamente y ser una de las productoras de piña reconocidas en la zona.
texts.en: Isvelia lives in the town of Manco Kapac with her spouse.  She and her spouse work together in agriculture on land of their own that they acquired with much effort after two years of hard work.  They grow pineapple and manioc on their land and sell it to middlemen that come by their place.  The pineapple production is growing in the place and generates good income and this is why Isvelia and her spouse need the loan to buy pineapple seedlings to expand production.  With this loan, Isvelia will be capable of meeting her set goals, to continue to grow economically and to be one of the most well-known pineapple producers in the zone.

loans.use: to buy pineapple seedlings.

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Chantha is 42 years old and a mother of two children. She and the rest of her family are residing in Kandal province’s Sa Ang district. 

She makes a living via pole bean planting. The 22 years' engagement in the current business enables her to generate about KHR 13,300 per day. 

Twice, Chantha has taken a microloan from VisionFund Cambodia and has fully repaid them. The past loan has kept up a good pace of her business and has improved her living conditions progressively. 

Now, she is taking a new loan of KHR 2,200,000 in order to make poles for her beans and to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her crops. She hopes to earn more income, so she can set aside some money for her future needs.

loans.use: to make poles for her beans and to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her crops.

loans.name: Mab's Group

texts.en: Mab is in his late 40s and is the father of seven children. He grows rice on two hectares and has had the business for 10 years. It earns him about 14,200 KHR per day to meet the expenses of his entire household. Mab has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for two loans and has repaid them completely, managing to improve his standard of living. Now he is leading a group of three to apply for a new loan. The total amount of his group's loan is 3,200,000 KHR, of which 1,200,000 KHR is his portion. Mab will spend his loan portion to buy fertilizer and to hire a laborer to plow his farmland. He expects to increase his income better than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to hire a laborer to plow his farmland

loans.name: Ath's Group

texts.en: Ath is the father of one son and resides in the Sampov Meas district of Pursat province, Ath farms rice on three hectares of land as his main source of income. He is able to earn up to 13,500 KHR per day from the business which he has had for two years. He took out a previous loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) which he has repaid back completely. The loan has supported his rice cultivation. Now, Ath leads a group of four to apply for a new loan. He will spend his requested loan amount to buy four sacks of potash and to pay the plowing fee. He believes that he can make more income to expand his business at a bigger scale than before.

loans.use: to buy four sacks of potash and to pay the plowing fee

loans.name: Benkelema Group

texts.fr:
Les six  membres du groupe  BENKELEMA sont essentiellement des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37  ans, 6 enfants et vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogame à KADIOLO (Noumousso) un des cercle de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur onzième prêt avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
KOROTOUMOU en position debout et au milieu sur la photo, fait la restauration   il ya environ 7 ans, sa renommée en la matière fait d’elle une restauratrice très sollicitée. 
Elle s’approvisionne en matière première (céréales et condiments) à Kadiolo ville et souvent dans les villages avoisinants. Elle détient une gargote à Kadiolo ville. Sa  clientèle se compose d’hommes et de femmes. Elle vend ses plats alimentaires  en détail et au comptant dans sa gargote et à domicile.
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne .
texts.en:
The majority of the six members of the BENKELEMA group are married women who, on average, are 37 years old and have six children each.  Most of them live in monogamous families in Kadiolo (Noumousso), one of the districts of Sikasso (third-largest administrative division of Mali).  They are on their eleventh loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and have duly repaid all their previous loans.

Korotoumou, the featured borrower, has been preparing meals for about seven years.  In the photo, she is standing in the middle of the group.  She is well-known in her field and receives many orders.

She buys her supplies (grains and condiments) in the town of Kadiolo and also often stocks up in the surrounding villages.  She owns a very small restaurant in the town of Kadiolo and serves meals to both men and women.  She sells her meals for cash and on a retail basis in her small restaurant and also from home.

She is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 45,000 CFA francs, part of which will be used to repay her loan and the interest while the rest will be saved.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for the preparation of meals.

loans.name: Bugambilias San Pablo Group

texts.es:
La señora Ignacia Domitila es madre soltera, tiene 52 años de edad, su escolaridad es primaria, tiene 1 hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, inició este negocio comprando poca mercadería y hasta la fecha lleva 10 años de experiencia.

Decide organizar un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de más mercadería y asi poder surtir su venta y generar mayor ganancia, en el futuro quiere ver su negocio prospero; las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la venta de ropa y molino de nixtamal.
texts.en:
Ignacia Domitila is 52 years old. She has a primary school education and is a single mother with one son. She works selling clothing, and started her business by purchasing a small amount of merchandise and now has ten years of experience.

She has decided to start a group and is applying for a loan that will be used to purchase more merchandise to increase her stock for sale as well as her profits. In the future, she would like to see her business thrive. The other members of her group earn their livings selling clothing and grinding cornmeal for tortillas.

loans.use: to buy and sell clothing.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: El señor Miguel trabaja como agricultor en una parte de terreno que su padre le proporcionó,  cultiva sus productos para después comercializarlo en el mercado de la población; por otro lado cuando no trabaja en su terreno le ayuda a su pareja en la venta de sus abarrotes donde venden de lunes a domingo sin parar ni un día, tiene un bebito al que mantienen con ambos trabajos, el dinero que está solicitando es para poder agrandar su tienda de abarrotes y para que puedan generar un poco mas de ingreso y así puedan sacar adelante a su pequeño hijito.
texts.en: Miguel works in agriculture on a part of a piece of land his father gave him; he grows his products to subsequently sell them in the local market.  On the other hand, when he’s not working the land he helps his spouse to sell groceries Monday to Sunday with no days off.  He has a baby they support by means of both jobs.  The money he’s asking for is to be able to enlarge his grocery store so that they can generate a bit more income and be able to move their little boy ahead.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Tyrone

texts.en:
Tyrone began Innovations Valid Photo Concepts two months ago in Memphis, Tennessee.  A photography, videography and production company that offers clients custom framed photographs, short movie productions for YouTube, and video recording services.

Tyrone discovered Accion Texas Inc. while watching the morning television show, Good Morning Memphis.  He took the necessary steps to apply and received a $5,450 loan.  The loan allowed Tyrone to continue to photograph weddings and parties with the few supplies he purchased with the loan money.  Tyrone is using his loan money to rent office space for the next six months, purchase updated camera equipment, film, and retain his one full-time employee.  Tyrone believes in great customer service and guarantees the best experience or your money back.  He believes he is hired to do the best job he possibly can during the special moments of his clients lives.  

Without the Accion loan he would still be utilizing his existing equipment and holding off to rent an office space.  The new equipment purchased has allowed Tyrone to step up to the demands of his business and offer better quality services, video, and photographs.

loans.use: to rent office space for the next six months, purchase updated camera equipment, film, and retain his one full-time employee.

loans.name: Soutoura Group

texts.fr:
Les sept membres du groupe SOUTOURA sont essentiellement des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 37  ans, et en moyenne 6 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogame à KADIOLO (Noumousso) un des cercle de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
ALIMA  en position debout et au milieu sur la photo, fait le commerce de tissus et des parures il ya environ 11 ans, sa renommée en la matière fait d’elle une commerçante très sollicitée. 
Elle compte acheter, 10 pièces de pagnes wax et quelques colis de parures. Elle s’approvisionne  à Kadiolo ville et souvent à Sikasso. Elle fait le commerce ambulant à Kadiolo ville. Sa  clientèle se composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle vend également à domicile.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35 000 francs CFA dont une partie sera  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne .
texts.en:
The majority of the seven members of the SOUTOURA group are married women who, on average, are 37 years old and have six children each. Most of them live in monogamous families in Kadiolo (Noumousso), one of the districts of Sikasso (third-largest administrative division of Mali). They are on their fifth loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and have duly repaid all their previous loans.

Alima, the featured borrower, has been selling fabrics and jewelry for about 11 years.  She is well-known in her field and receives many orders.  In the photo, she is in the standing row, in the middle of the group. 

She plans to buy 10 sets of wax "pagnes" (colorful West-African fabrics) and a few boxes containing jewelry.  She buys her goods in Kadiolo and also often stocks up in Sikasso.  She sells door to door in the town of Kadiolo and her customers are men and women.  She also sells from home.

She is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 35,000 CFA francs, part of which will be used to repay her loan and the interest while the rest will be used to strengthen her savings.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and jewelry.

loans.name: Enongninmon Antoine

texts.fr: Enongninmon Antoine, 49 ans, est marié à une revendeuse nommée Justine. Le couple à cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Enongninmon Antoine vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges du ménage. Enongninmon Antoine a très peu fréquenté l'école mais a appris la soudure. En plus de ses activités de soudures, Enongninmon Antoine vend également des tôles dans sa région depuis huit ans. Enongninmon Antoine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande grandissante de sa clientèle, Enongninmon Antoine sollicite pour la cinquième  fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé.  Les prêts antérieurs ont tous été remboursés en temps et en heure.
texts.en: Enongninmon Antoine, 49, is married to a reseller named Justine. The couple has five children, all who attend school and who are in their care. Enongninmon Antoine lives with his wife and his children. The couple shares the various household expenses. Enongninmon Antoine has had very little schooling but has learned to weld. In addition to his welding, Enongninmon Antoine has also been selling sheet metal in his area for eight years. Enongninmon Antoine stocks up in a market in Benin. In the goal of satisfying the growing needs of his clientele, Enongninmon Antoine is seeking for a fifth time, financial support from ALIDé. His previous loans have all been properly repaid on time.

loans.use: to buy sheet metal and accessories for welding

loans.name: Talshica

texts.en:
For eight years, Talshica has offered her services as a professional hair care attendant. As she continues to juggle her business and her side job, Talshica’s main focus is providing professional help for those without healthy hair. 

At her business, New Growth Hair Care, Talshica takes hair at all levels -- thin, split, broken and even healthy – and treats it to an improved level of care from her storefront, and oftentimes, in client’s homes.

Gaining clients from fliers, social groups, friends, family, and from advice given to potential clients, Talshica says more than half of her clients are returning clients. 

To expand her business, Talshica ventured to Accion Texas Inc. after learning about the nonprofit microlender from the Small Business Development Center in her hometown of Baton Rouge. A $5,450 loan helped the 32-year-old purchase sinks, chairs, dyers, and a receptionist desk and chair.

Though Talshica has many years of experience, she is at the beginning of her next stage of her business. She says after the additions to the store are made, she plans to add hire one full-time and three part-time employees. She also plans to become a wholesaler for the products she uses to increase business.

loans.use: to purchase sinks, chairs, dyers, and a receptionist desk and chair.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en: Florencia earns a living through her sari-sari or variety store business. She sells various goods and items to the people in her place like canned goods and noodles among others. This is the source of her income. Florencia is asking for a loan to buy more stock of items like canned goods, soda, noodles, rice, soap and toiletries to sell. With this, she will be able to improve her stock and attract more buyers in her store, thus augmenting her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy more stock of items like canned goods, soda, noodles, rice, soap and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman and a mother of three young children. 

She has been in the rice farming business for more than five years now. This is the source of their income. 

Lourdes is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer, and pesticides for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve her farm as well as her harvest. 

In the future, Lourdes hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer, and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Khatija

texts.en:
Khatija is a 53-year-old woman, living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She has three children and, for 15 years, her husband has been operating an automobile workshop. They are facing financial problems due to low monthly income.

Khatija has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner, BRAC Pakistan. She wants to invest in her husband’s business, so that their income and savings would be increased. The main purpose of the loan is for her husband to buy new tools for repairing and tuning automobiles. His customer base would be increased, if he had the latest equipment and tools. 

In the future, with the profit amount, he wants to expand his workshop by adding some more space to it. Khatija is very hopeful that this loan could solve many problems for her family and she is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their help.

loans.use: to purchase new tools for her husband's automobile workshop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Maria Gloria

texts.es: Maria vive con su esposo y su hijo de 14 años de edad. Ella posee una tortillería la cual es muy conocida en la localidad donde reside, tiene muchos clientes pues vende las mejores tortillas, calientitas y con el servicio más rápido además a precios realmente accesibles; María es una mujer emprendedora con ganas de salir adelante, tiene una actitud de ganadora, por eso siempre se mantiene adelante de la competencia, ella piensa que cuando alguien desea algo debe saber que corre riesgos y por eso la vida vale la pena, quiere correr el riesgo para poder hacer crecer su negocio por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz por mayor. María tiene la esperanza que de esta forma podrá llevar a su hogar seguridad económica y una vida plena para su familia.
texts.en:
María lives with her husband and 14-year-old son.  She owns a tortilla shop that’s very well-known in the community where she lives.  She has many customers because she sells the best, nice and hot, tortillas and service is very fast and prices are truly affordable.

María is an enterprising woman who very much wants to get ahead.  He has a winning attitude which is what always keeps her ahead of the competition.  She thinks that when someone wants something she must be aware that there are risks involved but life is worth it.  She wants to run this risk in order to make her business grow and that’s why she’s asking INTEGRAL for a loan to buy corn at wholesale.  María hopes in this way to bring economic security home and a fulfilled life for her family.

loans.use: to buy corn at wholesale.

loans.name: Kobanka Group

texts.fr:
Mme BRIGITTE représente le groupe  KOBANKA. Mariée, elle est mère de 02enfants. Le plus âgé a 05ans et le moins âgé a 02ans. Personne ne va à l’école et elle a 04personnes en charge.
Mme vend des pagnes depuis 01an. Elle s’approvisionne chez les grossistes de pagnes au grand marché. Ses clients sont les hommes, les femmes.
Elle veut s’acheter 10pagnes.
Mme veut épargner ses bénéfices. Elle ambitionne ouvrir une boutique de pagne et aider ses enfants pour leur avenir.
texts.en: Mrs. Brigitte represents the KOBANKA group. She is a married mother of two. The eldest is 5 and the youngest is 2. None of her children attend school and she has four people in her care. Mrs. Brigitte has been selling pagnes (traditional cloth wraps) for a year. She stocks up with pagne wholesalers at the big market. Her customers are men and women. She wants to buy ten pagnes. Mrs. Brigitte wants to save her earnings. She aspires to open a pagne boutique and help her children with their future.

loans.use: to buy 10 pagnes

loans.name: Zanga Group

texts.fr:
Mme P.JEANNE MARIE représente le groupe  ZANGA. Mariée, elle est mère de 04enfants. Le plus âgé a 21ans et le moins âgé a 15ans. 02 vont à l’école.
Mme fait la restauration depuis 10ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son quartier. Ses clients sont les voisins et amis.
Elle veut s’acheter 02 sacs de riz et 10 plats d’arachide.
Mme veut renforcer son activité avec ses bénéfices. Elle ambitionne agrandir son restaurant et aider son mari pour la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en: Mrs. P.JEANNE MARIE represents the ZANGA group. She is a married mother of four. The eldest is 21 and the youngest is 15. Two of her children attend school. Mrs. P.JEANNE MARIE has been in the restaurant business for 10 years. She stocks up at the neighborhood market. Her customers are neighbors and friends. She wants to buy two sacks of rice and ten plates of peanuts. Mrs. P.JEANNE MARIE wants to strengthen her business with her earnings. She aspires to grow her restaurant and help her husband pay for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy 2 sacks of rice and 10 plates of peanuts

loans.name: Dwarsani Group

texts.en:
In the year 2009, four rural tribal women from Baddohel village of Nuapada district in Odisha, India formed a group named Dwarsani to access a loan from Mahashakti Foundation and expand their business. Sumitra is one of them. The lady standing second from the left in the photo raising her hand is Sumitra; aged 30, she is a very poor tribal lady, and lives with her husband and her nephew. Her family belongs to a Below Poverty Line (BPL) category. People from the BPL category live on less than one dollar a day.

Sumitra has been running a general store in her small village for last 12 years. Her nephew supplements in her business. She sells general grocery items like oil, sugar, lentils, biscuits, soft drinks (sodas) and stationery such as books, pens, etc. Sumitra was able to increase the variety of items at her general store with her scanty savings and increase her cash flow. 

Her monthly income from the existing business is 6000 Indian Rupees (INR). Out of this income she has been able to manage her household expenses and spent some income for construction of a small shop cabin. As per the statement she was able to increase the variety of items in her shop but not the inventory. She wants to increase stock of her business. So the loan amount will be utilized to purchase items like lentils, oil, dal, soap, biscuits, potatoes etc. in bulk for her general store. This will help her to reduce her purchasing and transportation costs as she will replenish her stock less frequently. Sumitra hopes to save enough for building a good house for her family as the present house is very small and congested.

The other three members of the group are Pramila, Jamuna and Kumari who are running a tyre repairing center, a general shop and a goat business respectively.

loans.use: To buy lentils, oil, dal, soap, biscuits, potatoes, etc.

loans.name: Rafia

texts.en: Rafia is a 47-year-old hardworking woman. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband, two sons, and three daughters. All of her children are studying in school. She and her husband have owned a fast food business for five years, which is the only source of income for their family. Now for the further growth of their business Rafia has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase some crockery and chairs for the restaurant. Since their family expenditures are much higher than their monthly income and savings she wants to open a new shop for her husband with the profit amount. As a result, they can increase their monthly income and savings. She dreams for the higher education of her children. She is very thankful to Kiva for such a great help and kindness.

loans.use: To purchase furniture for restaurant

loans.name: Fidèle's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de sept personnes résident dans le même quartier.
La représentante du groupe, nommée Fidèle (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 29 ans, elle est mariée à un maçon avec lequel elle a eu trois enfants. 
Contrairement à Fidèle qui n’a été à l’école, tous ses enfants sont scolarisés.
Afin d’assurer les charges de la famille avec son mari, Fidèle vend des chaussures dans sa région depuis sept ans. 
Régulièrement, elle s'approvisionne dans un marché de sa ville pour revendre chez elle au détail.
Au vu de la demande croissante de ses clients, Fidèle s’est regroupé avec d’autres personnes de son voisinage pour solliciter un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. 
Les prêts antérieurs ont tous bien été remboursés en temps et en heure.
texts.en:
This group comprises seven members who all live in the same neighborhood.  Fidèle, the group's representative, is 29 years old and married to a mason with whom she has had three children.  In the photo, she is the woman raising her hand.

Unlike Fidèle, who did not attend school, all her children are in school.

In order to jointly take care of the family's expenses with her husband, Fidèle has been selling shoes, in her region, for the past seven years.

She regularly stocks up at one of her town's markets and resells from home on a retail basis.  As the demand from her customers is increasing, she has formed a group with other women from her neighborhood in order to request a third loan from ALIDé.  All previous loans have been duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Dagbozounkou Dénagan

texts.fr:
Dagbozounkou Dénagan est âgé de 50 ans, il vit avec sa femme Houmè et leur 5 enfants qui sont tous scolarisés.
Il partage avec sa femme, qui fait du petit commerce, les charges de sa famille.

Dagbozounkou Dénagan a très peu fréquenté l'école mais il a développé une grande expertise dans la maçonnerie qu'il exerce depuis 15 ans maintenant. 
Aujourd'hui Dagbozounkou Dénagan fait appel à ALIDé, pour la troisième fois, afin d'acheter des matériaux au marché pour construire des clôtures pailles (claies)afin de satisfaire sa clientèle.
Son grand dynamisme fait la force de son activité et est reconnu par tous.

Tous ses prêts antérieurs ont bien été remboursés.
texts.en:
Dagbozounkou Dénagan is 50 years old and lives with his wife Houmè and their five children, who all attend school. He pays for his family’s expenses with his wife, who runs a small business.

Dagbozounkou Dénagan has had very little schooling but has developed a strong expertise in masonry, which he has been doing for 15 years. Today Dagbozounkou Dénagan seeks the help of ALIDé for the third time in order to buy materials from the market to construct wire fences in order to satisfy his clientele. His energy drives his business and is recognized by everyone.

All of his previous loans were properly repaid.

loans.use: to buy materials to develop his masonry business

loans.name: Sèssimè's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est composé de trois femmes qui résident dans le même quartier. 
Elles ont décidé de se réunir pour prendre chacune un premier prêt auprès d'ALIDé afin de développer leur activité respective.

La représentante du groupe, Sèssimè (au milieu de la photo avec la main levée) est âgée de 41 ans. 
Elle est mariée avec Antoine et a eu quatre enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés.

Pour assurer les charges de la famille avec son mari qui est commerçant, Sèssimè s'approvisionne en maïs et boissons locales dans un marché de sa ville pour les revendre à son domicile depuis trois ans.

Bien qu'elle n'ait pas fréquentée l’école, elle est connue pour la bonne gestion de son activité.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three women who live in the same neighborhood. They decided to come together to take their first loan with ALIDé in order to develop their respective businesses.

The representative of the group, Sèssimè (in the middle of the photo with her hand raised), is 41 years old. She is married to Antoine and has four children, some of whom attend school.

In order to keep up with her family’s expenses with her husband, who is a storekeeper, Sèssimè has been stocking up on corn and local beverages in a city market to resell from her home for the last three years.

Although she didn’t go to school, she is known for managing her business well.

loans.use: to buy corn and local drinks

loans.name: Kendric

texts.en:
Although Kendric did not have much experience in the food industry, he didn’t allow that fact to hinder him from opening his mobile restaurant, Empty Bowl. Beginning in Katy, Texas, Kendric started his mobile pasta dish business less than six months ago with very little resources and serves surrounding cities.  

To purchase necessary cooking equipment for his business, begin constructing his website and social media page, pay for advertising in print and online publications in Katy, cover vendor licensing fees at trade shows and food inventory, Kendric knew he would need financial assistance.

While researching business support websites, Kendric came across Accion Texas Inc.  He inquired with Accion regarding a small business loan.  Once Kendric followed through the loan application process he was approved for $5,450.

Kendric is now able to continue displaying his dishes at local trade shows and conventions around the Katy and Houston, Texas area. He plans to continue demonstrating his dishes at local events and build clientele to serve his pasta and spice up his business.

loans.use: To purchase cooking equipment, begin constructing his website and social media page, and to pay for advertising, vendor licensing fees, and food inventory.

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
Maria tiene 41 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Pisco, ciudad de clima cálido, paisajes turísticos hermosos, asimismo tiene una gastronomía variada y deliciosa. Es madre de 2 hijos de 16 y 19 años, a  quienes quiere muchísimo y por quienes daría la vida para poder  darles felicidad, y sobre todo poder ofrecerles una vida digna. Maria es muy carismática y sobre todo tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante, por ello cada día Maria trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de jugos y sándwich, ella trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al día y puede atender hasta 30 clientes al día; Maria cree que esta saliendo adelante porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque tiene buena sazon.

Maria esta muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá 2 licuadoras, mesa, sillas, entre otros, con lo cual podrá mejorar su negocio y poder atender de manera más pronta a los clientes, así podrá mejorar sus ingresos y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Terminar de construir su casa”.
texts.en:
María, 41, lives in the city of Pisco, a city with a hot climate, beautiful tourist sites and a varied, delicious cuisine.  She’ the mother of two children who are 16 and 19 who she loves very much and for whom she’d give her life to make  them happy and above all to give them a proper life. 

María is very charismatic and above all very much wants to get ahead which is why María works every day in a small business selling juices and sandwiches.  She works about 9 hours daily and can see up to 30 customers per day.  She believes she’s doing well because she’s nice to her customers and above all because she’s a very tasty cook.

María is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support they’ve given her she will be able to buy two blenders, a table and chairs, among others that will improve her business because she’ll be able to take care of customers more quickly thus improving her income and continuing to strive to make her greatest dream reality: to finish building her house.

loans.use: to buy blenders, chairs and tables, among others.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 31-year-old diligent and hardworking woman. Her husband is a carpenter and she is helping her husband to meet the household expenses by selling dry fruits. She has been doing this business for 12 years. She has four children and three of them are currently studying in schools.

Fatima has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a large quantity of dry fruits from village at a cheaper rate to sell for profit. She would also package her dry fruits properly, through which her sales would be increased. Fatima is very hopeful that the loan will have a positive impact on her life.

loans.use: to purchase dry fruit

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Maria, de 45 años de edad , vive en la ciudad de León , tiene un hijo de 10 años de edad que está estudiando la primaria  ella es cosmetóloga y al mismo tiempo es dueña de un Cyber Café.  Negocio que tiene 1 año de estar funcionando pues ella observo que en su vecindario había la necesidad de instalar este tipo de actividad. Actualmente tiene 7 computadoras con las que brinda el servicio  de internet, es muy visitado por jóvenes universitarios y gente que vive alrededor, además como otras formas de conseguir ingresos  vende cosméticos en su casa. 
Ella está solicitando el financiamiento para comprar una fotocopiadora y un router. Esto le permitirá brindar un mejor servicio a su clientela. Uno de sus planes futuros es establecer dos Cyber Café adicionales para atender a más personas y llevarles el servicio.
texts.en:
María, 45, lives in the city of León.  She has a ten-year-old son attending primary school.  She’s a cosmetologist but at the same time owns an Internet Café.  This business has been in operation for a year since she noticed that her neighborhood needed this type of activity.  She currently has seven computers to provide Internet access service.  The business is quite frequented by young university students and by people who live nearby.  Also, as another way of earning income she sells cosmetics at home.

She’s asking for financing to buy a photocopier and a router which will make it possible for her to provide better customer service.  One of her future plans is to open two more Internet Cafés to tend to more people and provide them with this service.

loans.use: to buy a photocopier and a router.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman, and has been in the farming business for more than ten years. This is the source of her income.

Zenaida is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer, and pesticides for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve her farm as well as her harvest. 

In the future, Zenaida hopes to make her business a success, and save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer, and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Wycliffe

texts.en: Wycliffe is a Kiva borrower who describes himself as polite and courageous. He has taken a loan of KES 20,000 to buy a water tank that will benefit four members of his family. They will be able to store clean water for use. He operates a bicycle transportation business whereby he carries customers from one place to another to earn an income. He hopes that in the future he will be able to build a permanent house. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Tasleem

texts.en:
Tasleem is a 38-year-old hardworking and diligent woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband and three sons. 

Her husband and all her sons are running a car decoration and accessories shop. This is the only source of income for her family. Currently they are facing many problems in business, as the current stock of car accessories is almost gone, and they have no funds to purchase more stock. 

Tasleem has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can continue his business and purchase a new variety of car accessories and decoration kits with items like car chargers, fog lights, seat covers, neon lights, etc. 

She is going to make arrangements for the marriage of her son, and for the expansion of their business, with the profit.

She is very hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for them, and she is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their help.

loans.use: To purchase car accessories for the family business.

loans.name: Pudak Sari Wangi Group

texts.en:
Ni Luh and all members of Pudak Sari Wangi are very grateful to MUK for having given them a new loan. Ni Luh is a housewife who is married with I Komang, and has 2 children. The older one is already married, but the other one is still in high school Class 2. Ni Luh been running the pigs business since she got married.

As a group leader of Pudak Sari Wangi, Ni Luh with 4 other members received a total of 7.5M Rupiahs (IDR) (each member of the group received 1.5M IDR) to develop pig farming. With funds provided her, Ni Luh will purchase 2 superior piglets and pig feed. Ni Luh hopes cooperation between the group and MUK will run continuously until they could have their own capital for breeding pigs.

loans.use: to purchase 2 superior piglets and feed.

loans.name: Salvador

texts.es: Salvador de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con su familia, el se dedica a la agricultura, a la siembra de maíz y frijol. Se ha dedicado a esta actividad durante varios años y es así como se gana el pan de cada día. Él es un hombre trabajador, responsable y muy conocido en la zona por su enorme corazón y amabilidad para con los demás. Debido a que ya es temporada de siembra tomo la decisión de comenzar a prepararse. Es por esa razón que ha decidido solicitar este nuevo crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de semillas, abonos, insecticidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno donde desea hacer la siembra que es el que muestra la fotografia ya que donde el reside los terrenos son muy pedregosos y muy rústicos,  Lo que más desea es que su cosecha sea abundante y mejor que las anteriores, ya que esta es la forma en que él consigue el sustento para su familia.  Confía en Dios que con su ayuda, su dedicación y empeño en el  trabajo lograra el sueño de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Salvador, 45, lives with his family in his own house.  He works in agriculture growing corn and beans.  He’s been in this occupation for several years and this is how he earns his daily bread.  He’s a hardworking, responsible man who is very well-known in the zone because of his big heart and his kindness towards others.

Because planting season has arrived he wants to invest in seeds, manure, insecticide, etc. and to improve the land where he wants to plant which is shown in the photo because it’s very rocky and rustic.  What he most wants is that his crop yield will be abundant and better than past ones because this is how he acquires his family’s sustenance.  He trusts in God that with your help, his dedication and effort at work he’ll reach his dream of improving his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds and supplies.

loans.name: Prudencia's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de trois personnes réunit des voisines de quartiers qui ont décidé de se réunir pour solliciter un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

La représentante du groupe, Prudencia (celle qui a la main levée au milieu de la photo)est âgée de 38 ans, mariée, et a eu 2 enfants avec son mari Maxime, qui est cuisinier.
Leurs enfants sont scolarisés et vivent avec eux.
Pour aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes, Prudencia va s'approvisionner en tissus dans un marché de sa localité depuis maintenant 6 ans pour les revendre à son domicile.

Elle contracte aujourd'hui ce crédit dans le but de développer son activité.
texts.en:
This group comprises three women from the same neighborhood who have decided to come together to request their first loan from ALIDé.

Prudencia, the group's representative, is 38 years old.  She is married, and she has had two children with her husband, Maxime, who works as a cook.  In the photo, Prudencia is the woman raising her hand in the middle of the group.

Prudencia's children are in school and live with their parents.

In order to help her husband to take care of the day-to-day expenses, Prudencia has been buying fabrics at a local market for the past six years.  She then resells her merchandise from home.

She is now taking this loan in order to develop her activity.

loans.use: to buy some "pagnes" (colorful West African fabrics) and resell them from home.

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Beginning in New York as a part-time job, Lawrence brought his chauffer business to Austin, Texas.

Offering personalized service, Lawrence visits business personnel, such as hotel managers, to market himself. From there, he is able to take clients to and from airports, hotels and shopping centers in and around Austin. 

Boulevard Chauffeur has been in business for four years. “I enjoy driving,” he says. “Every day is different.” The entrepreneur gene is in Lawrence’s blood, he says. “I enjoy being self-employed.”

Lawrence also says being a chauffeur is a profitable business. As Lawrence is the only employee of his business, he plans to hire one more employee soon. However, before he can hire anyone, he needs to expand his business.

To purchase a second vehicle, Lawrence went to Compass Bank for a loan, but was then referred to Accion Texas Inc. The 46-year-old father of three says the loan helped to take advantage of the opportunity to expand, without which, he would have had to pass.

loans.use: to purchase a second vehicle.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John began his start-up business, Pro 1 Stop less than six months ago.  The mechanic is trained to diagnose and service many vehicles from minor to major issues.  Before opening up his own business, John worked for other mechanic shops around the Little Rock area.  

One day, a friend, an Accion Texas Inc. employee referred John to Accion to inquire about applying for a small business loan.  John proceeded to submit his application and was approved for $5,450. The Accion loan allowed John to purchase new tools to service vehicles and reach his goal of opening up his own business.  John says: “Without the loan, it would have taken longer to reach my goal.”  Some of Pro 1’s services include oil changes, tune-ups and regular maintenance for most vehicles. 

The updated equipment and tools allowed John to service vehicles more efficiently and build a clientele to jump start his business.  He is the sole employee of the company and does not have plans to hire additional help at the moment, but plans to expand in the future.

loans.use: to purchase new tools.

loans.name: Peris

texts.en:
Peris is a Kiva borrower, age 47 years. She describes herself as social. She is married and has five children with ages between 7 and 13 years. She has taken a loan of KES 21,000 to buy a water tank that she will use to store water that will be sold to customers. They face the challenge of a lack of water in the community.

Peris keeps livestock and also works at farming to earn an income. She hopes that in future she will be able to educate her children. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of KES 20,000 was paid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water tank to store and sell water.

loans.name: Sandy Rosalia

texts.es:
Sandy es un joven de 23 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco, ciudad de clima cálido, paisajes turísticos hermosos, asimismo tiene una gastronomía variada y deliciosa. Sandy es una joven madre de una pequeña de 2 años y junto a su pareja trabajan cada día para poder brindarle una vida digna y sobre todo poder ofrecerle un mejor futuro. Sandy debido a los pocos recursos económicos solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar una carrera universitaria.

Día a día Sandy trabaja vendiendo comida  y bebidas gaseosas afuera de su vivienda, ella trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al día y puede atender hasta 30 clientes diariamente; Sandy cree que está saliendo adelante porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo tiene buena sazón.

Sandy está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar un toldo para poder colocarlo afuera de su vivienda y con ello brindarle mayor comodidad a sus clientes, asimismo comprara mesas, sillas y una congeladora, de esta manera podrá atender a sus clientes con mayor comodidad y poder mejorar sus ingresos, de esta manera seguirá luchando por hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia y tener un gran restaurante”.
texts.en:
Sandy is a 23-year-old woman who lives in the city of Pisco. Pisco has a very warm climate, and beautiful, touristic landscapes as well as a variety of delicious foods. Sandy is the young mother of a 2-year-old daughter and together with her husband, she works every day to be able to provide her with a dignified life and a better future.

Due to a lack of economic resources, Sandy was only able to study through her senior year in high school, though she would have like to continue studying at a university. Each day, Sandy works selling food and soft drinks from her home. She works about nine hours a day and serves up to 30 customers daily. Sandy believes that she is getting ahead because she is very kind to her customers and, above all, she is a very good cook.

Sandy is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to their support she has been able to buy an awning to put outside of her home and thus, offer her customers a more comfortable atmosphere. She will purchase tables, chairs, and a freezer. In this way, she will be able to better attend to her customers and increase her profits. Sandy will continue trying to turn her dream into a reality: "to own her own house and have a big restaurant."

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, an awning, a freezer, and other items.

loans.name: Rubidia

texts.es:
Rubidia, vive con su esposo de 50 años de edad y con su suegra de 82 años de edad, disfruta de dos hijos, los cuales tienen edades de 7 y 10 años, todos dependen del negocio. Ella posee una sastrería, el oficio lo realiza desde hace varios años atrás y elabora uniformes para niños de la escuela, lo desempeña todos los días.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar materia prima para llevar a cabo su trabajo, entre estos están: tela, botones, zippers, agujas, cono de hilos, entre otros; esta inversión le ayudara a obtener más clientela y elaborar uniformes de calidad.
Su sueño es brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Rubidia lives with her 50-year-old husband and her 82-year-old mother-in-law.  She enjoys her two children who are 7 and 10 years of age; all depend on her business.  She has a tailor shop, an occupation she’s been in for several years now; she manufactures uniforms for school children every day.

The loan she needs will make it possible for her to buy raw materials like fabric, buttons, zippers, needles, thread cones, etc. to carry out her work.  This investment will help her acquire more customers and to make quality uniforms.  Her dream is to provide her family with better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is a 34-year-old, hard-working housewife with four sons and three daughters; she is a resident of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. For the past five years, her husband has been driving a van which is the only source of income for his family. 

Shazia  has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to expand her husband's transportation business by buying a new van. They are saving money for this purpose, and with the addition of the loan, they would be able to buy this van.This will not only help expand their transportation business, but will also help increase their monthly income. 

She is very hopeful that the loan will be productive so that they can meet the basic necessities of their family, and provide an education for their children.

loans.use: To purchase a van for her husband's transportation business.

loans.name: Shumaila

texts.en:
Shumaila is a 29-year-old responsible housewife. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband, two daughters, and two sons. 

Her husband works in a wood shop; he has a very low salary. It is very difficult for them to manage the household expenses; they are facing many problems in life. 

Since 2010, Shumaila has been running a small general store to generate a second source of income for her family. She has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan to expand her business. She wants to buy a variety of goods like milk, sugar, rice, soap, detergents, creams, etc and introduce some new items in her general store to fulfill the demands of her customers.  She also wants to increase her savings. 

She would reinvest the profit in the general store, use a part of it to pay her household expenses, and use part on the education of her children. 

She is very thankful to KIVA and BRAC Pakistan for their support. She is very hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for her.

loans.use: To purchase items for her general store.

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru:
Гулнора женщина среднего возраста. Родилась и выросла в городе Исфаре. Замужем и имеет двоих детей. Занимается продажей женской одежды, на местном рынке. После окончания школы, она поступила в местный педагогический колледж,и сразу после окончания начала работать в детском саду своего города. Тогда ее дети были маленькие и заработной платы хватало, но теперь ее дети выросли и расходов стало больше. Гулнора решила заняться своим бизнесом. Она стала торговать женской одеждой. Сначала она была продавщицей постепенно когда научилась,стала сама привозить товар. С 2010 года Гулнора сотрудничает с организацией Арванд. Благодаря Арванду она самостоятельно открыла точку и намного расширила свой бизнес.
 На данный момент Гулнора планирует закупить новый ассортимент товара женской одежды и снова с надеждой обратилась в Арванд. Гулнора очень признательна этой организации и заранее благодарит.
texts.en:
Gulnora is a middle-aged woman. She born and raised in the city of Isfara in Tajikistan. She's married, has two children, and makes a living by selling women's clothing on the local market. 

After finishing school, Gulnora attended a local college studying to become a teacher. Upon graduation, she started working in a local kindergarten. During that time, her children were small, and Gulnora's income was sufficient to support them. However, her children have grown now and, therefore, so have the expenses. Gulnora decided to supplement her income by becoming a saleswoman and selling women's clothing on the market. She gradually learned the nuances of the trade and then started importing the products herself. 

Gulnora has worked with Arvand since 2010. Thanks to the latter's assistance, she was able to open and later expand her own salespoint. Currently, Gulnora is planning to purchase an assortment of products and has turned to Arvand for help. She's very grateful and thanks you in advance.

loans.use: to buy women's clothing

loans.name: Juan De Jesus

texts.es: Juan de 48 años de edad,  desde hace varios años se dedica a cultivar la tierra.  Con mucha dedicación cultiva maíz y frijol, lo cual le permite llevar el  pan de cada día a su hogar. Se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador, honrado y responsable. Habita junto a su  grupo familiar el cual está conformado por su esposa y sus seis hijos.  Junto a su esposa trabajan muy duro para sacar adelante a su familia y darles mejores condiciones a las que ellos han tenido. Gracias a los conocimientos en la agricultura es como logra llevar el sustento a su hogar, que es su principal fuente de ingresos, dado que es la única forma que conoce para ganarse la vida honradamente.  Con muchos deseos de superación se acerco a esta institución para solicitar crédito ya que la temporada para la siembra comenzó y es necesario iniciar la siembra lo antes posible. Esta es la razón por la cual solicita el crédito ya que necesita invertir en la compra de los insumos agrícolas necesarios como: semillas, abonos, insecticidas, fertilizantes, herbicidas,  etc. para la siembra. Confía en Dios y en su trabajo que de esta forma logrará  tener una cosecha abundante la cual le permitirá acceder a una mejor calidad de vida para él y su familia.
texts.en:
Juan, 48, has worked cultivating the land for many years.  With much dedication he grows corn and beans that allows him to provide daily bread at home.  He’s noted for being a hardworking, honest and responsible man.  He lives with his family group consisting of his wife and six children.  He and his wife work hard to move their family forward and to provide them with better conditions than they have had.  Thanks to his agricultural knowledge he’s able to provide sustenance for his home for it’s his main source of income and the only way he knows of earning an honest livelihood.

With a strong desire for self-improvement, he approached this institution to request a loan since the planting season has started and it’s necessary to start planting as soon as possible.  This is the reason why he’s asking for a loan because he needs to buy agricultural supplies like seeds, manure, insecticide, fertilizer, herbicide, etc. for the crops.  He trusts in God and in his work; that in this way he will obtain an abundant harvest that will allow him to access better quality of life for him and his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta vive con su compañero de vida en casa propia y aun no tiene hijos,  es muy conocida en la zona donde reside por su humildad y su entrega al trabajo, nunca se ha dejado vencer y siempre ha salido adelante con sus dificultades. Con esfuerzo y dedicación posee una tienda en la que vende productos de primera necesidad granos básicos, leche, huevos, arroz entre otros, es muy dedicada a su labor y muy servicial a la hora de vender, es por eso que posee clientes que la buscan y la prefieren por sus productos. Se ha visto en la necesidad de surtir un poco mas la tienda debido al aumento de demanda y no tiene el capital para realizarlo, es por eso que la clienta solicita un crédito para comprar más productos como granos básicos producto instantáneo, golosinas, bebidas, etc. Confía en Dios de que pronto la ayuda solicitada, será otorgada, y no tendrá más preocupación para llevar el sustento diario a su hogar.
texts.en:
This client lives with her life companion in her own house; they don’t have children yet.  She’s very well-known in the zone where she lives because of her humility and dedication to work.  She’s never let herself be defeated and has always overcome her difficulties.  

With effort and dedication she has a store where she sells basic staples like basic grains, milk, eggs and rice, among others.   She’s very dedicated to her work and very service oriented when sells which is why she has many customers that seek her out and prefer her for her products.  

She needs to stock the store a little better because of increased demand but does not have capital to do so which is why she’s asking for a loan to buy more products like basic grains, instant products, snacks, beverages, etc.  She trusts in God that the requested help will be granted soon so she won’t have any more worries about providing daily sustenance for her home.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Françoise's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de trois femmes est composées de voisines de quartier qui sollicitent aujourd'hui leur premier crédit auprès d'ALIDé.

La représentante du groupe, Françoise (la main levée au milieu de la photo) est âgée de 51 ans. 
Françoise est mariée et à deux enfants qui sont tous scolarisés et à leurs charges. 

Françoise n’a pas fréquenté l’école mais elle a appris la couture qu'elle exerce depuis près de 10 ans.
Elle demande aujourd'hui un prêt afin de développer son activité de couture à domicile. Pour ce faire, elle ira s'approvisionner au marché de sa localité afin d'acheter des tissus.

En parallèle, elle développe une activité de vente de pagnes et de boissons pour répondre à la demande de sa clientèle de quartier.
texts.en:
This group consists of three women who are neighbors. They are seeking their first loan from ALIDé.

Françoise, age 51, is the group’s representative. She is the one with her hand raised in the photo. She is the married mother of two dependent children who go to school. Françoise never attended school, but she learned to sew, and she has been practicing this activity for nearly 10 years.

She is seeking a loan to help her expand the sewing shop she runs from her home. She will use the funds to stock up on supplies at the local market, where she will buy fabrics.

As a secondary activity, she also sells pagnes and beverages to the locals.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for her sewing activity.

loans.name: Andresa

texts.en: Andresa is a vegetable and fruit vendor from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She is a married woman and has had a retail business for more than 20 years now. This is the source of her income. Her husband works as a carpenter. Andresa is asking for a loan to buy more vegetables and fruits to sell. With this, she will be able to improve her stock as well as her income. In the future, Andresa dreams of expanding her store and making it a success.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and fruits to sell

loans.name: Mazrom

texts.en: Mazrom is a 54-year-old hardworking housewife. Her husband has been running a snooker club for 12 years. This club is located in the main market of the city and has been running very successfully. Due to the increasing number of customers, her husband wants to purchase one more snooker table. Mazrom has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a snooker table for her husband's business in order to help him expand the business. This will help them to increase their monthly income and their savings. Mazrom will save the profit for the marriage of her daughter.

loans.use: To purchase a snooker table

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en: Marlyn is a married woman from Trinidad, Bohol and the mother of two children. She has been engaged in the farming business for more than six years now. This is the source of her income. Marlyn is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve her farm as well as her harvest. Marlyn dreams of expanding her farm so that it will generate more income, which is necessary for the needs of the family, such as food and educational expenses for the children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a Kiva borrower who describes herself as focused and determined. She has taken a loan of KES 20,000 to buy a water tank in order to store clean water. Five members of her family will benefit directly from the tank. She operates a wholesale trade shop to earn an income. She faces a challenge of competition from other wholesalers in this business. She hopes that in the future she will attain economic growth. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a Kiva borrower who describes herself as focused and optimistic. She sells milk to earn an income, and she faces a challenge of competition from other sellers in this business.

She has taken a loan of Kes 20,000 to buy a water dispenser that will benefit seven members of her family. They will be able to access clean, safe drinking water.

Sarah hopes that in the future she will obtain financial freedom. This is her fourth loan with SMEP DTM; her previous loans were paid successfully.

loans.use: buy a water dispenser for her family.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is a 32-year-old hardworking, diligent woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband, a daughter, and a son. 

Her husband is a government employee, but his income is insufficient to meet the household expenses. Both of her children are studying in government schools. 

Asia is an efficient beautician by profession. Since 2010, she has been operating her own beauty salon. Currently, the beauty stock of the salon is almost gone, so Asia wants to purchase cosmetic products to continue her business. She has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase beauty products like facial creams, lipsticks, scrubs, makeup kits, hair colors, and other products. She would also buy some new chairs for her salon. 

She will pay the installments on the loan, and school fees for her children with the profits. She dreams of living a happy, healthy, and peaceful life with her family. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their support.

loans.use: To purchase products for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Uzma

texts.en:
Uzma is a 38-year-old woman who is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband, six sons and two daughters. Her husband is a Diabetic patient and she always worries about his health. For 11 years her husband has been running a wood shop, which is the only source of income for their family. All of her sons are very hardworking and help their father in his business a lot.

Uzma  has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband in his business. Her husband would purchase a wood cutting machine and some wood material for his shop. As they have no other source of income, her husband will be able to continue his business with the help of this loan, and with the net profit he will open a new shop for his son. Uzma dreams for her children's bright future and prays for her husband's good health.
