She wants to say that BRAC is working very well in the field of micro-finance, and she is very thankful to BRAC and Kiva for helping her.

loans.use: To purchase a wood cutting machine.

loans.name: Nosheen

texts.en: Nosheen is a 28-year-old hardworking and diligent woman. Her husband is working as a spray painter in an auto mechanic workshop. Nosheen has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. With the loan her husband would buy some new spray paints and spray materials like a spray machine and chemicals, etc. His current stock is almost gone, and with the help of this loan Nosheen's husband can continue his work. This is the only source of income for their family so this loan is very important for them. Nosheen is very thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a spray machine and chemicals, etc.

loans.name: Taj

texts.en: A loan of 20,000 PKR would help Taj to get a new sewing machine for her daughter so that she can help her in her work. Taj has been doing this tailoring work for 15 years and she has excellent tailoring skills. Now, with the help of her daughter, she will be able to stitch more dresses, resulting in an increase in her monthly income.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente vive en casa de un familiar con su esposa y su hija de 1 año de edad,  Él se dedica al cultivo de maiz y frijol desde hace algunos años. De esta forma es como se gana la vida y puede llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar. La actividad del cultivo la realiza año con año, y es la única forma que conoce de como ganarse la vida. Es un hombre muy trabajador, honrado y responsable. A pesar de las condiciones en las que vive, las cuales son muy humildes no se cansa de trabajar y de dar lo mejor a su familia. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito para comprar los principales insumos agrícolas: abonos, venenos para plagas, semillas, fertilizantes, etc.  Espera tener resultados favorables ya que no cuenta con otra fuente de ingresos. Confía en Dios que logrará obtener una cosecha abundante la cual le permitirá seguir llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar.
texts.en:
This client lives in a relative’s house with his wife and one-year-old daughter.  He has worked growing corn and beans for some years now.  He earns his livelihood this way and is able to provide daily bread for his home.  He does this activity year to year since it’s the only way he knows of earning his livelihood.  He’s a very hardworking, honest, responsible man. 

 Despite the conditions he lives in which are very humble he does not tire of working and giving his family the best.  He’s decided to request a loan to buy the main agricultural supplies: manure, pest poison, seeds, fertilizer, etc.   

He hopes to obtain favorable results because he has no other source of income.  He trusts in God that he’ll obtain an abundant harvest that will make it possible for him to continue providing daily bread for his home.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Anyar Sari 1 Group

texts.en:
The success of a group of pigs can be seen if some members don't have to borrow again and continue the business with their own capital. Like in the Anyar Sari 1 group--two members resigned from membership of the group because they have managed to develop their pigs business and have enough capital to continue this effort.

Ni Wayan will use the loan to buy four super quality piglets for fattening. The sow gives birth every four months and Ni Wayan hopes in the fifth and sixth months she could sell her pigs. She hopes she can be independent and continue the business with her own capital.

loans.use: to buy four super quality piglets

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria runs a variety store in San Miguel, Bohol. She sells various goods to the people in her neighborhood. For more than 17 years, Maria and her husband have also been engaged in a farming business. Maria is asking for a loan to buy more items to sell in her store like canned goods, candies, and noodles, as well as fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. Through this, she will be able to improve her ventures and augment her income.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like canned goods, candies, and noodles, as well as fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Erlina

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Erlina works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming and selling vegetables. 

Erlina is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase items such us sugar, milk, soap, shampoo, canned goods, eggs, etc. to sell in her general store business.

Erlina has sustained her business activities with her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items such us sugar, milk, soap, shampoo, canned goods, eggs, etc. to sell

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 41 years old, married, and has four children. She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Marilyn has been pig fattening for 10 years and also earns additional income from selling vegetables.

Marilyn is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She works tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
Gilda is 55 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Gilda is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Gilda has been farming rice for 11 years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business farming rice and raising pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Ruom

texts.en: Ruom, in her early 50s, is a resident from the Moung Russey district of Battambang province where rice farming is the popular business in the area. She has five children, two of whom are students in the local school. Her main source of income is from three hectares each of rainy season and dry season paddy crop. The 20 years' engagement in her current business has returned her about 32,000 KHR per day. Never before a member of VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), Ruom is taking her first loan of 3,000,000 KHR in order to pay for plowing fees and to buy potash and rice seed. She hopes that she can grow her crops fruitfully and make a good yield to relieve her family’s financial burden.

loans.use: to pay plowing fees and to buy potash and rice seed

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en: Shehnaz is a 35-year-old married woman who lives with her husband and daughter in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her biggest dream in life is to marry her daughter into a good and respectable family. For eight years, Shehnaz's husband has been driving a taxi, which is the only source of income for his family. But for the last 20 days he has not been able to generate any income, as his taxi stopped working and needs to be repaired. Shehnaz has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to repair her husband's taxi so that he can continue his work. This will not only improve the taxi's condition, but will help in improving the family's income as well.

loans.use: To repair her husband's taxi

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en:
Shakeela is very happy with her Kiva loan because she is now able to buy materials to make her artisan crafts. She sold her craft work, satisfying her customers' needs. Now Shakeela is dedicating all her attention to her son and business because she is no longer working for another business. She is happy about this because she is able to give other unemployed people the opportunity to earn an income. 

Shakeela sends the following message to Kiva lenders: "Thank you for the loan. It has benefited my family and me greatly." Shakeela is currently applying for a Kiva loan that she will use to buy artisan materials like stones, quartz, glass, beads, needles, lace, clothes wire, small pieces of wood, glue, and paint.

loans.use: To purchase embroidery materials

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is 36 years old. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her family. She is a mother of five children and she is a responsible and hardworking housewife. Her husband owns a furniture shop in the market. This shop is the base of earning for the family. He works very hard to meet the household's expenses, but due to an insufficient income he is facing problems meeting the needs of his family. 

Shazia has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, her husband will purchase a variety of furniture to sell. By doing so, he will increase his net income and savings for the future. Shazia is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for her husband's business. She wants to purchase a computer for her children with the profits. Shazia wishes to provide computer education to her children in the future. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase furniture to sell.

loans.name: Elmaddin

texts.en:
Elmaddin is 31 years old, married, and has a son. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) from Fizuli city. Now Elmaddin lives in the Fizuli region with his family. His wife stays at home, so he is the only one earning an income. His son goes to school and he is 15 years old. Elmaddin wants his son to become a sportsman. 

Elmaddin started his business five years ago to grow and resell calves. Now he needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy more calves. He wants to use the money for the future of his child. In the future, Elmaddin wants to have a big farm for sheep and calves. This will be more profitable for his business. Elmaddin is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting him.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth tiene 22 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Imperial, ciudad de clima variado y en el cual se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de maíz, manzana, entre otros. Elizabeth es madre de una pequeña de 2 años de edad, al cual quiere muchísimo y cada día se esfuerza para poder sacarla adelante.  Elizabeth es una joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es por ello que luego de mucho esfuerzo y ahorro logro iniciar su negocio de venta de ropa de niños, ella labora alrededor de 9 horas al día, ya que con el fruto de su trabajo puede solventar los gastos de su hogar con mucho esfuerzo; Elizabeth cree que está saliendo adelante porque es muy amable con los clientes y siempre ofrece productos de buena calidad a precios bajos.

Elizabeth esta muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mas ropa para niños pero de estación de invierno, como chompitas, casacas, pantalones, buzos, entre otros; así ella podrá mejorar sus ingresos y poder tener mayor variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes, lo que le permitirá seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una profesión a su hijo y poder tener un local propio para su negocio”.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, 22, lives in the city of Imperial, a city of varied climate where agriculture abounds especially growing corn and apples, among others.  Elizabeth is the mother of a little two-year old girl who she loves very much and for whom she strives daily to be able to move her forward.  Elizabeth is a young woman who very much wants to get ahead.  This is why after much effort and saving she managed to start her own business selling children’s clothes.  She works about 9 hours daily because she’s able with much effort to cover some of her household expenses with the fruits of her labor.  Elizabeth believes that she’s getting ahead because she’s very gracious to customers and always offers good quality products at low price.

Elizabeth is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given her she will be able to buy children’s winter clothes like little sweaters, jackets, pants and sweatshirts, among others.  She will thus be able to improve her income and have a wider selection of products on hand to offer her customers and she will be able to continue striving to reach her greatest dream: to provide her child with a profession and in future to have a space of her own for her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 50 years old and married with six children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Julieta has been raising pigs for three years and also earns additional income from farming rice.

Julieta is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feed for her pigs. She works tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money for business expansion.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for her pigs

loans.name: Nisa

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Nisa works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell vegetable business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Nisa is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional vegetables to sell in her business.

Nisa has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a food-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

Margarita has been in this business for six years. She earns additional income from a general store.

Margarita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Neneth

texts.en:
Neneth is 32 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school.

Neneth works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy sugar, soap, shampoo, and other groceries to sell.

Neneth has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from selling vegetables.

Neneth aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap, shampoo, and other groceries to sell

loans.name: Liaqat

texts.en:
Liaqat is a 38-year-old hard \-working and independent woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She has no children and is currently living with her husband in a rented house. Her husband is jobless and she is the only income-earning person in the family. Liaqat works in a dental clinic but she wants to start her own pharmacy. 

Liaqat has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to open a new medical store and to purchase a variety of medicines for that store. She hopes and prays that her husband gets a job soon. She is very thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: To open a pharmacy

loans.name: Edlyn

texts.en:
Edlyn is 32 years old and married, with three children. With two children currently in school, Edlyn works very hard to provide for them.

Edlyn runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 22,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional goods, like shampoo, coffee, sugar, bath soap, and cooking oil, to sell in her general store.

Edlyn has been in this business for eight years and she sells a variety of items, such as shampoo, coffee, sugar, bath soap, and cooking oil. 

In the future, Edlyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods, like shampoo, coffee, sugar, bath soap, and cooking oil, to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Olguita

texts.es:
Olguita tiene 28 años de edad, es madre de un hijo de 6 años de edad, el cual es muy travieso y a quien Olguita quiere muchísimo, sobre todo porque se ha convertido en el regalo mas importante que Dios le ha dado y por el cual es capaz de dar la vida para poder hacerlo feliz.
 
Olguita cada día se levanta muy temprano para trabajar, ella se dedica a  brindar servicio de costura y confección de prendas, ella labora alrededor de 9 horas al día y con los ingresos de su negocio solventa los gastos de su hogar con mucho esfuerzo; Olguita cree que está saliendo adelante porque es muy amable con los clientes y siempre ofrece un buen servicio.

Olguita esta muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias al apoyo que le han  brindado ella podrá comprar una máquina de coser ya que su máquina actual está en malas condicione sy puede realizar su trabajo a tiempo, de esta manera podrá atender a sus clientes con mayor prontitud y podrá mejorar sus ingresos, lo que le permitirá seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener un taller de costura y poder brindarle una carrera universitaria a su hijo”.
texts.en:
Olguita, 28, is the mother of a six-year-old son who is very mischievous and who Olguita loves very much above all because he’s become the most important gift God has given her and for whom she’s capable of giving her life to make him happy.  Olguita rises very early to start work.  She provides sewing services and makes clothes.  She works about 9 hours daily and is able to cover her household expenses with the income she earns with much effort.  Olguita believes she’s getting ahead because she’s very kind to customers and always provides good service.

Olguita is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support they’ve given her she will be able to buy a sewing machine since her current machine is in bad shape and she will be able to do her work on time and take care of more customers more quickly which will lead to improved income so she can continue to strive to make her greatest dream reality: to have a sewing workshop and to provide her son with a university career.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Magaly Janeth

texts.es:
Magaly tiene 24 años de edad, y es madre de un pequeño de 5 años de edad, el cual es su adoración y su motor para poder seguir esforzándose cada día por salir adelante y sobre todo ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades de las que ella tuvo, ya que debido a sus pocos recursos económicos ella solo pudo estudiar hasta el 2 grado de educación secundaria.

Luego de ahorrar y sobre todo de mucho esfuerzo Magaly logro indicar su negocio de venta de frutas, principalmente el plátano, así con el fruto de sus humilde trabajo puede solventar con mucho esfuerzo los gastos de su hogar, Magaly trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al día y puede atender hasta 20 clientes en el dia, Magaly cree que está saliendo adelante porque se esfuerza mucho y sobre todo porque es muy responsable.

Magaly esta muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias al gran apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mas mercadería para su negocio especialmente plátano y papaya al por mayor, de esta manera tendrá mayor variedad de productos y mejorar sus ingresos, lo que le permitirás seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:” Darle una carrera universitaria a su hijo y poder tener un minimarket”.
texts.en:
Magaly, 24, is the mother of a little five-year-old who is her adoration and motivation to continue striving to get ahead and above all to offer him better quality of life and better opportunities than she had because due to her limited economic resources she was only able to complete second grade of secondary school.

After saving and above all with much effort, Magaly was able to start her business selling fruit, mainly bananas, so that with the fruits of her humble labor she’s able with much effort to cover her household expenses.  Magaly works around 9 hours daily and can see up to 20 customers per day.  Magaly believes she’s getting ahead because she tries very hard and above all because she’s very responsible.

Magaly is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the great support they have given her she will be able to buy more merchandise especially bananas and papayas at wholesale in order to have greater variety of products and to improve her income which will allow her to continue striving to make her greatest dream reality: to provide university career for her son and to own a minimarket.

loans.use: to buy fruit like bananas at wholesale.

loans.name: Phally

texts.en: Phally, a 36-year-old mother of one, is a crop grower from Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham. Her one hectare growing a rice crop and half hectare growing cassava are the main income source of her family, to tackle their financial burden. During her spare time, she works for others for a fee for extra income. Phally is in her third cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and has repaid her past loan with success. It has enabled her to relieve the difficulty in her family at a good pace. Now, she is seeking a new loan in order to buy fertilizer for her farmland and grow more cassava. She believes that she can make more income from her crop husbandry to better her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland and grow more cassava

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Nimfa works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from fish vending and raising pigs. Nimfa is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks like soap, chips, shampoo, etc. to sell in her general store business.

Nimfa has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks like soap, chips, shampoo, etc., to sell

loans.name: Dulcesima

texts.en: Dulcesima works hard to support her family. She is married and has a sewing business in the Philippines, which she has had for 47 years now. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials like fabric, threads, zippers, etc. for her business. In the future, Dulcesima would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like fabric, threads, zippers, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Zalvie

texts.en: Zalvie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has had a fish vending business in the Philippines for 5 years. She earns more income from her general store. She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell in her fish vending business. Zalvie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 57 years old, married, and has two children. She is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 33 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Thy

texts.en: A mother of six children from Kampong Cham province, Thy is 46 years old and one of the breadwinners in the family. Her two hectares of rice farming and one and a half hectares of cassava cropping, the business which she has had for 20 years, earns her about 23,500 KHR per day to overcome the need in her family. Thy, who has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before, is seeking the first loan of 2,000,0000 KHR in order to buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing fees. She hopes that her cassava will grow fruitfully so she can make more profits to buy additional farmland.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing fees

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta vive en casa de un familiar con sus hijos y su compañero de vida quien le ayuda en el negocio, desde hace 3 años tomo la decisión de poner un puesto de venta de ropa interior para damas y caballeros, carteras, peluches, etc. en el mercado que esta cerca de su lugar de residencia, le ha ido muy bien ya que tiene  mucha clientela fija que la busca por sus buenos productos y a precios muy accesibles, también por su buena amabilidad a la hora de vender, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos en su hogar, la clienta esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar mas mercadería por mayor y poder seguir con su negocio ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y asi poderle dar a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
The client lives in a family member’s house with her children and her life partner, who helps her with the business.  Three years ago she made the decision to set up a stand selling men’s and women’s underwear, purses, and stuffed animals, etc.  She sells at the market that is close to where she lives.  It has gone very well for her because she has a lot of fixed clientele who seek her out for her good products, affordable prices, and her kind way of making a sale.  With the earnings that she gets, she manages to pay some of her household expenses.

The client is requesting a loan in order to be able to buy more merchandise wholesale.  She will also use the loan to be able to continue with her business because it is her only source of work.  This way she will be able to give her family better financial stability.

loans.use: to buy more clothes wholesale.

loans.name: Santos Wenceslao

texts.es: Don Santos es un hombre  muy trabajador y responsable quien vive en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y su nieto. Don santos  se dedica a la pesca artesanal se ha dedicado prácticamente toda su vida a esta actividad, la cual incluso ahora le permite salir adelante. Son santos solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para invertir en la compra de más trasmayos (redes) para pescar asi como muestra la fotografia, también anzuelos y otros instrumentos necesarios para realizar la pesca diariamente. Don santos  desea darles una mejor vida a sus nietos y compañera de vida en donde puedan contar con todo lo necesario.
texts.en:
Santos is a very hardworking and responsible man who lives in his own home with his life partner and their grandson. Santos works in artisan fishing and has been doing this practically for most of his life, which allows him to get ahead. 

Santos is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL, by which he can have the money to invest in the purchase of more fishing nets as shown in the photograph, as well as hooks and other tools needed for daily fishing. Santos wants to provide his grandchildren and life partner a better life where they can have everything they need.

loans.use: to purchase more fishing nets, as well as hooks and other tools.

loans.name: Heam's Group

texts.en:
Heam, a mother of two schoolchildren, is 39 years old and a farmer. She and the rest of her family live in Kampong Cham province’s Tbaung Khmum district, where cassava is the popular cash-crop in the area. Similar to her neighbor, she also grows cassava and rice for additional income. She earns about 22,000 KHR per day

Heam has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for 17 years. In a group of two, Heam is the leader and a second-cycle borrower, while her joint member is a third-time borrower. They are seeking the same loan amount from VisionFund, 1,2000,000 KHR each.  As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed. 

She hopes that she can grow her crops in a timely manner, and gain a better yield than last year.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Carlos Froilan

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 25 años de edad, vive en la calida ciudad de Pucallpa, ciudad de clima muy cálido, gastronomía variada y sobre todo sus pobladores son personas muy alegres y carismáticas.  Carlos es padre de un pequeño de 3 años de edad al cual quiere muchísimo y por quien daría la vida para poder darle una vida digna y sobre todo verlo feliz.

A pesar de sus pocos recursos económicos Carlos logro estudiar la carrera de Técnico en contabilidad y gracias a ello logro tener empleo en una pequeña institución de su ciudad, con el fruto de su trabajo solventa los gastos del hogar; el cree que esta saliendo adelante porque es muy responsable y sobre todo porque tiene la mayor inspiración para salir adelante, la cual es su hijo.

Carlos esta muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar mejoras en su vivienda ya que es de adobe y calima, asi podra mejorar la calida de vida de su hijo y seguir luchando y esforzándose para poder hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Carlos, 25, lives in the city of Pucallpa, a city with very hot climate and varied cuisine; above all its residents are very cheerful, charismatic people.  Carlos is the father of a little 3-year-old who he loves dearly and for whom he’d give his life to provide a good life for him and above all to make him happy.

Despite his limited economic resources, Carlos managed to study a technical Accounting career and thanks to that he managed to get a job in a small institution in his city.  With the fruit of his labor he’s able to cover household expenses.  He believes he’s getting ahead because he’s very responsible and above all because he has a great inspiration to get ahead: his son.

Carlos is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support they’ve given him he will be able to do some home improvements since his house is made of adobe and chalk and he will be able to improve his son’s quality of life and continue to strive to make his greatest dream reality: to have a house of his own.

loans.use: to make some home improvements.

loans.name: Youkou 2 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Youkou 2 fait partie de la coopérative Coopagui et est située à Guiroutou, un petit village au sud-ouest de la Côte d’Ivoire dans la région de San Pedro. Le groupe est composé de 14 personnes. 
Cédric a 24 ans et est un jeune producteur de cacao. Cela fait 2 ans qu’il fait partie de la coopérative Coopagui et il a 3 hectares de cacao certifiés UTZ et Rain Forest Alliance, ce qui veut dire qu’il respecte les principes et les normes de l’agriculture durable. 

Grace au crédit, il va pouvoir acheter des produits phytosanitaires pour sa plantation. Ces produits vont lui permettre d’augmenter sa production et ainsi d’accroître ses revenus. 

Avec l’argent supplémentaire, il va se faire construire une maison.
texts.en:
The group Youkou 2 is part of the Coopagui cooperative. It is located in Guiroutou, a small village in the southwest of Ivory Coast, in the region of San Pedro. The group has 14 members.

Cédric, age 24, is a young cacao farmer. He has been with Coopagui for two years, and his three hectares of cacao farmland are certified by UTZ and by the Rainforest Alliance, which means that he adheres to the principles and regulations of sustainable agriculture.

He plans to use this loan to buy pesticides for his cacao plantation. This will allow him to increase production and to bolster his income. 

He wants to use the additional revenue to build a new house.

loans.use: to buy pesticides for his cacao plantation.

loans.name: Kongossigue Dit Yacouba

texts.fr:
Natif du cercle de Bla, Région de Ségou, Monsieur Kongossigue est âgé de 37 ans et père de 4 enfants. Il vit dans une famille polygame avec ses 2 femmes et ses enfants dans le quartier Hérémakono Nord de Bougouni. 
N’ayant pas fréquenté le système scolaire, il ne faisait que l’agriculture auprès de son père au village. Quelques années plus tard il décida  de quitter le village pour Bougouni afin d’apprendre le commerce notamment la vente des articles divers  de boutique, auprès de son oncle.  Avec 4 années d’expérience, il maitrise bien cette activité. Ayant fait la connaissance de Soro Yiriwaso à travers un agent de l’institution, il décida d’intégrer le programme crédit avec qui il est à son quatrième prêt, après avoir correctement remboursés les trois précédents.
Il compte acheter avec ce nouveau prêt, 5 sacs du sucre, 10 cartons de thé, 8 cartons de cigarettes et 9 cartons de savons. Sa boutique est située à Niebala un des quartiers de Bougouni. Il s’approvisionne à Bamako capitale de la république du Mali et parfois à Bougouni. Sa clientèle est composée de la population locale. Avec ce prêt, Monsieur Kongossigue compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 85 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts du prêts, assurer les dépenses de sa famille et à agrandir sa boutique.
texts.en:
A native of Cercle de Bla, Région de Ségou, Mr.  Kongossigue is 37 years old and a father of four. He lives in a polygamous family with his two wives and his children in the Hérémakono Nord district of Bougouni. Not having attended school, he used to be a farmer with his father in the village. A few years later, he decided to leave the village for Bougouni to learn about commerce from his uncle, especially about selling various shop goods, With four years of experience, he has a mastery of this business. 

Familiar with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso through one of its representatives, he decided to join the loan program and is now on his fourth loan. He has correctly repaid the three previous ones.

With this new loan, he intends to purchase 5 sacks of sugar, 10 boxes of tea, 8 boxes of cigarettes, and 9 boxes of soap. His store is located in Niebala, a district in Bougouni. He gets his supplies from Bamako, capital of the Republic of Mali. His customer base is composed of the local people. 

With this loan, Mr. Kongossigue plans on making a monthly profit of 85,000 francs CFA that will be used to pay the loan interest, to ensure his family expenses are covered, and to expand his store.

loans.use: to purchase various goods, such as sugar, cigarettes, and tea, for his store

loans.name: Pha's Group

texts.en:
Pha is in her late 30s, and the widowed mother of three kids who are working for others for a fee. She lives in Kampong Cham province’s Tbaung Khmum district, where she does rice cropping. Her ten years of experience in her current business has earned her about 11,000 KHR per day. 

With this new loan, Pha will be a fourth-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of three members;  the other two fellow group members are third-cycle clients. The past loans have supported her business well. 

The total amount of her new group loan is 2,700,000 KHR. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion of 1,400,000 KHR to pay a plowing fee. 

She hopes she can improve the living conditions of her family in a great place.

loans.use: To pay a plowing fee.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en:
A rice grower on two hectares of farmland from Kampong Cham province, Pov is 35 years old and married. She has three dependent children to take care of, two of whom are in school and the remaining one is too young for schooling. The current business has generated her about 33,900 KHR per day. 

Pov and other three members in the same group of four female members are seeking their first loan of 1,000,000 KHR each from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). For Pov, who is the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farm. She hopes that she can make more income to enlarge her business better than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Srin's Group

texts.en:
Age 30 and a mother of one little kid, Srin is also an inhabitant from Kampong Cham province. She does rice farming on a one hectare area with the support from her husband. She is able to earn up to 31,200 KHR per day from the business that she has managed for 10 years. 

This is the first loan for Srin with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). It is also the same cycle of the other three borrowers in the same group. The total amount of her entire group loan is 4,000,000 KHR, of which 1,000,000 KHR is Srin’s loan portion. As the leader, she will spend her loan to buy fragrant rice seed and potash for her farmland. She hopes that she can increase her income and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fragrant rice seed and potash for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to service his mototaxi and install doors on it.

loans.name: Porfirio

texts.es:
Porfirio nació en la ciudad de Huancarani y tiene 35 años de edad, él es casado y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene siete hijos, él es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo entonces él tiene una ferretería en su domicilio donde vente diferentes productos como por ejemplo clavos, calaminas, alambres, pinturas y otras cosas más. 

En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como alambres, techos de metal, clavos y otras cosas más. 

Porfirio pertenece  al banco comunal “Mamacha Rosario” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Porfirio was born in the city of Huancarani and is 35 years old. He is married and this beautiful relationship has given him seven children. Porfirio is a hardworking and enterprising person who has been able to get his family ahead with much hard work. He has a hardware store in his home where he sells products such as nails, corrugated metal, wire, paint and more.

At this time, Porfirio is applying for a loan to buy more merchandise such as wire, metal roofing, nails, etc.

Porfirio is a member of the "Mamacha Rosario" communal bank, which is part of Asociación Arariwa. He is grateful for this opportunity and committed to complying with the repayment schedule.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise such as wire,  metal roofing, nails and more.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
Jose tiene 25 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Ica, la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, el desarrollo de su agricultura, en especial el cultivo de la uva, esparrago, entre otros.  Debido a los pocos recursos económicos Jose solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar una carrera universitaria.

Luego de mucho esfuerzo Jose logro inicar su negocio de instalación de puertas y ventanas de aluminio, trabajo con el cual puede solventar los gastos de su familia ya que el vive al lado de su esposa, quien lo apoya mucho en todo lo que el emprende y lo apoya en su negocio, Jose cree que esta saliendo adelante porque es muy responsable y sobre todo porque es my cumplido con los clientes.

Jose esta muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podra realizar mejoramientos en su vivienda, especialmente podra colocar un cerco para poder dar mas seguridad a su vivienda ya que hace algunos mese fue victima de un robo, asi podra seguir trabajando con mayor tranquilidad, ya que su familia estará mas segura, y podra seguir luchando para poder ahcer realidad su mas grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
José, 25, lives in the city of Ica which is noted for its hot, welcoming climate and for the development of agriculture especially growing grapes and asparagus, among others.  Because of his limited economic resources, José was only able to finish fifth grade of secondary school but he would have liked to have attended university.

After much effort José managed to start his own business installing aluminum doors and windows, work that makes it possible for him to cover his family expenses since he lives with his wife who supports everything he does and helps him with the business.  José believes he’s getting ahead because he’s very responsible and above all because he meets his customers’ expectations.

José is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given him he will be able to do some home improvements, especially to be able to install a fence to provide more security for his home since he was the victim of a burglary a few months ago. In this way he will be able to continue working with more tranquility because his family will be safer and he can continue striving to make his greatest dream reality: to own a house.

loans.use: to build a fence.

loans.name: Benita

texts.es:
Benita tiene 39 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de uva, algodón, entre otros. Benita es madre de 2 hijos de 8 y 11 años, a quienes quiere mucho  y por los cuales trabaja y se sacrifica para poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida y sobre todo que sean personas de bien y mucho mejor que ella, por ello junto a su esposo luchan por vencer las adversidades y seguir adelante.

Cada día Benita trabaja como obrera en un fundo agrícola, ella labora alrededor de 9 horas al día, y cree que está saliendo adelante porque es muy responsable y sobre todo muy cumplida con su trabajo.

Benita esta muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar materiales de construcción para hacer un cuarto de material noble (cemento, arena, ripio, entre otros) y poder mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos, así Benita poco a poco lograra ir construyendo su casa de material noble y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una profesión a su hijo y poder tener un negocio propio”.
texts.en:
Benita, 39, lives in the city of Ica, a city noted for its hot, welcoming weather as well as its agriculture especially cotton and grape growing, among others.  Benita is the mother of two children who are 8 and 11 years old who she loves very much and for whom she works and sacrifices to provide them with better quality of life above all so they will be upstanding citizens and much better than her; because of this she and her husband strive to overcome adversities and continue moving forward.

Benita works every day as a laborer on a large agricultural estate.  She works about 9 hours daily and believes she’s getting ahead because she’s very responsible and does her work well.

Benita is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given her she will be able to buy building supplies to build a room out of substantial materials (cement, sand, gravel, etc.) to be able to improve her children’s quality of life and Benita will thus gradually build her house with substantial materials and continue to strive to make her greatest dream reality: to provide her son with a profession and to be able to have a business of her own.

loans.use: to buy building supplies like cement and sand, among others.

loans.name: Sifa Mupya Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kitenge est vice présidente du groupe d’affaire « Sifa mupya », entrepreneur expérimentée, âgée de 45 ans, mariée et mère de 8 enfants qui étudient tous. Son conjoint est un chauffeur. La cliente est vendeuse des denrées alimentaires (farines de manioc, farines de maïs, etc.). Elle installe ses produits à son domicile. Elle commença cette affaire avec le prêt de l’IMF Hekima, il y environ 2 ans. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 1 sac de farine de Manioc, 1 sac de Maïs, etc. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son capital, scolariser ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit aux petits entrepreneurs.Il sied de signaler qu'une cliente porte son bébé.
texts.en:
This client, Kitenge, is the vice-president of the business group "Sifa mupya". An experienced entrepreneur, she is 45 years old, married, and the mother of eight children, all students. Her husband is a chauffeur. This client sells grocery items (cassava flour, cornmeal, etc.) She sets up her products at her home. She started this business with a loan from the microfinance institution Hekima about two years ago. 

This new loan will be used to purchase a sack of cassava flour, a sack of cornmeal, etc. Thus, she would like to increase her capital and provide schooling to her children. In conclusion, she thanks Hekima very much for its micro-credit support of small-scale entrepreneurs. It should be noted that one client in the photo is holding her baby.

loans.use: to purchase cassava flour, corn, etc.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Sophal's Group

texts.en:
Sophal, age 40 and married, is a local farmer who grows cucumbers as her main source of income. In business for 20 years, she is able to earn about 19,400 KHR per day.

The recipient of five previous loans, all repaid, that have supported her business and improved her living standards, Sophal, the leader of a group of two, is requesting a new loan from Kiva's Partner VisionFund. She will use her portion to buy good cucumber seeds for planting and hopes that she can make a good profit and sustain her living.

loans.use: To buy good cucumber seeds for planting

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 26-year-old man. He is married and has one child who lives in Sana`a, Yemen. 

Ali is a very happy, energetic man. He is a soldier who gets a low salary. He has saved up money, but does not have enough to buy furniture. 

He has decided to apply for a loan of YER 100,000 from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank (AMB) to buy furniture for his house. He hopes that he will be supported and lenders will help him to realize his plans.

loans.use: to buy furniture for his house.

loans.name: Phal

texts.en: Phal is 33 years old and also the mother of three schoolchildren, living in a village located in the Sampov Meas district of Pursat Province. She has a five-hectare area for growing paddy rice. This business, which she has been with for 10 years, earns her about 31,000 KHR. Phal is in a second-cycle loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid her past loan already and it has supported her business on time and increased her profit. Now, she is seeking a new loan of 2,000,000 KHR in order to plow her farmland and to buy one sack of fertilizer. She hopes that she can earn more income so that she can expand her business.

loans.use: To plow her farmland and to buy one sack of fertilizer

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en: A young single lady residing in the Kror Kor district of Pursat province, Pov is 25 years old and a farmer.  She grows rice and raises pigs as her main source of income. Currently, she is able to earn up to 18,000 KHR per day. Pov is a second-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her loan with success and it has improved her lifestyle better than before. Now, she leads a group of three to apply for a new loan. Pov, who is the group leader, will use her loan to buy potash for her farm. She hopes that she can make more income from her current business so that she can sustain her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy potash for her farm

loans.name: Guiroutou 2 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Guiroutou 2 fait partie de la coopérative Coopagui et est située à Guiroutou, un petit village au sud-ouest de la Côte d’Ivoire dans la région de San Pedro. Le groupe est composé de 14 personnes. 
Noufou a 56 ans. Il s’occupe de 6 personnes dans son foyer. Cela fait 7 ans qu’il fait partie de la coopérative Coopagui et il a 4 hectares de cacao certifiés UTZ et Rain Forest Alliance, ce qui veut dire qu’il respecte les principes et les normes de l’agriculture durable. 

Grace au crédit, il va pouvoir acheter des produits phytosanitaires pour sa plantation. Ces produits vont lui permettre d’augmenter sa production et ainsi d’accroître ses revenus. 

Avec l’argent supplémentaire, il va se faire construire une maison.
texts.en:
The group "Guiroutou 2" is part of the cooperative Coopagui and is located in Guiroutou, a small village in southwestern Cote d'Ivoire, in Région de San Pedro. The group is composed of fourteen persons.
 
Noufou is 56 years old. He takes care of six persons at home. He has been part of the cooperative Coopagui for seven years, and he has four hectares of cocoa having UTZ and Rain Forest certification, which means he respects the principles and standards of sustainable agriculture. 

Thanks to this loan, he is going to purchase some pesticides for his plantation. These products will enable him to augment his production and thus increase his income.  

With the additional money, he is going to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase pesticides for his cocoa plantation

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio es un joven de 22 años de edad vive en la ciudad de Pisco , la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo se caracteriza por poseer paisajes muy bonito los cuales son visitados por muchos turistas en todo el año. Julio es un joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante, por ello cada día se esfuerza mucho por progresar, sobre todo porque apoya a sus padres con los gastos del hogar, ya que no tienen muchos ingresos económicos.

Día a día Julio trabaja como operario en un fundo agrícola de la ciudad, el trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al día y el cree que esta saliendo adelante porque es muy responsable y porque se esfuerza por desempeñar bien su trabajo.

Julio está muy agradecida con el apoyo que le están brindado los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar materiales de construcción como cemento, fierro, arena, mayólicas, entre otros, de esta manera podrá realizar mejoras en la vivienda de sus padres y podrá mejorar su calidad de vida, así el podrá seguir esforzándose por hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Terminar de construir la vivienda de sus padres y poder estudiar una carrera universitaria”.
texts.en:
Julio is a young man of 22. He lives in the city of Pisco, which is known for its warm and inviting climate and its beautiful landscape, which attract many visitors year round. Julio is a young man with a real drive to get ahead. Each day he works hard to make progress, particularly because he helps support his parents with household expenses because they do not have a lot of income. 

Day to day, Julio is an agricultural worker on a farm in the city. He works around nine hours a day. He believes he will come out ahead because he is very responsible and strives to perform his work well. 

Julio is very grateful for the support that Kiva lenders are offering him, because thanks to the help they have given him, he will be able to buy construction materials like cement, metal, sand, tiles, among others. This way, he will be able to make improvements to his parents' home and give them a better quality of life, so he can continue to strive to realize his greatest dream: to finish the construction of his parents house and be able to study in a university.

loans.use: to buy materials like cement, metal, sand, tiles, among others.

loans.name: Vanny

texts.en:
Vanny, 61 and a widowed mother of five children, is resident from Sa Ang district of Kandal province. To struggle for daily food consumption she manages a vegetable garden, green mustard, and cucumber planting. For ages with this business she has been able to earn up to 37,200 KHR per day.

Vanny is new to VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is now taking a loan of 2,000,000 KHR in order to buy a good seeds to support her business. She hopes that she can make triple the income to sustain her living.

loans.use: to buy a good seeds to support her business.

loans.name: Yun's Group

texts.en:
Yun, 27 and married, is a rice farmer from the Kror Kor district of Pursat province; her husband works as a driver. She has been in her business for five years, earning around 38,000 KHR per day.

Yun's living conditions have improved as the result of her three previous loans, all since repaid, from Kiva's partner VisionFund. Now leading a group of two to request a new loan, she will use her portion to pay for a house builder. Yun hopes to renovate her house in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To pay for a house builder

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is a first time borrower of UGAFODE Microfinance Ltd applying for UGX 1,000,000. He is a married man with three children that he looks after using his carpentry business. For all the time he has worked, he has managed to buy land and now would like to build a small residential house using the loan applied for. He believes in incremental building since he does not have good business to service the loan.

Given the loan, he has hope of building a residential house slowly little by little and educating his children. He is excited about the fact that he will soon have a house of his own.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build a residential house

loans.name: Ram's Group

texts.en: Ram, a villager from Pursat province, is 47 years old and a married mother blessed with six children. Five of her kids are in school while the remaining one is too young for schooling. Her main sources of income are from paddy rice cultivation and selling handmade brown sugar. She is able to generate about 17,500 KHR per day from the business she has done for 19 years.  With this new loan, she is in her fourth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She can afford to send all of her kids to school from the successful past loans which she has fully repaid. Now she is in a group of three to apply for a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her crop. She highly believes that she can better her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her crop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: make improvements to her home.

loans.name: Lala Aicha

texts.fr:
Madame Lala Aicha est âgée de 44 ans et mère de 5 enfants. Elle vit avec son époux et ses enfants dans le quartier Hérémakono Centre de Bougouni. 
N’ayant pas fréquentée l’école moderne très vite elle commença à mener des activités génératrices de revenus. C’est ainsi qu’elle décida de suivre sa sœur pour apprendre les activités d’achat et de vente de condiments. Avec une expérience de plus de 5 ans, elle maitrise cette activité.   
Après 5 prêts  solidaires dans une association de femmes de son quartier,  elle décide de venir au prêt individuel dans lequel elle est à son 4 ème prêt et tous ses prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elle compte acheter avec son nouveau prêt, 15 épices de pagnes et 3 cartons de parfums. Elle s’approvisionne à Lomé et au Burkina Faso et effectue ses ventes à domicile et en ambulant,  en détail, au comptant à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle compte réaliser  avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 80.000 FCFA qui sera investi dans son activité, payer le prêt et assurer certaines dépenses de la famille tout en aidant son époux.
texts.en:
Ms. Lala Aicha is a 44-year-old mother of five. She lives with her husband and children in the Hérémakono Centre district of Bougouni. Not having attended school, she soon starting running revenue-generating businesses. That is how she decided to learn from her sister about buying and selling condiments. With over five years of experience, she has a mastery of this business. After five solidarity loans with a women's association in her district, she decided to take out an individual loan. She is now on her fourth one, and the previous ones were all correctly paid back. 

With her new loan, she intends to purchase 15 lengths of 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa) and 3 boxes of perfumes. She gets her supplies in Lomé and from Burkina Faso. Accepting cash from a customer base composed of men and women, she makes her sales retail out of her home and by going door to door. 

With this loan, she plans on making a monthly profit of 80,000 francs CFA that will be invested in her business, pay back the loan, and ensure certain family expenses are covered while helping out her husband.

loans.use: to purchase 'pagne' cloth and perfumes to sell

loans.name: Sorn's Group

texts.en:
A 52-year-old mother of seven children, Soan is the breadwinner in the family because she is a widow. She is able to earn about 25,000 KHR per day from her current business, grocery selling, which she has managed for 10 years. 

This is not the first loan for Soan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her previous loan already, and it enabled her to support her business in good time. Now, she forms a group of two, to apply for a new loan. She will spend her loan portion to buy more grocery items to resell at her store. She hopes that she can replenish her business inventory on time and get more customers, so she can earn more income to support herself and her family.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items to resell at her store

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase corrugated iron, Guayaquil cane, sticks among other materials.

loans.name: Saidahmad

texts.ru:
Сайдахмад является скотоводом и живет в горном районе Хамадони. Ему 58 лет. Он женат и отец троих детей. Его жена ведет домашнее хозяйство. Старшим дочерям Сайдахмада больше 18 лет и они занимаются земледелием на 3 га земли отца. Сыну 15 лет и он еще учится в школе. Сам Сайдахмад занимается животноводством. Он в течение 3 лет закупает, откармливает и перепродает крупно-рогатый скот. Он разводит телят и бычков на местном пастбище, где растет хорошая трава. Сайдахмад кроме этой деятельности, еще и работает на соляной горе и занимается там производством соли. Сайдахмад по натуре усердный человек и он никогда не отказывался от тяжелой, но честной работы, чтобы обеспечивать семью. 
В данный момент Сайдахмад нуждается в кредите для животноводческой деятельности - для увеличения поголовья продаваемого скота. На сумму кредита он намерен закупить телят и бычков для откорма и перепродажи.
texts.en: Saidahmad is a cattle breeding and lives in the mountainous district of Hamadoni.  He is 58 years old, married and a father of three children.  His wife takes care of the household.  Saidahmad's older daughters are over 18 years old and involved in farming on their father's three hectares of land.  His son is 15 years old, and he still goes to school.  Saidahmad is involved in animal husbandry.  He has been buying, fattening up and reselling cattle for three years.  He raises calves and bulls at a local pasture with good good grass.  Besides this business, Saidahmad also works at a salt mountain and is involved in salt production there.  Saidahmad is a diligent person and never refuses hard, but honest work in order to provide for his family.  At the present time, Saidahmad needs a loan for his animal husbandry business to increase the livestock headcount.  He intends to use this loan to buy calves and bulls for fattening up and reselling.

loans.use: to buy calves and bulls for fattening up and reselling

loans.name: Horn's Group

texts.en:
Horn is a rural villager from the Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province and also a mother of five children. Currently, two children are students, while the remaining three are paid workers in our neighbor country, Thailand. 

The ten years' engagement in Horn's current business has returned her about KHR 10,000 per day. Horn, a third-time borrower, forms a group with three other members, two first-cycle borrowers and one second-time borrower, to apply for a new loan with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner).  The past loans have impacted Horn positively, improving her lifestyle. 

She now leads a group of four to apply for a new loan. Horn, whose loan portion is KHR 1,000,000, is borrowing the same amount as her joint members. She will spend her loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes that she can multiply her income to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Om-Wajdan Group

texts.en:
This group, called Om-Wajdan, is comprised of four members, all of whom are female. They are from Aden, Yemen, and they know each other very well as they have lived in the same area for a long time. They have different businesses. They have requested a loan of 280,000 YER.

One group member, Khadija, is a 66-year-old, married woman. She has five children. She has been selling grocery products and getting a small daily income. She started her own business, which is her main source of income. Her business is not going well, due to the lack of money to stock her shelves. This is why she's requesting a loan of 80,000 YER from AMB, which she will use to purchase grocery products for her business. She hopes she can improve her family's financial stability with this investment, and enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase grocery products to resell to her customers

loans.name: Marat

texts.en:
Marat lives in Kapan, which is in Syunik region. Marat has three daughters. His two eldest daughters are school-aged. The smallest daughter is two years old, and his wife takes care of her.

Marat has his private business. He has a car, in which he transports people to different territories of Armenia. Marat also has a stall where he provides document copying services.  Several years ago, Marat had a different car, but it was worn out and inconvenient. With much hard working and purposefulness, Marat managed to buy a new car, modern and comfortable both for driving and for his passengers, as well.

Marat asks a loan of 800,000 Armenian drams. He will use the loan to buy wheels for his car, and a new copying machine. He is sure that Kiva lenders will help him to enlarge his businesses.

loans.use: To buy wheels for his car and a new copying machine

loans.name: Daler

texts.ru: Далер молодой жизнерадостный парень в возрасте 25 лет. Он женат и, несмотря на свои годы, уже имеет на иждивении троих детей. Далер со своей семьёй живёт в доме своих родителей в маленькой деревне. Ему приходится много работать, чтобы обеспечивать свою семью и своих родителей, так как он старший сын в семье. Чтобы иметь доход, он работает мастером в местной мастерской. Эта работа приносит ему постоянный доход. Жена Далера также помогает ему приносить доход в семью, она подрабатывает техничкой в местной школе. Её зарплата хотя и совсем маленькая, но является дополнительным доходом в семье. Также у Далера есть младший брат, который закончил школу, но поступить в университет у него пока не получилось, в связи с финансовыми проблемами. И сейчас он вместе со своим другом хочет поехать в Россию на заработки, чтобы заработать деньги и подготовиться к поступлению в университет. Поэтому Далер обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит, чтобы купить своему братишке авиабилет для поездки в Россию на заработки. Он надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Daler is a cheerful young man aged 25. He is married and already has three children despite his age. Daler and his family live with his parents in a small village. He has to work hard to provide for his family and for his parents, as he is their eldest son. He earns a steady income working as a craftsman in a local workshop. Daler's wife also helps earn money for the family by cleaning part-time at a local school. Her salary is quite small but provides additional income for the family. Daler has a younger brother who has graduated from high school, but he can't go to college because of financial problems. Now his brother wants to go to Russia with a friend to find work and prepare to apply for college, so Daler came to MDO Arvand and asked for a loan to buy his little brother a plane ticket. He hopes everything will turn out well and thanks MDO Arvand for their support.

loans.use: to buy his little brother a plane ticket to look for work in Russia.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente se dedica a la agricultura desde muy pequeño hace 10 años tomo la decisión con ayuda de su padre de cultivar maíz y frijol, es así como se gana el pan de cada día. Él es un hombre trabajador, responsable y muy conocido en la zona por su enorme corazón y amabilidad para con los demás vive en casa propia con su esposas y su hijo de 2 años de edad. Debido a que ya es temporada de siembra tomo la decisión de comenzar a prepararse. Es por esa razón que ha decidido solicitar este nuevo crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, insecticidas, etc. Lo que más desea es que su cosecha sea abundante y mejor que las anteriores, ya que esta es la forma en que él consigue el sustento para su familia.  Confía en Dios que con su ayuda, su dedicación y empeño en el  trabajo lograra el sueño de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
The client has made a living though agriculture since he was very young.  Ten years ago he made the decision with the help of his father to grow corn and beans, which is how he makes a living daily.  He is a hard-working and responsible man who is well-known in the area for his enormous heart and kindness for others.  He lives in his own house with his wife and two-year-old son.  

Since it is planting season he has made the decision to begin preparing.  It is for this reason that he has decided to ask INTEGRAL for a loan to invest in the purchase of seeds, compost, fertilizer, insecticide, etc.  What he most desires is for his harvest to be abundant and better than the previous harvests, since this is the way in which he continues to support his family.  He trusts in God that with his help, his own dedication, and determination to work, he will achieve his dream of improving his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, compost, fertilizer, insecticide, etc.

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
Davit is 24 years old, and he lives in the village of Vazashen, which is in Tavush region. Davit lives with his wife, small daughter (9 months old) and parents. His father is disabled and retired, and the only person that helps Davit around their farm is his mother. His mother also works both at the local school as a deputy director, and as an Armenian history teacher at the church.

Davit is engaged in farming, including keeping 15 piglets and 12 chickens, at present. The profits from farming have helped him very much, to cover the expenses of his marriage party and of buying furniture for their house. Davit manages swine breeding, and he wants to try his luck in beekeeping with the hope of increasing the family's income. That is why he asks a loan of 600,000 Armenian drams, which he will use to buy a lot of fodder for piglets and five beehives. This is Davit’s first deal with Kiva lenders, but his mother has already once taken a loan from Nor Horizon. His mother paid back her loan without any delays, so his mother is a perfect example for him of being responsible and punctual.

loans.use: To buy a lot of fodder for piglets, and five beehives

loans.name: La Source Group

texts.fr: La cliente Zefania est team leader du collectif d’affaire « La source», doyenne, entrepreneur expérimentée, âgée de 65 ans, veuve et mère de 4 enfants, tous ont respectivement leurs  foyers. Son conjoint fut décédé suite à une maladie cardiaque. La cliente est vendeuse des cannes à sucre. Elle installe ses produits au marché public et parfois à son domicile. Elle commença cette affaire avec son fonds propre reçu de son mari, lors de son vivant, il y environ 25 ans. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 5 tas des cannes à sucre.  Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son capital, et construire une maison à léguer à ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit aux petits entrepreneurs.
texts.en:
This client, Zefania, is the team leader of the business collective "La Source". The most senior member and an experienced entrepreneur, she is 65 years old, a widow, and the mother of four children, all with their own homes. Her husband is deceased due to a heart ailment. This client sells sugar cane. She sets up her goods at the public market and sometimes at home. She started this business with funds from her husband when he was alive, about 25 years ago. 

This new loan will be used to purchase 5 piles of sugar cane. Thus, she would like to increase her capital and build a house to pass down to her children. In conclusion, she thanks Hekima very much for its micro-credit support of small-scale entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase sugar cane

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Trader's Union Group

texts.en:
Greetings are coming to you from members of Trader’s Union Group from Kenema, Sierra Leone. This group of entrepreneurs is very happy to inform you that their recently repaid Kiva loan has been very helpful to their businesses and personal lives. 

Having finished repaying that last Kiva loan successfully, they are requesting new Kiva loan in order to further expand their respective businesses. Featured member Salay will again use this loan to buy a larger quantity and a wider variety of slippers to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity and variety of slippers/flip-flops to add to her current stock

loans.name: Jacqueline's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe est créé le 16 mai  2011 lors de l’inauguration leur banc villageois. Il compte femmes qui habitent toutes le même village, solidarité et entre aide caractérisent les relations entre membre du groupe. Elles commencent à mieux comprendre le programme et sont très actives dans le petit commerce au niveau du marché hebdomadaire du village.

Madame Jacqueline (assise à la première place à gauche) est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants dont 01 garçon. Elle tient une buvette où elle vend des jus naturels qu’elle prépare elle-même et des boissons gazeuse qu’elle achète au marché central de la région par carton pour la revente au détail.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte recharger sa buvette par l’achat de 06 cartons de 24 cannettes par carton à 5 500 F CFA et des casiers de soda à 4 800 F CFA.

Les bénéfices serviront à accroître son épargne d’une part et d’autre part à participer à la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
This group was created on May 16, 2011 when the 'banc villageois' was inaugurated. It is composed of women who all live in the same village. The relationships between the group members can be characterized by solidarity and mutual assistance. The women are starting to understand the program better and are very active in small-scale commerce at the village's weekly market. 

Ms. Jacqueline (sitting first from the left in the  photo) is the featured borrower of the group. She is a married mother of three children, including one boy. She has a refreshment stand where she sells natural juice drinks, that she makes herself, and carbonated drinks that she purchases by the box at the central market of the region in order to sell retail. 

With her new loan, she intends to resupply her stand by purchasing 6 boxes of drinks (24 cans per box) at 5,500 francs CFA and some cases of soda at 800 francs.

The profits will be used to increase her savings and also to help cover family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase canned soft drinks to sell at her refreshment stand

loans.name: Dim's Group

texts.en:
Residing in Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province, Dim is a 58-year-old mother and has two daughters who are currently working at a local factory. She supports her living via rice cultivation as her sole business and it earns her about 37,000 KHR per day. 

Dim, a first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), forms a group of two to apply for a new loan. As the leader she will spend her loan portion of 1,000,000 KHR to buy good rice seed for growing and to pay for the plowing fee in order to be ready for the upcoming replanting season. 

She hopes that she can gain a high yield from her crops.

loans.use: to buy good rice seed for growing and to pay the plowing fee.

loans.name: Chantho's Group

texts.en:
Chantho, a mother of four children - two of whom are in school - is 47 years old and is a villager from Kandal province. She affords to keep her kids in school via her duck egg selling business. It is the business that she has had for five years.

Chantho has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for the past one cycle and has succeeded in repaying back the loan already. The positive impact of her loan has helped her to uplift the living conditions for her family and she could afford to buy home appliances for her kids too. 

For this cycle she leads a group of three to take a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion of the money in order to buy more eggs for resale. She hopes to make more income so that she can keep her kids in school until tertiary level.

loans.use: to buy more eggs for resale.

loans.name: Roman

texts.en:
Roman and his family live in the village of Karmirgyugh, which is in the Gavar area. Roman’s father is in the Russian Federation in an abroad job. He is a builder, and from time to time he shares his family's bills in Armenia. Roman lives with his mother, who does not work but helps her son around their farm. In his farm, Roman has at present five cows, nine bulls, five calves, and seven sheep.

The income from selling the farm's products (wool from the sheep, meat, milk, butter and cheese) hardly covers the expenses of Roman's family. He needs some financing, in order to overcome some challenges and difficulties of his life and farming occupation. Roman wants to buy four calves and a lot of animal fodder, and he asks a loan of 900,000 Armenian drams from Kiva lenders. He hopes very much that he will be supported by them.

loans.use: To buy four calves and a lot of animal fodder

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
Blanca es madre de 2 hijos de 11 y 8 años de edad, a quienes quiere muchísimo y por los cuales cada día se motiva para luchar y poder sacarlos adelante. La vivienda donde habita blanca se encuentra en la ciudad de Imperial, la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima muy variado, en donde también podemos encontrar muchas parcelas agrícolas en las cuales se cultiva el maíz, manzana, entre otros.

Cada día Blanca trabaja de sol a sol en su pequeño negocio de venta de anticuchos, especialmente ofrece este rico potaje en las noches , atiende alrededor de 15 clientes aproximadamente; ella cree que está saliendo adelante porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo tiene buena sazón.

Blanca está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar materiales para colocar un falso piso , ya que actualmente el piso de la vivienda es solo tierra y su pequeño de 8 años, se enferma mucho de las vías respiratorias, así podrá ir mejorando la calidad de vida de su familia y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una profesión a sus hijos y llegar a tener un restaurante”.
texts.en:
Blanca is the mother of 2 children, ages 11 and 8, whom she loves very much and for whom she is motivated to strive every day to be able to support them. The house where Blanca lives is in the city of Imperial, which has a very varied climate and in which many agricultural plots can be found where corn, apples, and other crops are grown.

Every day Blanca works from dawn to dusk in her small business selling kebabs. She offers this delicious dish especially at night. She serves around 15 customers approximately; she believes that she is able to keep the business going because she is very friendly with her customers and, above all, she’s a good cook.

Blanca is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because, thanks to the help they give her, she will be able to buy materials to install a floor structure, since right now the floor of the house is just dirt and her small 8-year-old child often gets respiratory tract infections. This way she will be able to improve the quality of her family’s life and continue to strive to make her biggest dream come true: “To give her children a trade and be able to have a restaurant.”

loans.use: to make improvements to her house.

loans.name: Arsen

texts.en:
Arsen is 46 years old, and he lives with his big and lovely family, in the village of Varser. Varser is in Gegharkunik region. Arsen and his wife do their best and work hard for their family's well-being. They have three children -- two daughters who are already students, and a school-aged son.

For many years, Arsen and his family lived in Poland, where he had some business but very little income. The low income made them decide to return to their homeland. Today Arsen owns a plot of land, on which he cultivates potatoes and grain. He also has a big and rich farm; he keeps two cows, one heifer, two calves, two pigs, ten sheep, eight lambs and fifty chickens. All these he has earned during several years, by devoting himself to his work.
 
Arsen asks a loan of 500,000 Armenian drams, which he will use to buy fertilizer for his land. He hopes very much that this support will be the beginning of future cooperation, between him and Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to use in cultivating his land

loans.name: United Sister Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the United Sister Group from Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

Nyama is the featured leader of this group. The 35-year-old is married to a businessman and they have five children, three of whom are attending primary and secondary school. Nyama has been a businesswoman for ten years now. She sells groundnuts. With her share of this loan, she will buy a larger quantity of groundnuts to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of groundnuts to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Tweweyo Tukore Grp Group

texts.en:
Aidah, a single mother of 5 children, lives in rural Lyantonde.
