Having no source of income to depend on except subsistence farming, Aidah resorted to selling charcoal since it was in demand by the town dwellers who can not afford gas, let alone the high cost of electricity. Through the sales she has managed to save some money to pay for her children's tuition as well as meet other household demands. 

Because her capital base was so small she, together with eleven other members from the same village, sought out financial assistance. There was no better alternative than Ugafode since the other institutions in their reach are commercial banks that can not lend to her category of people (rural poor). 

She will use the loan to buy more stock such that she can increase her profits and buy a plot of land on which she will build a residential house in the future. She is a hardworking woman, though her challenges are that she has no alternative sources of income and has to strain the business for all the household needs.

loans.use: to buy charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of market foodstuffs to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Legroma Association Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Legroma Association” group. They are small scale businesswomen based in Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more profit, and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The featured leader of this group is Aminata. Aminata is age 42. She was born in Kailahun town but is currently residing in Koidu. Aminata is a widow with 3 children who are attending primary and secondary schools. For 3 years now, Aminata has been selling market food – tomatoes, etc. With this loan, she is going to buy a larger quantity of tomatoes, etc. to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of tomatoes, etc. to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of market foodstuffs to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Quaquso Group

texts.en:
Annie is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Annie was born in Sowa, in eastern Sierra Leone. She is married to a diamond miner and the couple have four children who are attending primary, secondary, and tertiary academic institutions. For ten years now, Annie has been selling market-food, such as tomatoes. 

This is the first loan that Annie and her group members have applied for from Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT)/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

Annie will use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to expand her business. She will use the money to buy tomatoes, etc., in bulk, to add to her current stocks.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, etc., in bulk, to add to her current stocks.

loans.name: Kankylay Women Ii Group

texts.en:
These are the members of the Kankylay Women II group from Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They are local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a Kiva partner, to apply for a 3,100,000 SLL loan to be disbursed among the group members. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions.

Tigidankay is the featured leader of this group. The 40-year-old is married to a trader, and they have one child. Tigidankay sells clothes and has done so for many years now. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy a large quantity of clothes to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Good People Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the Good People Group from Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan in the amount of SLL 800,000 for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and, consequently, improve their living conditions. 

Jebbie is the featured leader of this group. The 35-year-old is married to a trader, and they have three children. She sells cassava. With her share of this loan, she will buy a larger quantity of cassava to add to her produce for sale.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of cassava to resell to customers

loans.name: Eliodoro

texts.es:
El señor Eliodoro es soltero, tiene 39 años, se dedica a la compra  - venta  de muebles desde hace varios años, compra  y vende roperos de 2 y  3 cuerpos, juego de comedores, sillas de madera individuales, cama , placar, modular, cómodas.
El es una persona muy trabajadora, que ha demostrado que con esfuerzo se puede salir adelante, ya que por medio de su trabajo ayuda a su familia.
Solicita este préstamo para la compra de muebles para la venta, ya que está aumentando su cantidad de clientes al visitar otras zonas que anteriormente no visitaba y por ende aumenta su demanda y el crédito le ayudará a fortalecer su negocio, mejorar su variedad de productos y eso  le permitirá ofrecer variedad  a sus clientes y así poder mejorar su ingreso mensual.
texts.en:
Eliodoro is single. He is 39 years old and has made a living buying and selling furniture pieces for a few years. He buys and sells 2-3 piece wardrobe sets, dining room sets, individual wooden chairs, beds, and chests of drawers.  Eliodoro is a very hardworking person who has demonstrated that with hard work, he can get ahead. He is able to help his family from what he earns in his business. 

Eliodoro is requesting this loan in order to buy furniture pieces to sell. He has been gaining new customers since he has been visiting new areas. Since customer demand is increasing, this loan will help him to strengthen his business and increase the variety of pieces he offers to customers so he will increase his monthly profits.

loans.use: to buy furniture to sell.

loans.name: Garik

texts.en:
Garik is the only child of his family, and now it is his turn to take care of his parents as good as his parents used to do when he was a little boy. Garik’s father does not work and he greatly helps him in farming. His mother has worked for many years at their village library as a librarian. 

Garik is 24 years old. At first Garik tried to make his future in Yerevan city and worked as a manager at the supermarket, but very soon he returned to his village and with his father became engaged in farming. On their farm, they keep six cows, three calves and seven bulls. The work about their farm is a lot,  but Garik overcomes all difficulties by the help of his father and his strong will. His farm animals give a good meat and milk, and Garik sells it right from their house. 

Garik wants to buy two calves and a lot of animal fodder for the winter months. For this he requests a loan of 900,000 Armenian drams.

loans.use: To buy two calves and a lot of animal fodder for winter months

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen and his lovely family live in the village of Tsovagyugh in the Sevan area. Armen is married and he has two children already. His wife takes care of them. He owns a shop, where he sells spare car parts.  

Armen is among those people that already once have had a chance to experience that Kiva lenders truly provide help and humanity to those who really need it. By the help of his first Kiva loan, Armen managed to adapt and repair part of his shop for a household goods trading organization, and to buy merchandise for it.

This time Armen needs a loan of 900,000 Armenian drams to renew the assortment of goods in his shop and to buy car wheels. He will try to see what kind of income it will bring, since his family has become bigger and financial drains have become greater.

loans.use: To buy car wheels and to renew the assortment of goods in his shop

loans.name: Konomoqua Group

texts.en:
Sarah is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Sarah was born in Gbenseh in eastern Sierra Leone. She is married to a welder and the couple has 3 children, 2 of whom are attending primary and secondary schools, respectively. For 4 years now, Sarah has been selling ready-to-wear clothes, “Bamako” clothes (clothes tie-dyed in Mali) and “gara” clothes (locally dyed clothes).

This is the first loan that Sarah and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve their living conditions. Sarah is going to use her share of the loan to buy ready-to-wear, Bamako, and gara clothes in larger quantities to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy ready-to-wear, Bamako, and gara clothes in larger quantities to add to her business.

loans.name: Faithful Servant Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you the members of Faithful Group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs, who have come to SMT and Kiva lenders to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each, which they will invest in their respective businesses. 

Baindu is the featured leader of this group. Baindu is a 35-year-old, married woman who has four children – two in primary school and two in secondary school. Baindu sells rice and has been a businesswoman for many years, now. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy a large quantity of rice to resell.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of rice to resell

loans.name: Abdulai's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is pleased to present to you this group of teachers from Kenema, in eastern Sierra Leone. Teachers of this school have come to SMT for a loan of 14,000,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) in order to improve their standards of living. Some of them will use this loan to buy house-building materials, some to buy pieces of furniture, others to pay school fees for their children. At the end of each month, the school’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting their repayment amounts and pays SMT/Kiva lenders. This is the first loan that this group has applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. 

Abdulai is the featured leader of this group of teachers, and he has been in the teaching profession for 31 years now. The 51-year-old was born in Jojoima, in eastern Sierra Leone. He is married to a trader and they both have 4 children, 2 of which are in college. Abdulai has requested this loan in order to buy house building materials like cement, iron corrugated zinc, etc. for the construction of a dwelling house for his family.

loans.use: to buy house building materials like cement, iron corrugated zinc, etc. for the construction of a dwelling house for his family

loans.name: Al-Hakma Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Hakma and consists of four women. They took out a loan through AMB of 280,000 YER, which is to be disbursed among the group members.

Asmhan is 48 years old, married and has six children. The family lives in Aden, Yemen. Asmhan is focused on her business selling many items like perfumes, clothes, etc. as it is a great help in improving her family’s welfare.

As time passes and her customers' needs grow, she has redoubled her efforts. But for Asmhan focus and hard work aren't enough, so she will use her 70,000 YER portion of the loan to buy additional perfume, clothes, etc. to sell. She hopes to gain more in profits through these goods so as to be able to provide a good living for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional perfume, clothes, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Fatmata is 30 years old, married and has 3 children. She runs a general store in Tombo Western rural area in Sierra Leone.

She's been in this business since 2008 and sells plastic rubber products in her community.  She says that the main problem for her business is improper business location.

Fatmata requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more spoons and a variety of food containers for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and pay for her children's school fees. In the future, she would like to renovate her house. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more spoons and a variety of food containers for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise such as small appliances (irons, hair dryers, ovens, electric sandwich makers), furniture, and other items.

loans.name: Come And See Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you the members of the Come and See Group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs, who have come to SMT and Kiva lenders to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each, which they will invest in their respective businesses. 

Abibatu is the featured leader of this group. She is 27 years old, she is married to a trader, and the couple has two children. The children are attending primary and secondary schools. Abibatu sells fish. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy a larger quantity of fish to resell.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of fish to resell

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Trabajadoras está en su ciclo número  2 del programa de comité de mujeres, son de la ciudad de Caaguazú, el grupo lleva ese nombre, ya que todas son mujeres muy trabajadoras que han luchado por crecer y dar a sus familias todo lo que ellas no pudieron tener.
La Sra. Loida es una de las integrantes, ella tiene una peluquería y un pequeño taller de costura. Desea que conforme pase el tiempo, y por medio de la ayuda de las capacitaciones pueda seguir creciendo y mejorando su vida y la de su familia.
Solicita su crédito para la compra de cremas, peines, gel, hebillas, apliques entre otras cosas para su negocio de peluquería. Y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo con su negocio y dar así a su familia lo que necesitan para tener una vida sin privaciones.
texts.en:
The group called Mujeres Trabajadoras (hardworking women) is in its second loan cycle in the Women's Committee program. These women are from the city of Caaguazú. They chose their group name because all of the members are very hardworking women who have fought to grow and provide their families with things they never had.

Loida is one of the group members. She owns a small beauty salon and a small sewing shop. She hopes that in time, with the help of the Women's Committee training sessions, she will keep growing and improving her life and her family's life. Loida is requesting this loan in order to buy creams, combs, gel, buckles, appliqués, and other items for her salon. In this way, she will be able to keep growing with her business and provide for her family so they do not have to go without.

loans.use: to buy creams, combs, gel, buckles, appliqués, and other items.

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
Meet 30-year-old Adama from Tombo Western rural area in Sierra Leone. She is married and has 2 children ages 1 and 6 years. One of her children is  currently attending school. In 2009, Adama established her general stock business.  She started the business to improve her standard of living. She works at the business 7 days per week and 15 hours per day. She says that the main challenge to her business is transportation problems and price inflation.

Adama requires a loan in order to buy more soft drinks, soap and milk. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to take good care of her family. In the future, Adama plans to build a permanent resident for her family. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks, soap and milk

loans.name: Mamusa

texts.en:
Meet 28-year-old Mamusa from Tombo western rural in Sierra Leone. She is married and has 3 children between the ages of 3 and 8 years. She has two children that are going to school. In 2009, Mamusa established her home product business. She began her business because she wants to get a source of income to support the home. She works at the business 10 hours per day, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are improper business location and insufficient capital to run the business.

Mamusu requires a loan in order to buy cups, food containers, and plates for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and improve her standard of living. In the future, Mamusa plans to open a big shop. She thanks you for your support

loans.use: to buy cups, food containers, and plates for resale

loans.name: Sim's Group

texts.en: Sim, a 27-year-old mother of two small children who are too young for schooling, is a farmer from Sampov Meas district of Pursat Province. Besides her paddy rice growing business, she also grows corn and sesame on a half-hectare area to supplement the family’s income. She has been involved in this business for five years and is able to earn up to 16,800 KHR per day. This is not Sim's first loan with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. After successfully repaying previous loans, she feels empowered to sustain her living conditions. Now, in a group of five, she is the leader. Sim will spend her loan portion to buy ten sacks of fertilizer for her farmland, to pay for plowing fees, and to pay a fee to lease farmland. She hopes that she can make more income to expand her farmland.

loans.use: To buy ten sacks of fertilizer, to pay plowing fees, and to pay leasing fees

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Meet 40-year-old Salamatu from Tombo Western rural area in Freetown. She is married and has 4 children. In 2006, Salamatu established her clothing business. She began her business because she needs to create income to survive. She works at the business 10 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of enough capital to run her business.

Salamatu requires a loan in order to buy more waxed cotton. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business In the future; Salamatu plans to own a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more waxed cotton

loans.name: Lamia

texts.en: Lamia is a 27-year-old, single woman who lives in a poor area in Taiz, Yemen.  She works in a clinic and earns a low salary.  She applied for a youth loan of 100,000 YER from AMB in order to buy houseware to use for her house. She hopes to own a retail shop to gain good profit.

loans.use: to buy housewares to use for her house

loans.name: Oyniso

texts.ru:
Ойнисо живет с 2 сынами и мужем. Муж вышел на пенсию и на данное время нигде не работает, сидит дома. Ойнисо с младшим сыном торгует на овощном рынке( лук, картофель и морковь). Старший сын разнорабочий, работают по заказу. Семья Ойнисо растет, младший сын хочет жениться и хочет отделить свой бизнес. Поэтому Ойнисо планирует все что есть оставить сыну а сама заново начать свой бизнес. Для этого она планирует закупить овощи и с этой целю Ойнисо обратилась в Арванд. Она очень надеется, что разделив бизнес они смогут намного улучшить свои условия проживания и накопить денежных средств для свадьбы сына.
 Заранее благодарит Арванд за помощь и поддержку.
texts.en: Oyniso lives with her two sons and her husband. Her husband stays at home because he is on a pension and not currently working. Oyniso and her younger son sell onions, potatoes and carrots at the vegetable market. Her older son performs odd jobs. Oyniso's family is growing, and her younger son wants to get married and split off from the business. Oyniso plans to give everything they have now to her son while she starts her own business all over again. She asked for a loan from Arvand to buy vegetables to get started. She hopes that by dividing the business they can greatly improve their living conditions and save up money for her son's wedding. She thanks Arvand in advance for the help and support.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell at the market

loans.name: Mujeres Maravilla Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Maravilla está en su  ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas están aprendiendo a trabajar juntas y por medio de las capacitaciones quieren seguir creciendo.
La Sra. Rosa es una de las integrantes, ella se dedica a la venta de prendas intimas para hombres y mujeres, y cuenta que ya se hizo de muy buena clientela, ya que tiene siempre muy buena variedad de prendas y eso gusta mucho a sus clientes. Su meta es poder seguir trabajando para que el día de mañana pueda dar a su familia todo lo que ella no pudo tener.
Solicita de este crédito para poder comprar más prendas intimas para la venta, ya que de esa forma podrá seguir teniendo los ingresos para ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The community bank "Mujeres Maravilla" are in their second loan cycle.  They are learning to work together, and through their training programs they want to keep growing.

Rosa is one of the members. She has a business selling men's and women's underwear.  She reports that she has a very good client base, since she always has a good variety of products, which her customers enjoy very much.  Her goal is to be able to keep working so that in time she will be able to give her family everything that she was not able to have.

She is seeking this loan so that she can buy more underwear for resale.  In this way she will be able to continue earning income to help her family.

loans.use: to buy underwear for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothing to sell

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 37-year-old Fatu from Tombo Western rural area in Freetown. She is married to a fisherman and blessed with three children between the ages of 13 and 20. Two of her children attend school. 

Fatu runs a business selling building materials; she sells paint in a busy market. She has been running this business since 2007. She works at the business 10 hours per day, 6 days per week. Fatu says that the main challenge to her family's businesses is getting fish.

Fatu has requested a loan in order to purchase more paint for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and renovate her house. In the future, she plans to build a house. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more paint for resale.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
This is 25-year-old Kadiatu from Tombo, a coastal town in the Western Area Rural District of Sierra Leone. (The town is approximately 30 miles, or 49 km, east of Freetown.) Kadiatu is single and has two children, ages 4 and 7 years. She wants to generate a permanent source of income, since she did not go to school.

Kadiatu runs a clothing business in her area; she sells garments for both men and women. She has been running this business for three years. She works at the business every day, moving around her area selling clothes and footwear.  She says that her business is doing well, and because of the profit from it, she is able to take care of herself and her children. 

She has requested a loan in order to buy more footwear and clothing. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business, and save some money so she can go to an adult education school. In the future, she plans to expand her business more than ever. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy more footwear and clothing to resell.

loans.name: Muhamad

texts.en: Muhamad is a new client to Ugafode, a peasant married to Zamura and with 3 children, the client has experienced hardships in agriculture transportation of his goods to the market especially agricultural produce.  He has applied for 2,000,000 UGX to enable him to buy a motorcycle to help in the transport in order to reach far markets and more sales. With the motorcycle his market base will expand and so will his profits. He is a hard working man but has  always failed to get financial access because he did not have adequate security, but thanks to Kiva through Ugafode he was granted him access to the loan. In the photograph is the client (centre), his wife and the guarantor, they consented on the waiver form.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Mariama is 40 years old, married and has 2 children, ages 10 and 18 years. She runs a fish business in Tombo Western rural area in Sierra Leone. She started this business to get her daily living. 

She's been in this business since after she got married and sells fish within a busy market. She says that at present her business is doing well and out of the profit she is able to provide for her family.

Mariama requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy purchase more fish for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and have a permanent business location. In the future, she would like to expand her business to a higher level. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy purchase more fish for resale

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Meet Kadiatu, she is in her late forties and from Tombo Western rural area in Freetown. She is married and has 3 children. Her children are currently attending school. In 2010, Kadiatu established her fish business. She began her business because she needed to create income to support the home. She works at the business 10 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is that sometimes fish are scarce in the wharf.  

Kadiatu requires a loan in order to buy more fish for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business.  In the future, Kadiatu plans to own a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more fish for resale

loans.name: Sirojiddin

texts.ru: Сирочиддин жизнерадостный мужчина в возрасте 34 лет. Он женат и имеет троих детей. Со своей семьёй он живёт в доме родителей, в маленькой деревне. Родители помогают ему и его жене воспитывать их детей. Так как Сирочидин и его жена постоянно заняты работой, детей больше времени воспитывают его родители. Живя в маленькой деревне, невозможно найти хорошо оплачиваемую работу, поэтому нужно иметь свой бизнес, который будет приносить доход для проживания. И вот уже как 10 лет Сирочидин занимается животноводством. С юных лет он помогал в этом деле своему отцу и сейчас имеет большой опыт в ведении этого бизнеса. От выращивания и продажи скота Сирочидин получает хороший доход. А также он имеет на рынке свой ларёк, где занимается обменом валюты. Этот вид бизнеса также приносит ему дополнительный заработок. Жена Сирочидина тоже приносит в дом доход. Она подрабатывает медсестрой на дому, раньше она оканчивала курсы медсестры. Её приглашают соседи ухаживать за больным, либо делать уколы, и за эти услуги она получает деньги. Дети Сирочидина растут, и их потребности увеличиваются. Он хочет, чтобы его дети учились в городской хорошей школе. Поэтому он планирует расширить свой бизнес животноводства, чтобы получать больше прибыли и восполнять все нужды своих детей. Сирочиддин хочет закупить больше скота, и для этого он обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит. Он заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Sirojiddin is a cheerful man, age 34.  He is married and has three children.  He lives with his family in his parents' home in a little village.  His parents help him and his wife raise their children.  Because Sirojiddin and his wife work more often than not, Sirojiddin's parents spent the most time with the children.  Living in a little village, it's impossible to find good paying work so it is necessary to run your own business to provide an income.  For 10 years, Sirrojiddin has worked with livestock.  Since his early years, he has helped his father in this same business.  From raising and selling cattle, Sirojiddin earns a good income.  He also has a stall at a market where he exchanges currency.  This business brings in additional money.  His wife also earns a living.  She works as an in-home nurse, having earned her degree in the field.  Neighbors hire her to care for their sick and to give injections and she receives money for these services.  Sirojiddin's children are growing and so are their needs.  He wants his children to study at a good school in a city.  Therefore, he plans to expand his livestock business in order to earn more profits and take care of his children's needs.  He needs to buy more cows and to do so, he has turned to Arvand for a loan.  He is grateful for the support.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Rozi's Group

texts.en: Rozi is a 35-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of three children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For many days his rickshaw has not been working properly because of which he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore, as a member of a five person lending group, Rozi has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Rozi is very thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing a rickshaw.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado kuña Guapa está en su cuarto ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres de la ciudad de Villa Ygatimi, una zona bastante alejada y con escaso acceso, ya que son de lugares lejanos y de difícil acceso. Todas ellas quieren que su barrio va creciendo y mejorando día a día.
 La señora Rumilda es la presidenta en el comité y es muy activa, formo su grupo para poder trabajar en conjunto y salir adelante. Ella tiene una despensa bien surtida en la cual trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas, tratando de ofrecer a su clientela lo que necesita y también a su familia los ingresos para cubrir los gastos del día a día.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de frutas, condimentos, carnes, hortalizas y demás, para seguir con sus ventas y dar a su clientela lo que pide.
texts.en:
The community bank "Kuña Guapa" is in its fourth loan cycle.  The group is comprised of women from the city of Villa Ygatimi, which is in quite a remote area with little access to the outside.  They all want their neighborhood to grow and improve day by day.

Rumida is the president of this group.  She is a very active person, and she formed the group so that she could work with others and make progress. She has a well-stocked shop in which she works every day starting very early in the morning.  She strives to offer her customers what they need and to earn the income she needs in order to cover her family's day-to-day expenses.

She is seeking this loan so that she can purchase fruit, meat, vegetables, condiments and other items, so that she can continue her sales and give her customers what they are asking for.

loans.use: to purchase fruit, meat, vegetables, condiments and other items.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet 27-year-old Fatmata from Tombo, a coastal town in the Western Area Rural District of Sierra Leone. She is married and has been blessed with two children, ages 4 and 7 years. One of her children is currently attending school. In 2010, Fatmata established her plastic / rubber goods business. She began her business, because she wants to get a source of income to support the home. She works at the business 10 hours per day, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is, sometimes the bowls break on the way.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to buy cups, food containers, and plates to resell. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and improve her standard of living. Fatmata plans to open a big shop, in the future. She thanks you for your support

loans.use: to buy cups, food containers, and plates to resell

loans.name: Marian          T

texts.en:
Meet 40-year-old Marian T. from Tombo Western rural area in Freetown. She is married and has 3 children between the ages of 5 and 15 years. Two of her children are currently attending school. Marian established her palm oil business after her wedding. She began her business because she was trained in the business and she needed to generate income to support the home. She works at the business 10 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of enough capital to run her business.

Marian requires a loan in order to buy more palm oil for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and improve her level of living. In the future, Marian plans to expand business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more palm oil for resale

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Meet 35-year-old Kadiatu from Tombo western rural in Sierra Leone. She is married and has 3 children between the ages of 7 and 17. Her children are currently attending school. After she left school, she established her home product business. She began her business because she wants to get source of income to support the home. She works at the business 10 hours per day, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation.

Kadiatu requires a loan in order to buy cups, food containers, and plates for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and improve her standard of living. In the future, Kadiatu plans to open a big shop. She thanks you for your support

loans.use: to buy cups, food containers, and plates for resale

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
Meet 35-year-old Mariatu from Tombo western rural in Sierra Leone. She is married and has 3 children between the ages of 3 year and 18 years. All three of her children are currently attending school. In 2010, Mariatu established her home product business. She began her business because she wanted to get a source of income to support the home. She works at the business 10 hours per day, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is that some times the purchasing power of the customer is very slow.

Mariatu requires a loan in order to buy cups, food containers, and plates for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and improve her standard of living. In the future, Mariatu plans to open a big shop. She thanks you for your support

loans.use: to buy cups, food containers, and plates for resale

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Even though Efua grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. Currently, Efua is an entrepreneur. She prepares and sells ‘banku’ for a living (a traditional Ghanaian dish made using fermented corn/cassava dough that is mixed proportionally and cooked in hot water into a smooth, whitish, consistent paste). She primarily sells her banku in Apewosika (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began three years ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their six children. 

Efua has identified that there is a growing demand among consumers for her banku. Nevertheless, she is unable to meet their needs due to a limited inventory capacity. Thus she aims to use her loan to purchase a greater quantity of maize and cassava, therefore helping her to prepare more of her tasty banku. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of maize and cassava, therefore helping her to prepare more of her tasty ‘banku’

loans.name: Kuña Poty – Laguna Ita Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Poty – Laguna Ita está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, están aprendiendo a trabajar juntas y tienen un gran entusiasmo por salir adelante e ir mejorando la calidad de vida de cada una. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza para conocer la situación económica de cada una.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Idalia, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de ingresos bastante bueno, pero igual es consciente que tiene que trabajar y seguir luchando.  Ella tiene una pequeña, pero bien surtida despensa, y comenta que al principio le fue un poco difícil empezar, pero que después poco a poco fue mejorando hasta llegar a lo que es hoy en día.
Hoy solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de verduras, frutas, productos a granel, y demás, que le ayudará a seguir ayudando a su familia con sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group "Kuña Poty – Laguna Ita" is in its first loan cycle.  The women in this group are learning to work together and are highly motivated to get ahead and improve the quality of their lives one day at a time.

Idalia is one of the members of this group.  In her last assessment, she demonstrated a fairly good level of income, but she is aware that she needs to keep working and continue fighting.  

She has a small but well-stocked shop. She says that initially it was difficult for her to get going, but she has made improvements little by little, which has led her to where she is today.

Currently she is seeking a loan in order to purchase fruit, meat, vegetables, grain products and other items.  This will help her to continue to support her family with her income.

loans.use: to buy fruits, vegetables, grain products and other items.

loans.name: Las Exitosas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado “Las Exitosas”  está en su ciclo número 10º del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante.  Son mujeres con gran entusiasmo que quieren seguir creciendo y capacitándose.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Jorgelina  quien se dedica a la venta de ropas y calzados, también se debe destacar el gran esfuerzo que ella está haciendo, ya que todo lo que hace es por su familia, ya que quiere darle a su familia todo lo que no pudo tener y que no pasen por necesidades.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de ropa y calzados de temporada lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group called “The Successfuls” is in its 10th loan cycle in the Womens' Committee program, where everyone works and helps each other get ahead. These are women with great enthusiasm who wish to continue their growth and, also, advancing their training.

One of the members is Jorgelina who is dedicated to selling clothing and shoes. We should take note of her great efforts, since everything she does is for the sake of her family. She wants to offer the family all that she herself couldn't have, while assuring that they will not lack necessities.

Jorgelina requests this loan to purchase seasonal clothing and shoes that will help her to meet her business plan and thereby help improve her income.

loans.use: buy seasonal clothing and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Meet 35-year-old Kadiatu from Tombo Western rural area in Freetown. She is married and has three children between the ages of 6 and 12. Her children are currently attending school. In 2010, Kadiatu established her clothing business. She began her business because she needs to create income to support her household. She works at the business 10 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of enough capital to run her business.

Kadiatu requires a loan in order to buy more clothing to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and renovate her house. In the future, Kadiatu plans to own a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to expand her business.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Meet 42-year-old Sarah from Tombo, a coastal town in the Western Area Rural District of Sierra Leone. She is married and has four children, who are between the ages of 1 and 16 years. Three of her children are currently attending school. In 2010, Sarah established her home products business. She began her business, because she wants to strive for herself and her family. She works at the business 10 hours per day, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is, sometimes people who owe her money don't pay.

Sarah requires a loan in order to buy knives, food containers, and plates to resell. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and improve her standard of living. In the future, Sarah plans to begin importing her goods. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy knives, food containers, and plates to resell

loans.name: Ramatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is Ramatu a women in her early forties from Tombo Western rural area in Freetown. She is married to a fisherman and is blessed with 3 children between the ages 7 and 20. Two of her children attend school. 

Ramatu runs a cookery business at home, and sells local cooking at her house. She has been running this business since 2008. She works at the business 10 hours per day and 6 days per week. Ramatu says that the main challenge to her business is that if sometimes the food is not sold it will spoil.

Ramatu has requested a loan in order to buy food ingredients to expand her cookery business. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and renovate her house. In the future, she plans to educate her children up to college level . She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy ingredients to expand her cookery business

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is 30 years old, married and has 2 children ages 4 and 7. She runs a general stock business in Tombo Western rural area in Sierra Leone.

She's been in this business since 2009 and sells soda, milk, cigarettes and biscuits to her community.  She says that the main problem to her business is lack of capital to expand her business.

Zainab requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more soda, milk, cigarettes and biscuits for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and pay her child's school fees. In the future, she would like to open a big shop. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more soda, milk, cigarettes and biscuits for resale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Meet 36-year-old Mary from Tombo Western rural area in Freetown. She is married and has 4 children between the ages of 10 and 20. Three of her children are currently attending school. Since 2005, Mary established her fishing-net business. She began her business because she was train in this business; and she needed to generate income to support the home. She works at the business 10 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of enough capital to buy more fishing-nets.  She usually sells the small amount she purchases.

Mary requires a loan in order to buy more fishing-nets for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and improve her level of living. In the future, Mary plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more fishing-nets for resale

loans.name: Alies' Group

texts.en: Alies is a 58-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of six children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For many days his rickshaw has not been working properly, and because of this he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore Alies, as a member of this four-person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Alies is very thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing a rickshaw

loans.name: Rugiatu

texts.en:
Rugiatu, age 35, runs a general store where she sells such items as milk, biscuits, alcohol, and cigarettes. She lives with her husband and their two children, ages eight and 15, in Tombo, which is in a western rural area of Sierra Leone. Rugiatu started her business in 2008 because the income earned by her husband, a fisherman, was not enough to support the family. She tells us that the main obstacle to her enterprise is lack of capital to expand her business.

Rugiatu has requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone in order to purchase more items such as alcohol, milk, cigarettes, and biscuits to offer for sale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and allow her to pay her children's school fees. 

In the future, she would like to buy a plot of land. 

Rugiatu is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase items such as milk, cigarettes, alcohol, and biscuits to offer for sale

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel lives in Nanyuki, in the famous Rift Valley in Kenya. The 63-year-old father of three is a farmer. This is his major economic activity. He has done this for the last thirty years. He is building rental houses on his small piece of land and he is estimating that in five years the houses will be complete and it will be helping him. He knew Milango through an employee and now seeks a loan to buy some tea tree seedlings, onions and carrots that he wants to plant on his farm. The major challenge that he faces in farming is that the weather cannot be predicted at times. He has three employees on his farm who help him in running the business.

loans.use: to buy some tea tree seedlings, onions and carrots.

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
Mariatu, age 25, runs a general store. She lives with her husband and their two children, ages four and seven, in Tombo, which is in a western rural area of Sierra Leone. Both children are currently enrolled in school. Mariatu was a housewife until she established her general store in 2010. She started her business in order to help support her children and to raise the family's standard of living.

Mariatu works at her business seven days per week and 15 hours per day. She says that the main challenges to her business are transportation problems and price inflation.

Mariatu is requesting a loan in order to buy more soft drinks, soap, milk, toothpaste, and sardines to offer for sale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to take good care of her family and she prays that she will deliver her baby safely. 

In the future, Mariatu plans to build a permanent residence for her family. 

She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, soap, milk, toothpaste, and sardines to offer for sale

loans.name: Álvaro Alonso

texts.es: El señor Álvaro Alonso es un hombre de 58 años de edad, casado y con dos hijos. Hace aproximadamente 38 años se dedica al oficio de la ebanistería, el cual le ha permitido sacar adelante a su esposa e hijos y brindarles una calidad de vida aceptable. El cliente desea invertir el crédito en el arreglo del techo de su negocio, ya que se le está filtrando el agua y para ello requiere tejas de eternit y alambre y, el resto del dinero lo invertirá en la compra de una máquina canteadora de madera con la cual podrá realizar un trabajo más pulido, en menor tiempo y de esta forma le brindará mayor calidad a sus clientes y, de esta manera aumentará sus niveles de producción y venta, lo que le permitirá  generar mayores ingresos para su familia. Su mayor sueño es poder brindar empleo a más personas y poder enseñar todo lo aprendido en sus años de experiencia.
texts.en:
Señor Álvaro Alonso is a 58-year-old man who is married with two children.  For approximately 38 years he has made a living through cabinet-making, which has allowed him to get his wife and children ahead in life and to provide them with an acceptable quality of life.  He wishes to invest the loan in repairing the roof of his business because it is leaking water and he needs Eternit-brand tiles and wire.  

The rest of the loan will be used to purchase a wood edging machine so that he can do more refined work in less time and in this way offer better quality to his customers, which will increase his production levels and sales.  This will allow him to generate a higher income for his family.  His greatest dream is to be able to offer employment to more people and to teach all that he has learned in his years of experience.

loans.use: to buy a wood edging machine and to improve his location (fix the roof of his business and to buy Eternit-brand tiles).

loans.name: Vanny

texts.en:
Vanny, age 33, is a farmer. She lives and works in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province with her husband and their two children. Both children live at home and are enrolled in school. Vanny and her husband support the family by managing three hectares of cassava farming and two hectares of soybean planting. She has been engaged in this business for 13 years.

This will be Vanny's first loan cycle with Kiva partner VisionFund. She is requesting a loan in order to plow her farmland, buy rice seed, and pay for labor costs. 

She strongly believes that this loan will allow her to increase her income, allowing her to offer better living conditions to her family. Her goal is to keep her children in school until the tertiary level.

loans.use: to plow her farmland, buy rice seed, and pay for labor costs

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Victor nació en la ciudad de Paucartambo y vive en la misma ciudad junto con su pareja, él tiene 38 años y aun no tiene hijos. 

Victor es una persona emprendedora y trabajadora que sale adelante con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación pues tiene tres actividades económicas que los distribuye  para estar en sus actividades durante el día por ejemplo: en las mañanas trabaja como empleado público en una entidad del estado y en sus horas libres se dedica a administrar su tienda de abarrotes y su negocio de venta de combustible. Ya son varios años que se dedica a estos negocios y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Torrechayoc” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar combustible como gasolina,petróleo y asi aumentar su capital de trabajo en este rubro.  Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. 

(La ciudad de Paucartambo es la capital de la Provincia de Paucartambo dentro del departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Victor was born in the city of Paucartambo and lives in the same city with his wife. He is 38 years old and has no children as yet.

Victor is an enterprising and hard-working person who ventures out with much effort and dedication, since he has 3 separate economic activities distributed carefully during the day, so that he can be most active. For example, mornings he works as a public employee in a state entity, then in his free hours, Victor administers his grocery store and his fuel selling business. He has been pursuing these businesses for various years now and its going very well, thanks to the effort he puts into his work.

Victor belongs to the “Senor de Torrechayoc” communal bank and, on this occasion, he is requesting a loan to purchase fuels such as gasoline and fuel oil, to augment his working capital in this area. Victor values and is grateful for the loan and promises to comply with his monthly payment schedule very responsibly.

(The city of Paucartambo is the capital of the Province of Paucartambo, located within the Department of Cusco, Peru.)

loans.use: buy fuels such as gasoline and fuel oil to sell.

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn, age 29, raises hogs to earn an income. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur and has been engaged in her business for two years. She and her husband have three children, all of whom attend school. Jonalyn is pictured here with two of her children.

Jonalyn has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 10,000 loan through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Jonalyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Sina

texts.en:
Sina, age 49, is a cassava farmer. She lives in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province with her husband and their three children. Two of the children are enrolled in school and the eldest is a paid worker. Sina and her husband are both engaged in cassava cropping, and the business generates about 28,400 KHR per day. In addition to working in the family agribusiness, her husband also works for others for a fee for extra income.

This will be Sina's third loan cycle with Kiva partner VisionFund, and she has successfully repaid both her previous loans. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 KHR in order to plow her farmland and pay for labor costs. Additionally, she will use a portion of the funds to buy a plot of farmland to expand the scale of her crop farming. 

Sina hopes that she can increase her income so that she can build a house for her family.

loans.use: to plow her farmland and pay for labor costs

loans.name: Zonia

texts.es: Zonia, de 51 años, es una mujer amable, buena y trabajadora, es casada y vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y sus dos hijas. Zonia, se dedica a la venta de comida. Prepara a diario los más ricos platos característicos de la región, además de refrescos de frutas tropicales y otros. Trabaja con la ayuda de sus hijas quienes se encargan de la atención siempre de la mano con un trato agradable que es su mejor carta de presentación. Su puesto esta establecido en el frontis de su vivienda y atiende todos los días desde las 5 de la tarde. Su rutina se termina por la noche y toma este tiempo para descansar y renovar energía para que al día siguiente se levante muy temprano para irse al mercado en busca de los ingredientes que usa para preparar los potajes. Lleva en este rubro más de 10 años y lo complementa además con la venta de gaseosas y cervezas. Este trabajo le gusta mucho ya que le genera buenas ganancias económicas, pero también sabe que su clientela exige mucho más en cuanto a sabor y comodidad, es por eso que desea comprar los principales ingredientes que usa en su trabajo al por mayor para tenerlos siempre disponibles y una mesa amplia de buena calidad para brindar una mejor atención y continuar disfrutando de las satisfacciones que su trabajo le ofrece. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2000, por tanto agradece a quienes hacen posible su acceso a este crédito para continuar con el logro de sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado comprará arroz, aceite, azúcar, carnes y otros abarrotes que usa continuamente en su trabajo, comprará también una mesa de mejor calidad para que sus clientes se sientan más cómodos.
texts.en:
Zonia is a 51 year old woman who is friendly and hard working. She is married and lives in her own home with her husband and their two children. Zonia makes a living selling food. She prepares the most delicious dishes that are typical of the region everyday accompanied by tropical fruit drinks and other refreshments. She works with the help of her daughters who are in charge of attending to their customers with a friendly manner. 

Her stall is located in front of her home and she attends to customers everyday beginning at 5pm. Her work ends at night and she takes this time to rest and renew her energy to wake up early the next day to go to the market to buy the ingredients she needs for her dishes. She has been doing this work for over ten years and also sells soft drinks and beer. She likes her work a lot because she is able to generate good earnings and also because she knows that her customers have a high demand for the comfort and flavor at her restaurant. It is for this reason that she wishes to buy the main ingredients that she uses for work at wholesale prices in order to have them readily available. She will also buy a large, quality table to offer better service and continue enjoying the satisfaction of her job. 

She is now requesting 2000 nuevos soles. She is thankful to those who make her loan possible so that she can continue to achieve her objectives. She is also committed to fulfilling the punctual payment of her loan installments. With the amount requested she will buy rice, oil, meats and other groceries that she constantly uses at her business and will also buy a high quality table so that her customers can dine more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil and other groceries, as well as a table for her customers.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites, age 41, buys and sells bananas to earn an income. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur and has been engaged in her business for six years. She and her husband have seven children, four of whom are enrolled in school. 

Marites is requesting a PhP 17,000 loan through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy more bananas to offer for sale.

In the future, Marites would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy bananas to offer for sale

loans.name: Mab

texts.en:
Mab, age 39, is a cassava farmer. She lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district. She earns a daily income from her cassava farm, which she has managed for three years. This agribusiness brings her about 33,000 KHR per day. 

Mab is in her fourth loan cycle loan with Kiva partner VisionFund and has repaid her previous loans successfully. The loans have helped her to stabilize her business at a steady pace. She is now requesting a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 KHR, which she will use to pay plowing fees and labor costs as well as to buy cassava seedlings and insecticide for her farm. 

Her goal is to receive a good yield and increase her income.

loans.use: to pay plowing fees and labor costs as well as to buy cassava seedlings and insecticide for her farm

loans.name: Gayatri Group

texts.en:
This group, formed in the year 2009, is called “Gayatri”. It is a group composed of four women members of the village called Gadramunda. It is located in the Nuapada district of Odisha, India. 

One of the members of this group is Bhanubai, who has raised her hand in the photo on the extreme right. She is 34 years old. She lives with her husband, one son of seventeen years and two daughters of eleven and nine. 

Bhanubai has been running a small bakery factory in her house with the help of her husband for the last ten years. In the bakery factory, items like bread, cream roll, toast, etc. are being prepared. She has engaged three skilled laborers for the processing and making of bakery items. Thirty vendors from fifteen nearby villages come to her factory for taking the product. 

Bhanubai says that owing to better quality, design, packing and forms of her products, there is a lot of demand from the locality, but due to shortage of stock, she is not able to meet the demands. She now wants to buy more stock of oil, dough, sugar, etc. with the present loan to increase her production level to meet the demand and grab her customers. 

From the increased income, Bhanubai dreams to start an ice cream factory for the next summer season. She also hopes to save money from the sale proceeds for providing a better education facility to her children.

The other three active members of the group are Sadabadi, Mangalbai and Simadini, who are running a biriyani restaurant, fish business and tyre-repairing center respectively.

loans.use: to purchase oil, dough, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Mirshakar

texts.ru: Миршакар молодой парень в возрасте 23 лет. Он  пока ещё не женат,  но в ближайшем будущем собирается, сейчас занимается поиском подходящей невесты для себя. Живёт Миршакар со своими родителями в сельском посёлке. Он во всём помогает своим родителям, очень их любит, уважает и заботиться об их здоровье. После окончания школы, Миршакар стал помогать соседским пастухам, он помогал им пасти скот на пастбище. И вот уже как 3 года Миршакар сам начал свой бизнес животноводства. Он занимается откормом и продажей скота, и получает от этого хорошую прибыль. Родители помогают ему в этом деле, отец занимается покупкой и продажей скота, а мама ухаживает и выращивает этих скот. Сам Миршакар ещё работает в средней образовательной школе секретарём, и имеет дополнительный заработок от этой работы. Каждый месяц ему приходится тратить много денег на лекарства родителям, чтобы поддерживать их здоровье. Поэтому Миршакар желает расширить свой бизнес, чтобы иметь большое стадо скота и получать больше прибыли от их продажи. Сейчас в наличии у него имеется 3 скота, и он хочет купить ещё несколько голов скота. Поэтому Миршакар обратился в Арванд  и хочет взять кредит для покупки скота. Он надеется на положительный результат, и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Mirshakar is a young man, age 23.  He's not yet married, but plans to wed soon and is searching for a fiance.  Mirshakar lives with his parents in a rural village.  He helps his parents in every way, he loves them very much, respects them, and cares about their health.  After finishing school, Mirshakar began helping neighboring shepherds, assisting while the cattle grazed in pastures.  Now, it's been three years since Mirshakar started his own livestock business.  He fattens and sells cattle and receives good profits from it.  His parents help him with the business--his father buys and cells the animals, and his mother cares for them.  Mirshakar also works as a secretary at a high school to earn additional income.  Each month, he has to spend large amounts of money on medication for his parents to keep them in good health.  Therefore, Mishakar wants to expand his business and increase his herd to increase his profits from sales.  He currently has three cows and wants to buy a few more.  With this goal in mind, he has turned to Arvand to take out a loan to buy the animals.  He hopes for a positive outcom and is grateful to Arvand for the support.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Srang's Group

texts.en:
Srang, age 40, is a cassava farmer. She has managed five hectares of cassava crops for many years. She lives with her husband and their children in a wooden house in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. She has five children in total and three of them are still enrolled in school. 

This will be the first micro-loan for Srang's group with Kiva partner VisionFund. The group consists of two female members. They are each requesting the same loan amount of 2,000,000 KHR. Srang is the leader of the group. 

Srang will use her portion of the loan funds to plow her farmland, pay the reaping fees, and lease additional farmland to expand her crop. She hopes that she can sell her cassava at a good price so that she can relieve the financial burden on her family.

loans.use: to plow her farmland, pay the reaping fees, and lease additional farmland to expand her crop

loans.name: Sainath Group

texts.en:
Kamala, an active married lady of 50, is a permanent resident of Khariar town in the Nuapada district of Odisha, India. She is always cheerful in nature. The active and energetic lady standing in the middle with a raised hand in the photograph is Kamala. 

She resides with her husband and one son of 28 years. To increase the income of her family, in the year 2009, she, along with four other like-minded women of her locality, formed a group named Sainath and availed a loan from Mahashakti Foundation. This is the fourth loan for her.

Kamala herself has been running a fancy store with ladies’ fancy items and cosmetics for the last fifteen years in the heart of the town. She basically sells items like bangles, talc, combs, oil, face cream, plastic items, cosmetics, ornaments, etc. She brings the stock for her fancy store from the wholesale market 200 kms away in another state. The joyfulness of Kamala attracts many customers to her shop. 

Presently, she earns a monthly income of 10,000 INR. She wants to increase the volume of her business to earn some extra income. So, from this loan amount, Kamala wants to purchase bulk items of bangles, talc, combs, oil, face cream, plastic items, cosmetics, ornaments, etc. She hopes to develop her shop into a showroom with quality items in the future.

The other four members of the group are Gitanjali, Surindar, Chhayadevi and Sita. They are running a fancy store, iron and steel materials shop, bangle store and barber shop.

loans.use: to purchase bangles, talc, combs, oil, face cream, plastic items, cosmetics, ornaments, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase tomatoes at wholesale.

loans.name: Thai

texts.en:
Thai, age 53, is the breadwinner for an extended family consisting of 10 children, three of whom are in school. He is a rice farmer. For many years, he has grown rice on three hectares of farmland to earn an income, and he also plants cassava and grows rubber trees. The agribusiness brings him about 29,000 KHR per day. 

This will be Thai's first loan cycle with Kiva partner VisionFund. He is requesting a loan in the amount of 2,000,000 KHR in order to buy rubber tree seedlings for planting. 

He hopes to generate more income to support his family and to marry off all of his children.

loans.use: to buy rubber tree seedlings for planting

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Isatu, age 30, prepares and sells food to earn an income. She lives with her husband and their two children in Tombo, which is in a western rural area of Sierra Leone. The children are aged two and seven and are both attending school.

Isatu has been operating her cookery business for the past 10 years. She began her business because needed to generate income to help support the family. She works 10 hours per day and seven days per week. She says that her main challenge is the lack of enough capital to run her business smoothly.

Isatu is requesting a loan in order to buy palm oil to offer for sale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to grow her business and improve her family's standard of living.

In the future, Isatu plans to continue to expand her business. 

She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy palm oil to offer for sale

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.ru: Зухро позитивная и жизнерадостная женщина в возрасте 30 лет. Она замужем и имеет троих детей. После окончания сельской школы, Зухро не продолжила своё обучение, так как родители сразу выдали её замуж. С тех пор Зухро занимается домашним хозяйством, ухаживает за мужем и растит детей. Но для того, чтобы иметь доход в семье, они оба занимаются маленьким бизнесом. Зухро работает на рынке, занимается торговлей продуктов питания. Постепенно она расширяет свой бизнес, на сегодня она уже имеет свой ларёк для продажи продуктов, а также расширяет их ассортимент. Её муж работает дехканом. Они вместе получают хороший доход, которого хватает на пропитание. Но Зухро и её муж мечтают о собственном большом и просторном доме, где будут жить их дети со своими семьями. Сейчас они ютятся в маленьком домике с не очень благоприятными условиями для проживания. Поэтому Зухро начинает закупать и заготавливать материалы для строительства дома. И сейчас она хочет взять кредит в Арванд для того, чтобы закупить строительные материалы для строительства дома. Она надеется на поддержку, в следствии чего улучшится качество жизни её семьи.
texts.en: Zuhro is a positive and cheerful woman, age 30.  She is married and has three children.  After finishing high school, she did not continue her education since her parents immediately married her off.  Since that time, she has worked in the home, caring for her husband and children.  However, to provide an income for her family, both she and her husband run a small business.  Zuhro works at a market and sells food goods.  She is consistently developing her business and now has her own stall to sell from as well as space to expand her inventory.  Her husband works as a farmer.  Together, they bring home a good income which is enough to provide for the family.  However, Zuhro and her husband dream of building their own home where they will live with their children and their children's families.  Now, they live in a small little home that doesn't provide very favorable conditions.  Therefore, Zuhro has begun purchasing building materials for their home.  Now, she wants to take out a loan through Arvand to buy more construction materials.  She relies on the support which will allow her to improve the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Zulaikho

texts.ru: Зулайхо 43 года.  Она замужняя женщина и мать одного сына. В последние годы муж с ними не живет. Хотя они  не разведены, но у мужа отдельная жизнь. Зулайхо одна воспитывает сына и она всегда старается работать усердно, чтобы сын ни в чем не нуждался. Сейчас Зулайхо хотела бы открыть швейное дело. Она умеет шить национальные женские платья и делать на них вышивку. Она уже знает кто будет ее первыми клиентами: это близкие родственники, соседи, подруги. Зулайхо планирует в день вышивать по два платья, одно простое, а другое с вышивкой. Чтобы реализовать свою цель Зулайхо просит кредит для приобретения компьютерной швейной машинки и ткани. Благодаря кредиту Зулайхо будет иметь собственный прибыльный бизнес и жизнь семьи - ее и сына намного улучшится.
texts.en: Zulaikho is 43 years old, married, and the mother of one son.  In recent years, her husband has not lived with her and her son.  They are not divorced, but her husband has a separate life.  Zulaikho is raising her son as a single parent.  She always tries to work diligently so that her son doesn't go without anything he needs.  She would like to open a sewing business.  She is able to fabricate the national women's dress and embroider it.  She already knows who her first clients will be: her close relatives, neighbors, and friends.  Zulaikho plans to sew two dress a day, one simple, the other more ornate.  In order to achieve this goal, she is asking for a loan to buy a computerized sewing machine and fabric.  Thanks to this loan, Zulaikho will have her own lucrative business and her life, as well as her son's, will be considerably improved.

loans.use: to buy a computerized sewing machine and fabric

loans.name: Maria Santos

texts.es: Doña maria de 59 años de edad, vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de verduras  tomates, cebollas, chiles entre otros tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, el lugar donde comercia es muy estratégico para la actividad y además muy concurrido de personas, ya tiene mucha clientela que la prefiere porque su producto es fresco, a buen precio, de calidad y con un excelente servicio; doña maria  es una mujer emprendedora, dedicada a su labor con muchas ganas de salir adelante, siempre está buscando alternativas que le permitan alcanzar el éxito, quiere realizar una nueva inversión pero no posee de suficiente capital que la respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar verduras por mayor. Doña maria tiene buenas referencias de pago, esta agradecida con el apoyo y asegura que podrá saldar la deuda, a la vez confía que le dará a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Maria is 59 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and son. She sells vegetables - tomatoes, onions, peppers, etc. She has spent several years in the business which has given her extensive experience in sales, allowing her to make the most income. 

The place where she does business is very strategic and also very busy with people. She has many customers that prefer her because her products are fresh and of good quality, and she has good prices and excellent service. Maria is an enterprising woman, dedicated to her work and eager to get ahead. She is always looking for alternatives that will allow her to succeed. She wants to make a new investment but doesn't have enough capital to back it. She is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL that will allow her to buy vegetables wholesale. Maria has good payment references, and is grateful for the support and ensures that she can pay off the debt, and at the same time she trusts that she can give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale vegetables.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Meet 40-year-old Eva from the Tombo Western rural area in Freetown. She is married with two children, ages 12 years and 18 years. Her two children are currently attending school. 

In 2007, Eva established her food stand business. She began her business because she was trained in business and she needs to generate income to support the home. She works at the business 10 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of enough capital to run her business.

Eva requires a loan in order to buy more cooking seasonings, rice and butter for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and improve her level of living. 

In the future, Eva plans to expand her business even more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more cooking seasonings, rice and butter for resale.

loans.name: Haja

texts.en:
Haja, age 35, sells spare motor parts to earn an income. She has been running this business since 2001. She works at the business 10 hours per day and seven days per week.

She lives with her husband and their two children, ages six and ten, in Tombo, which is in a western rural area of Sierra Leone. Both her children are attending school. 

Haja says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business. She has requested a loan in order to purchase more spare parts to offer for sale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to start a savings account and increase her business. 

In the future, she plans to open a clothing shop. 

She thanks you for your support

loans.use: to purchase spare parts to offer for sale

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah, age 40, runs a general merchandise business. She lives with her husband and their two children in Tombo, which is in a western rural area of Sierra Leone. 

Hannah has been engaged in her business since 2008. In her store, she sells such items as soda, milk, cigarettes, and biscuits. She says that the main obstacle she faces is lack of sufficient capital to expand her business.

Hannah has requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone in order to buy soda, milk, cigarettes, and biscuits to offer for sale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and improve her family's standard of living. 

In the future, she would like to buy a plot of land. 

She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy soda, milk, cigarettes, and biscuits to offer for sale

loans.name: Felix

texts.es: Don felix vive junto a su esposa en casa propia,  él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y  frijol tiene muchos años de dedicarse a la agricultura por lo que se ha hecho de mucha experiencia en el rubro, es muy conocido en la zona y ya tiene buena clientela pues obtiene las mejores cosechas, por lo tanto comercia producto de primera calidad y a precios muy accesibles, además el servicio es inigualable, don felix se caracteriza por su gran amabilidad, es un hombre emprendedor con muchas ganas de salir adelante, piensa que aprovechar las oportunidades lo llevaran un paso más adelante del éxito; en la última siembra no obtuvo las ganancias esperadas y esta vez quiere aumentar la producción, pero necesita de un apoyo de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semillas, abonos, herbicidas, fertilizante, etc. don felix tiene referencias de tener una moral intachable, responsable y de muy buena paga, confía que podrá responder a la deuda y al mismo tiempo podrá darle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
Felix lives with his wife in their own home. He works cultivating corn and beans and has devoted many years to agriculture so he has a lot of experience in the industry. He is well known in the area and already has a good customer base. He gets the best crops so he sells quality products at very affordable prices, and the service is unmatched. Felix is characterized by his great kindness; he is an enterprising man eager to get ahead. He thinks taking advantage of opportunities will take him one step closer to success. 

In the last crop he did not get the expected returns and this time, he wants to increase production, but needs more capital. He is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL that will allow him to purchase seeds, manure, herbicides, fertilizers, etc. Felix has references that he has good moral character, is responsible and has a good record of payment. He is confident that he can pay off the debt and at the same time give his family a full life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, herbicides, fertilizer, etc.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 35 years old and married with one child, age 3 years. She runs a fish business in Tombo Western rural area in Sierra Leone. She started this business to get her daily living. Her husband is a fisherman, but his income is not enough to support the home.

She's been in this business since 2006 and sells fish within her community. She says that at present, her business is doing well because out of the profit, she was able to take of her family.

Victoria requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more fish for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and change her status of living. 

In the future, she would like to expand her business to a higher level. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more fish for resale.

loans.name: Abie

texts.en:
Abie is 25 years old and married with two children, ages 1 year and 3 years. She runs a fish business in Tombo Western rural area in Sierra Leone. She started this business to get her daily living. Her husband is not working at present.

She's been in this business since just after she got married, and sells fish within her community. She says that at present, her business is doing well because out of the profit, she was able to take care of her family.

Abie requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more fish for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to increase her business and have a permanent business location. 

In the future, she would like to expand her business to a higher level. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more fish for resale.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
