They have a plot of land on which they cultivate vegetables (potatoes, tomatoes, and cucumbers) and they also have a trim farm where they keep four cows, two bulls, two calves, ten sheep, five lambs and ten chickens. 

Karlen plans to cultivate a lot of potatoes, and he has requested a loan of 800,000 Armenian drams to buy potato seedling. He would also like to buy animal fodder. On this occasion Kiva comes to be the best and the only and trustful partner for them.

loans.use: to buy potato seedling and also to buy fodder for his animals.

loans.name: Bil Bil Group

texts.en:
Bil Bil Group is composed of four Filipino women who all work as housekeepers for Lebanese families. 

Lovelita is a 46 year-old widowed mother of three children, standing second from the right of the picture. Her status as a widow is a great burden on her children because her children depend entirely on her revenue to be able to survive. The fact that she lives abroad also does not help to improve the situation, since her children are left under the custody of her retired parents. The Al Majmoua loan would truly help her providing her children with the financial care they need. In fact, she would be paying the schooling expenses of her children.

Liberty is a 41 year-old divorced mother of four children, standing on the far left of the picture. Her four children live back in the Philippines with her retired parents. She needs the Al Majmoua loan in order to pay the schooling expenses.

Julieta is a 50 year-old single mother of two children, standing on the far right of the picture. She is the only financial provider of her family. The Al Majmoua loan would truly help her with the schooling expenses of her children.

Jesusa is a 53 year-old married mother of three children. Her husband is currently unemployed, which makes her the only financial supporter of the family. She needs the Al Majmoua loan in order to send it to her husband who would take care of the schooling expenses.

loans.use: for settling the schooling expenses of her children.

loans.name: Dong

texts.en:
Dong, 40, is a hardworking woman and a passionate businessperson. She has two children. Her daughter is a student, and her son is in the 10th grade. Her husband sells groceries and earns about 5,000,000 Vietnamese dong (VND) per month. 

Dong is also a grocery seller, as well as a farmer. She has done this work for 15 years. This job suits her family’s skills. Together, the family’s earnings are about 10,000,000 VND per month. 

Dong’s challenge in life, and in work, is covering her children’s education fees. Her dreams are to have her children grow up well and to enlarge her grocery store. This loan is one step toward reaching these dreams. It will enable her to invest in her grocery store, increase her earnings and save for her children’s education. 

Dong has participated in the Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance’s credit program since 2009. In the last cycle, she borrowed 9,632,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10,080,000 VND to buy biscuits, beer, noodles and candy for her grocery store. 

She always wants to raise her children well.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, beer, noodles and candy for her grocery store.

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina is a single mother of five children, and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. 

Madina has a business selling charcoal, and she has been in this business for six months. She has applied for a loan of 600,000 UGX from MCDT-SACC  to buy more bags of charcoal. She works from her home and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include transportation and thieves. 

Madina aspires to become a wholesaler and also to own a delivery van to help with transportation. She resides in a house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Gurgen

texts.en:
The name of this blithe and kind man is Gurgen, and he is again very happy to deal with Kiva lenders and this field partner, Nor Horizon, for the third time.

Gurgen lives in Ddmashen village, in the Sevan area, with his mother, his wife and two sons. He is a farmer and remains the only breadwinner in his family. The last loan helped him greatly, for he has enlarged the number of his farm animals and increased his family income as well. Slowly but surely he goes ahead in his farming activities. 

Compared to previous years, he now manages to sell dairy products right from his house, since his wife makes cheese and butter. Every little achievement gives positive results and also comes to somehow lighten the financial problems of his family.

By the support of Kiva lenders, Gurgen hopes to buy a cow and animal fodder, and he promises that in the near future he will again inform us about his successes in farming.

loans.use: To buy a cow and fodder for his animals.

loans.name: Dd Gorgeous Group

texts.en:
DD Gorgeous is a group comprising four Filipino ladies who work as housekeepers for Lebanese families. Judy Ann is the leader and featured member of this group. She is a 45-year-old widowed mother of two children; she is standing on the far right in the picture. She barely earns enough to provide for herself. Her children live in the Philippines with her retired parents, which means that she is the only financial resource of the entire family.  This situation has motivated her to join the group and contact Al Majmoua in order to acquire a group loan to pay for the schooling expenses of her children.

Bella is a 44-year-old widowed mother of one child; she is standing on the far left in the picture. She is the only financial provider for her family and thus is really in need of this group loan. It would also help her to pay for the schooling/tuition expenses of her children.

Vilma is a 39-year-old married mother of two children; she is standing in the second from the right position in the picture. Her husband is currently unemployed, which renders her the only financial resource of the family. She needs the Al Majmoua loan in order to help her husband pay for the schooling expenses of their children.

Lerio is a 40-year-old single lady; she is standing in the second to the left position in the picture. She needs the Al Majmoua loan in order to send money to her family in the Philippines.

loans.use: to pay for the schooling expenses of her children.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong is 40 years old. She has two children. Her son is learning in 10th grade, and her daughter is learning in 8th grade. Her husband is a building manager. His income is 10,000,000 VND per month. Huong is a farmer and a grocery seller. Her monthly income is about 5,000,000 VND. She has done this job for 10 years. Her family’s total earnings are about 15,000,000 VND per month. 

Her challenge in life and work is paying her children’s education fees. Her dream is that her children can grow up well and she can enlarge her grocery shop. This loan is one of the steps helping her to reach this dream. She can invest in her grocery shop to gain earnings and save the profits for her children’s education. 

Huong is a hardworking woman and a passionate businesswoman. This job not only brings her income but also helps her have many communications with neighbors. She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2009. In the last cycle she borrowed 9,632,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10,080,000 VND to buy biscuits, beer, noodles and candies for her grocery store. She wants to save more money for her family and to raise her children well.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, beer, noodles and candies for her grocery store.

loans.name: Gantulga

texts.en: Mr.Gantulga is 41 years old and lives with his wife and 3 children in a ger (traditional Mongolian tent) in the Uvs province of Mongolia. His wife, Oyunbat, herds their livestock and takes care of the family. His 3 sons study at the local school. Gantulga has herded livestock for years and has lots of experience in the business. He sells his livestock to butcher shops before winter and then prepares forage for his livestock. He is a hardworking, diligent and honest man. He is now requesting 1,500,000 MNT to purchase young livestock to herd into grown meat breeds for selling before next winter.

loans.use: to purchase young livestock to herd them into grown and meat breed and sell before winter

loans.name: Hishigjargal

texts.en:
Mrs. Hishigjargal is 55 years old and lives with her son and grandson in a ger in the Bulgan province of Mongolia. Her son, Mongon, is 26 and works at a local company and her grandson, Monhjin, is 14 and studies at a local school. 

Hishigjargal has been working as a hairdresser at a local barber shop for a long time. She was previously granted six loans at XacBank and has good previous loan records. 

Hishigjargal is now requesting a loan of 600,000 MNT to purchase hairdressing tools and inventory to provide services to her clients. She is a hardworking, honest and welcoming lady.

loans.use: to purchase hairdressing tools and inventory to provide services to her clients.

loans.name: Peterson

texts.en:
Peterson is 32 years old and married with 2 children. He sells secondhand clothes in Nairobi town. The business has been profitable and he makes a monthly income of about 23,700 Kenya shillings. 

This will be his sixth loan term with KADET LTD and he plans to use the loan amount to buy more stock of clothes for selling. He will use the generated income to buy more stock of clothes.

He hopes to grow his business by opening a boutique and also make more money to be able to complete the construction of his family house.

loans.use: To buy more stock of clothes for selling.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 49 years old and married with five children. For the past three years, she has run a retail shop in Kangundo town. 

Josephine is requesting her first loan with KADET LTD to buy more stock of sugar, rice, salt, and flour to sell. She will use the income generated with her loan to pay school fees for her children. In the future, Josephine hopes to expand her business and open another retail shop to make more income and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, salt, and flour

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma, 43, lives in Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and the mother of four children. She has a fishing business to earn a living and sells fish in the local community. She has been doing this for years. 

Recently, she requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos through Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative to buy new fishing nets.  

In the future, Vilma hopes to purchase additional fishing boats and gain more profit.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase dairy cows.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is a 33-year-old married woman with three children. She works selling ghee at a trading center that is a distance a way from a branch of an institution. Sofia sells ghee to people around the trading center who normally buy it for home consumption. 

Sofia is requesting a loan to buy butter from local cows to make ghee. Buying locally and in bulk will be cheaper and she will save on transport costs and therefore make more profit. In the future, Sofia hopes to improve her profit to work with big suppliers instead of relying on farmers in rural areas for supplies.

loans.use: to make ghee

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 44 years old. She sells cereals in Kangundo town. She has been in this business for 3 years and it has been profitable. She is widowed and has three children. 

This is her first loan term with KADET LTD and she plans to use the amount to buy more stock of maize and beans for selling. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children. 

She hopes to be successful in her business and thereby be able to provide for the needs of her children.

loans.use: To buy more stock of cereals for selling.

loans.name: Coleta

texts.en:
Coleta is 38 years old and married with 3 children. She sells firewood and timber in Kangundo town. She also does farming, growing maize, beans and bananas for selling. She has been in this business for 12 years. 

This will be her second loan term from KADET LTD, and she plans to buy more stock of firewood and timber for selling. She will use the generated income to pay school fees for her children. 

She hopes to fully venture into farming and sell the farm produce in Kangundo town and other areas, hence becoming able to provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: To buy firewood and timber for selling.

loans.name: Villa

texts.en:
Villa is 51 years old, married, and resides in Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She owns and helps her husband manage a farm, planting bananas for selling. She has been farming for a living for years, earning about 5,000 PHP a month. 

In 2012, she became a member of GDMPC micro-credit and is now requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She planned with her husband to cultivate the farm to generate more income for the needs of the family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is extremely fertile for agriculture. She has six children and has been farming for 10 years. Her primary income sources are from milk, eggs, crops and personal business.

What is most enjoyable about farming is “selling products.” Her biggest challenge is “spraying.” Animals on the farm have been named “Mur Kuut” (referring to the colour, size and character of her cattle). 

Mary chose Juhudi Kilimo for his loan because the organization “deals with farmers.” During Juhudi's required micro-finance training session, Mary learned that saving “is important.” 

Her highest monthly expenses are farming costs. She believes this loan will benefit her family by improving its livelihood. 

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Mary owns a cow, poultry and bicycle but does not own a pig, pump, motorcycle or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. Mary has a mosquito net but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, a sewing machine, TV or DVD player.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Nam

texts.en:
Nam is borrowing her first loan from HKL in the amount of 2,500 US dollars to build a bathroom and extend the water system into her house. Nam believes that the entire family will benefit from the bathroom and the water, because the main challenge they face is to have enough clean water for their daily consumption. This way, she will be able to provide healthy conditions and secure the overall welfare of her family. 

To connect her house with the water pipes, she needs 1) to buy pipes, and 2) pay the first connection fees to the supplier, and 3) pay for the connection services of a plumber. Nam is very grateful to all kind lenders who offer Kiva loans to improve living standards. Nam is 41 years old and a mother of three children.

loans.use: to build a bathroom and extend the water system into her house.

loans.name: Harkous Group

texts.en:
Harkous is a group composed of three Lebanese women who are colleagues and friends. They decided to join hands and request a group loan from Al Majmoua. 

Siham is the leader and featured member of this group. She is a 35-year-old single lady who still lives with her retired parents. Siham is the only financial provider for her family of six. She works as an editor at a printing house and is in charge of correcting the grammar. Siham's income is very low and not sufficient to provide for herself, let alone her entire family. Her family's income is not enough for them to purchase any additional leisure products and this is why she decided to join the Harkous group. Siham will use her portion of the loan to purchase a personal computer with a desk to be able to work at home to earn extra income.

Abir is a 33-year-old single lady who lives with her parents. Her father sells lotto tickets and she works with Siham in the printing house. Abir is in charge of the printing process. Her family is composed of six people and she must work to earn income to support her family. Abir will use her portion of the Al Majmoua loan to purchase a laptop that is necessary for her editing and printing work.

Roudeina is a 36-year-old married woman. She owns a small international call center and she also sells accessories. Roudeina's husband owns a small business where he trades radiators. She will use her portion of the loan to purchase merchandise for her business to increase her revenue. The additional income from her loan might help her make the decision to have children.

loans.use: to purchase a personal computer with a desk

loans.name: Weldon

texts.en:
Weldon lives in the Litein area of Kenya. He has 3 children and has been farming for 8 years. His primary income sources are milk and eggs.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Farming'.  His biggest challenge is: 'Poor market for farm produce.' Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Chemarus.'

Weldon was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: 'Because of their grace period.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'Utility gives loans after training.'

His highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked 'How will this loan benefit his family', Weldon replied, 'Will get more income to meet family needs.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Weldon owns the following: 'cow, poultry' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net' but does not have 'electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
Sara es una mujer casada de 33 años de edad madre de 3 hijos los cuales están en la primaria en diferentes grados de educación. Ella solo pudo cursar hasta el 5 grado en la primaria ya que las entradas económicas en sus padres eran muy pocas y no pudieron seguirla apoyando pero agradece el esfuerzo que ellos hicieron ya que su familia es muy humilde pero trabajadora. Fueron sus padres los que le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra a muy temprana edad mismos que le heredaron un pedazo de tierra para que ella pudiese sembrar café, maíz y frijol y obtuviese ingresos para su familia. La tierra que sus padres le heredaron está ubicada a una distancia de 3 kilómetros de distancia de su casa de habitación a la cual se trasladan a pie diariamente.

Ella actualmente ha solicitado un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para poder comprar fertilizantes abono entre otros y evitar que sus cultivos sean dañados por la roya y por otras plagas que destruyen una producción completa de no tratarse a tiempo. 

Ella sueña con ser la mejor productora de café en la zona, con su tierra tecnificada y fértil para apoyar a sus hijos con sus estudios, sus sueños, sus metas y otras necesidades básicas como: la alimentación, vestimenta, medicina con muchas restricciones que a diario se presenta.
texts.en:
Sara is a 33-year-old married woman with three children who are in different grades of elementary school. Sara was only able to study up to grade 5 because her parents' income was very low and they were not able to keep supporting her, but she is grateful for their hard work. Her family is very humble but hard-working. Her parents taught her to work the land at a very young age, and they handed down a plot of land to her so that she could plant coffee, corn, and beans and obtain an income for her family. The land that her parents left her is located three kilometres from her home, and she travels there on foot every day.
She has now requested a loan from COMIXMUL for the purchase of manure, fertilizer, and other items to prevent her crops from being damaged by pests and other plagues that will spoil entire plantations if not treated in time.
Sara dreams of being the greatest coffee producer in the area with a well-outfitted and fertile plot of land. This way, she will be able to support her children  with their studies, their dreams, their goals, and other basic necessities such as food, clothing, and medicine. There are many restrictions on them every day.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to protect her coffee crops.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 60 years old and married with four grown-up children who are older than 18. She is a farmer in Tala town where she grows coffee, bananas, maize, beans, and vegetables to sell. Rose also rears cattle and goats. She has been in the farming business for seven years.

Rose is requesting her second loan with KADET LTD to buy fertilizer and seeds to plant. She will also buy feed for her cattle. Rose will use the income generated from her loan to provide for the needs of her family. She hopes to improve her farming methods and plant a greater variety of crops to sell.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds to plant

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is a 29-year-old married man with two children. He lives in Sana`a, Yemen. Mohammed works hard to provide a better life for his family and has been selling sweets in the street. He finds it difficult to accumulate a large amount of money to buy various kinds of sweets because most of the profit he makes goes toward his family expenses such as clothes and food. 

Mohammed is requesting a 60,000 YER youth loan to buy new and different kinds of sweets to expand his business. He thinks that expanding his business will attract more customers, and in turn, result in more profit. Mohammed hopes to improve his income to help him go over the poverty line.

loans.use: to buy new and different kinds of sweets

loans.name: Laira

texts.en:
Laira, 51, is married with one child. She resides in Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.
 
To earn a living, Laira has sold fish in the market for 20 years. Her husband does the fishing, and she sells a portion of his catch in their local community. 

Laira has borrowed 5,500 Philippine pesos through the Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative to buy new fishing nets. She will save a portion of her profits to acquire a new pump boat for the business.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Antoni

texts.en:
Antoni is single and living with three persons in the family home.  He lives in Cilegon, a semi-urban area about two hours from Jakarta. 

Antoni runs a small stall that sells snacks, drinks and mobile phone airtime credits. Antoni began working with Ruma six months ago because he was interested in the income for selling mobile airtime. For the last three months, he has around $140 to $145 in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). 

He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. As the business runs, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Pratiwi

texts.en:
Pratiwi lives in Cilegon, about two hours from Jakarta. Cilegon is known for the Krakatau city. Pratiwi is married and living with her child and husband in the family home. 

Pratiwi manages a small shop selling mobile phone airtime credit. Pratiwi joined Ruma two years ago because she feels easier using Ruma’s product.  With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Pratiwi has seen improvements in her shop. For the last three months, she has earned an average of $120 to $127 in mobile phone airtime credit sales. 

She hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions. Her goal for her business is to expand and bring in more new business in the future

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Dudung

texts.en:
Dudung lives in Cilegon, a semi-urban area about two hours from Jakarta. Dudung is married and living with five persons in the family home. 

Dudung runs a small stall that sells mobile phone airtime credits. Dudung began working with Ruma six months ago because he was interested in the income for selling mobile airtime. For the last three months, he has around $170 to 171 in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales).

He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. As the business runs, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Hezron

texts.en:
Hezron is 33 years old and married. He has two children. 

Hezron has a grocery business in Nairobi town. He sells vegetables, tomatoes, onions, potatoes and fruits. He has been in this business for eight years. 

This being his second loan term, he plans to use the amount to buy more stock of vegetables, onions, tomatoes and potatoes for sale. He will use the generated income to buy more stock of grocery food and have enough stock to sell.

He hopes to grow his business, make more income and open a retail shop.

loans.use: To buy more stock of vegetables and tomatoes for sale.

loans.name: Jielez

texts.en:
Jielez is 38, married, and has four children. She lives in San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. 

Jielez has provided catering services for six years to earn a living. Every month she earns PHP 8,000 from her business. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy ingredients and additional utensils to be used for catering. 

In the future, Jielez hopes to increase her savings for the future needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and additional utensils to be used for catering.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
27-year-old David lives in Akhalsheni village, Khelvachauri district with his 20-year-old wife, parents, and two sons (2 and 3 years old). The main source of the income for the family is from agriculture. They have a plot of land, which David cultivates and plants with fruits and vegetables. After harvesting the products, he sells them at the local markets. David’s father is an artisan; he is working on private orders to earn additional income for the family.

David has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, without any success. His loan request was rejected every time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Now David has requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. He has been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income.

With his credit, David will start trading with fruits and vegetables. He will purchase stocks of product at wholesale prices and sell it with a price markup at the local market. David will earn a good profit with his new business. Part of the profit will be used to reinvest, and another part for the family.  

The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will give David an opportunity to improve the living conditions of the family and insure a better life for his children.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables at wholesale prices to sell in the market.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia esta estudiando la carrera de enfermería, cuenta que le gusta mucho lo que está estudiando ya que siempre quiso ayudar a las personas, y sabe que con su carrera podrá hacerlo.
La inspira su familia, ya que siempre la han apoyado y han estado a su lado para darle todo lo que necesita. El día de mañana quiere poder hacer lo mismo con ellos.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en pagar las cuotas de su universidad, ya que de esa forma podrá aligerar un poco la carga a sus padres, esta agradecida por esta ayuda que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
Sonia is studying nursing. She says that she likes what she is studying a lot because she always has wanted to help people and she knows that with her major she will be able to do it. 

Her family inspires her, since they have always supported her and have been by her side to give her everything she has needed. In the future she wants to do the same for them. She is asking for this loan to pay for college tuition. This way she can ease her parents' burden a little. She is grateful for the opportunity she is being given.

loans.use: to pay for college tuition.

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es: Alba es originaria del Rama pero vive en Managua con 3 hijos mayores de edad, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a vender mercadería en general. Ella empezó  elaborando ropa de cama hace 7 años  y poco a poco fue invirtiendo en comprar diferentes productos para diversificar su negocio,   gracias a esa iniciativa sus ventas han ido creciendo logrando un amplio negocio  ya que sus clientes mencionan el empeño productivo y beneficioso que tiene con su trabajo, invirtiendo y dedicando su tiempo, tiene como otro ingreso la pensión de su esposo. Está solicitando  un préstamo para comprar ropa, zapato, cosméticos y asi mantener su negocio amplio  con la visión de crecer a un mas y comprar una vitrina para invertir en bisutería.
texts.en: Alba is from Rama  but she lives in Managua with 3 grown children. She is a merchant and sells general merchandise. She started making bed clothes 7 years ago and little by little she invested in different products to diversify her business. Thanks to this initiative, her sales have grown and she has been able to expand her business. Her customers mention the productive and beneficial effort of her work, investing and dedicating her time. She has another income, her husband's pension. She is asking for a loan to buy clothes, shoes and cosmetics so she can keep her business stocked. Her vision is for it to grow even more and buy a display case to invest in jewelry.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Virtud De San Nicolás Group

texts.es:
El señor Juan Ignacio es de estado civil casado, tinene 61 años de edad, curso 6 años de educación primaria, tiene 5 hijos que ya no estudian, él se dedica a atender su tienda de artículos de consumo diario, inició este negocio con una tiendita pequeña con pocos productos y hasta el momento lleva ya 34 años de dichosa experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de productos para agrandar su tienda tales como: azucar, huevo, granos básicos, aceite, gaseosas, pastas, etc. en el futuro quiere que su tienda sea grande y muy bien acreditada; los demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la venta de ropa, zapatos, tortillas y tienda en general.
texts.en:
Juan Ignacio is married and 61 years old. He went to school through the 6th grade and has 5 children who aren't in school anymore. He works in his store selling items of daily consumption. He started this business with a little store with a few products and so far has 34 years of fortunate experience. 

He is a group organizer and is asking for a loan which he will use to buy products to enlarge his store, such as: sugar, eggs, basic grains, oil, soft drinks, pasta, etc. In the future, he wants his store to be big and with a good reputation. The other members of the group work selling clothes, shoes, tortillas and in a general store.

loans.use: to buy items of daily consumption.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, 51, is married with three children. She sells used clothes in Nairobi and has been in this business for five years. She currently makes a monthly income of 10,000 Kenyan shillings.

This will be her second loan with the Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology. She plans to use the loan to buy more clothes to sell, including jeans, shirts and blouses. She anticipates making more profit, which she will use to buy a greater variety of clothes and to pay back her loan.

In the future, Mary hopes to be successful in her business and even buy a piece of land to build rental housing.

loans.use: To buy more stock of clothes to sell

loans.name: Rita Elena

texts.es:
Rita  de 40 años es originaria del municipio de Camoapa pero  tiene 5 años de vivir en Managua   es madre de 4 hijos  todos son estudiantes. Ella trabajaba para una señora en el mercado, realizo un préstamo a una persona particular para iniciar su negocio el cual se caracteriza por la venta de comida y bebida  desde hace 3 años, siendo su único ingreso. Actualmente sigue con esta actividad, ella quiere  dar a conocer su producto vendiéndolo también en su casa ya que donde ella realiza sus ventas  alquila. 
Solicita este préstamo con el fin de comprar productos para la elaboración de la comida tales como  arroz, frijoles verduras, aceite, carne y pollo. Ella estima que al comprar al  por mayor los productos, obtendrá mejores precios y podrá vender más., su meta es abrir una cuenta de ahorro y comprar su propio local para en un futuro implementar la venta de ropa en su casa y negocio actual,  trabajando con su hermana ya que es su único apoyo.
texts.en:
Rita, age 40, is from the municipality of Camoapa but has lived in Managua for five years. She has four children who are all in school. She used to work for a woman in the market, but took out a loan three years ago from someone in order to start her own business selling food and drinks. This is her only source of income. She is still doing this work. She wants to get her product out there. She makes her sales from her home, which she rents.
She is requesting this loan with the goal of purchasing products such as rice, beans, vegetables, oil, meat, and chicken, for making food. 
She believes that she will get better prices and be able to sell more if she buys these products wholesale. Her goal is to open a savings account and buy her own storefront. In the future she wants to sell clothing from her home. She works with her sister, who is her only support.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, vegetables, oil, meat, and chicken.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 49 years old. He lives in the Khelvachauri district with his wife and two sons, Mamuka and Rostom. The main source of his family's income is from agriculture. David's family owns a plot of land and cultivates grain and vegetables to harvest and sell at the local market. His sons earn small monthly salaries: Mamunka works as a security guard and Rostom works as an administrator at a local restaurant. David has requested loans from local financial institutions several times to start-up a  family business without any success. His loan requests are rejected all the time because of his low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

David is requesting a loan from Credo to start up a family business. He will use his loan to purchase a minibus to start a transportation business. His loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo that envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the rural poor who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. His new business, financed with his Kiva start-up loan, will significantly increase his family's income. David will use part of the profit from his loan to expand his agriculture business to improve his family's living conditions and ensure a better life for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a minibus

loans.name: Nohemy Lorena

texts.es:
Nohemy de 46 años de edad, es una persona que siempre ha trabajado muy fuerte, para sacar adelante a sus hijos y ayudar a su papá. Es madre soltera de dos hijos propios y un niño de crianza, (21, 16 y 8 años), una persona que desde muy temprana edad ha trabajado en la comunidad. Ella plancha,  lava y  vende diferentes productos. No poseía un negocio propio, pues solamente le pagaban por vender o hacer los oficios. Un día en la comunidad se estaba ejecutando un proyecto de mejoramiento de una calle vecinal y las personas le llegaban a comprar tortillas para la alimentación y fue así como inicio su propio negocio hace ya 5 años, de donde ella obtiene ingresos económicos. Ahora vende a las personas de la comunidad y le es un negocio rentable. Tiene dos hijos estudiando quines en los ratos libre su hija y el mas pequeño la apoyan repartiendo las tortillas, mientras que el otro luego de venir de estudiar se va ha trabajar por tardes a un taller mecánico.
Compra el maíz, la cal en la ciudad, el cual le toma cerca de 15 minutos en el transporte urbano y así es como ella viaja a la ciudad cada semana a comprar los insumos para seguir vendiendo tortillas en la comunidad. Lo hace acompañada de una vecina quien le ayuda a elaborarlas y venderlas.
El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar materia prima (maíz, cal, y leña) para la producción de tortillas, pues su negocio le es rentable y quiere aprovechar ahorita que el precio del maíz esta razonable.
Con el crédito, estará garantizando por mas tiempo su producción de tortillas, pues considera que hasta el momento le es rentable, tiene sus clientes y su demanda a ido aumentando poco a poco, por eso desea garantizar su negocio, para continuar brindándole  el estudio a sus hijos y a su papa una mejor calidad de vida.
Ella desea apoyar en el estudio a sus hijos, pues la mayor sueña estudiar enfermería, el hijo menor aun esta en el nivel básico. Además, su sueño es construir su casa de ladrillo o de adobe, pues su casa actualmente es de bahareque.
texts.en:
Nohemy, age 46, is a person who has always worked very hard to get her children ahead and to help her father. She is a single mother to her own two children and to another she is raising (ages 21, 16, and 8). She has worked in her community from a very young age, washing and ironing, and also selling various products. She did not have her own business; she would just be paid for sales here and there or for doing chores. One day, there was an improvement project for one of the streets in her neighbourhood and people came to her to buy tortillas to eat. This is how she started her own business five years ago already. It provides her with an income. She now sells to people in the community, and it is a profitable business. She has two children in school; in their free time, her daughter and her youngest child help her to sell the tortillas. The other child works in the afternoons after school at a mechanic's workshop.
Buying the corn and lime in the city takes her about 15 minutes on public transportation. She travels to the city every week to buy supplies so that she can keep selling tortillas in her community. A neighbour goes with her and helps her to make and sell the tortillas.
This loan, which she is requesting from Fundación Campo, is for the purchase of basic materials (corn, lime, and firewood) for the production of tortillas. Her business is profitable and she wants to take advantage of the fact that the price of corn is reasonable at the moment.
With this loan, she will secure her tortilla production for more time. She considers it to have been profitable up until now. She has a clientele, and demand has increased bit by bit. She wants to secure her business in order to continue offering her children an education, and providing a better quality of life for her father.
She wants to support her children's studies; her eldest daughter dreams of studying nursing. Her youngest son is still in elementary school. Furthermore, her dream is to build a brick or adobe home; her house currently has mud walls.

loans.use: to buy basic materials (corn, lime, and firewood) for making tortillas.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge es alumno regular del 2do año de la Carrera Derecho de la de la universidad nacional de Asunción, una de las mejores universidades del País. Es el menor de dos hermanos y trabaja en el Poder Judicial hace dos años. El se define a si mismo como un chico bueno y responsable.
Su meta es llegar a ser abogado y gran profesional del rubro ya que le dedica mucho tiempo a la lectura de sus libros. Aspira con ser uno de los mejores y así poder ser útil para su familia y la sociedad. Inspirado por el pensamiento de su padre en el respeto y la honestidad hace que Jorge sea cada vez más luchador por sus sueños e ideales.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en pagar sus clases, y de esa forma estar más cerca de su sueño.
texts.en:
Jorge is a regular student in his second year of law school at the Universidad Nacional de Asunción, one of the best universities in the country. He is the youngest of two children and has worked in the judicial system for two years. He describes himself as a good and responsible guy.
His goal is to become a lawyer and a great professional in the field. He dedicates a lot of time to reading his books. He aspires to be one of the best and to contribute to his family and to society. He is inspired by his father's teachings on respect and honesty, which make him work harder for his dreams and ideals.
He is requesting this loan so that he can invest in paying for his classes. This way, he will be closer to his dream.

loans.use: to pay for university classes.

loans.name: Anatolia

texts.es:
Anatolia es de la ciudad de Ybycui, es madre, también trabaja y estudia. Es una mujer muy sacrificada, que con esfuerzo y sacrificio está saliendo adelante.
Ella pese a que ya es una persona mayor quiere seguir capacitándose, y es por eso que está estudiando la carrera de administración de empresas. Cuenta que todo lo que hace es por su familia, para darles un futuro digno.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en pagar sus clases de la universidad y también para pagar las cuotas. Esta agradecida por esta oportunidad que le será de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
Anatolia is from the city of Ybycui. She is a mother and also works and studies. She is a sacrificial mother, and with hard work and sacrifice, she is getting ahead.
Even though she is a mature student, she is studying business administration.
She tells us that everything she does is for her family, so that she can give them a decent future.
She is requesting this loan so that she can invest in paying for her university classes, and also to pay the quotas. She is grateful for this opportunity, as it will be a great help to her.

loans.use: to pay for classes.

loans.name: Alba

texts.es:
Alba es de la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo, es estudiante de Odontología, vive con sus padres y hermanos, trabaja en el negocio familiar y estudia.
Su meta es recibirse y ejercer su profesión. A cierto tiempo se ve siendo una profesional reconocida, que pueda ayudar a las demás personas en algo tan importante como lo es la salud bucal. Se esfuerza porque estudia y trabaja a la vez.
Solicita esta crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de útiles para la universidad y también para pagar las cuotas de la universidad.
texts.en:
Alba is from the city of Coronel Oviedo. She is a student of dentistry and she lives wither her parents and siblings. She works in the family business and she goes to school.  

Her goal is to graduate and practice her profession. After a certain amount of time she sees herself becoming a well known professional who can help other people in something as important as oral health. She works hard because she has a job and goes to school at the same time. She is asking for this loan to be able to invest it in supplies for college and to pay for tuition.

loans.use: to buy supplies for college and to pay for tuition.

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
Sara es de la ciudad de Villarrica, está estudiando la carrera de contabilidad que es lo que más le gusta, ya que con esta carrera quiere desarrollarse como profesional competente y encontrar un  buen trabajo por el cual pueda ayudar a su familia.
Comenta que quienes la inspiran a seguir estudiando es su familia, por el gran apoyo que siempre le da, ya que le han enseñado muy buenos valores. Agradece también por la ayuda que Kiva le está dando.
Solicita de este crédito para invertirlo en comprar útiles y también en pagar sus cuotas de la universidad.
texts.en:
Sara is from the city of Villarrica and is studying accounting, the subject that she most likes.  With these studies, she would like to become a capable professional and find a good job with which she can help her family.

She says that her family inspires her to continue studying with the huge support that they give her and the very good values that they have taught her.

Sara also thanks Kiva for its support.

Sara is applying for this loan to invest in buying materials and to pay university fees.

loans.use: to buy materials and pay fees.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie, age 45, manages a piggery where she raises piglets to earn an income. For additional income, she has been engaged in a service-based activity for two years. She lives with her husband and their two children in Villaflor, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. Tessie earns a total of PhP 5,000 per month from her two business activities. 
 
She has requested a loan of PhP 15,000 from GDMPC micro-credit. She will use her loan funds to repair her livestock's shelter. 

Tessie hopes to improve the business and earn more income so that she can provide a better future for her family.

loans.use: to repair the livestock's shelter

loans.name: Ambrosi

texts.en:
Ambrosi, age 38, is an auto artisan, repairing cars for an income. Ambrosi lives in Senaki District with his wife and their three children, as well as his mother, who is provided with a small retirement pension. Other than this, Ambrosi's business provides the only source of income for the family, and it is hardly enough to provide food for them. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Ambrosi wishes to start up a car wash business. He has requested loans from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up purposes, but without success. His loan request was rejected each time because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

He has now requested a loan from Credo to start up the new family business. He has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products because they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” due to their low income. 

With his credit, Ambrosi will open a car wash. As he has been repairing cars in his community for many years and has a good number of clients, he is confident that the business will be profitable. This will significantly increase the income of their family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to open a car wash

loans.name: Mirian

texts.en:
Mirian is 28 years old. He lives with his wife and two daughters (5 and 6 years old) in Keda district. Mirian requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The family runs an agricultural business. They have one milk cow, a vineyard and a plot of agricultural land. The cow is milked every day to produce cheese. From the harvested grapes, Mirian is making wine, and on the plot of land, vegetables are grown. Mirian is a very hardworking man. He is working very hard to earn a small monthly income by selling all the products at the local markets. 

Mirian requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Mirian has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his credit Mirian, will purchase seats for his mini-bus. He wants to start driving it on a bus line from his village to the Batumi direction. Mirian will work as hard as he can to earn a good income and use it for his family to provide all the needed household goods and cover their monthly expenses. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To purchase seats for his mini-bus.

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina is married with two children, and both her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (her mother and cousin).  

She has business of selling ground nuts and beans. She has been in this business for 20 years, working six days out of every week and selling on a retail basis only. She has applied for loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy bags of ground nuts and beans. She doesn’t have any other income-generating activity.   

Her major business challenges include transportation, defaulters and seasonality. She is aspiring of becoming a wholesaler and also to soon rent a store. She resides in the family house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent for her business premises and electricity.

loans.use: To buy more bags of ground nuts and beans.

loans.name: Seybatou's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sobouldé a été créé le 17 Mai 2011 lors de l’inauguration leur banc villageois. Ce  groupe en sein des femmes très braves et désireuses d’apporter un plus à leur foyer. Elles habitent toutes le même village. Il existe une parfaite solidarité entre les femmes. Elles font comme activité principale le  petit commerce et la fabrication de savon traditionnel.

Madame Seybatou (assise à l’extrême gauche avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe, elle est mariée et mère de cinq enfants dont 02 garçons, elle est une femme très respectée au sein du groupe. Elle est vendeuse de savon, de riz. Son activité consiste à l’achat au marché communal de pack de savon à 6 500 F CFA pour la revente en détail à 200 F CFA le morceau, de sacs de riz à 15 000 F CFA  au détail 350 F CFA le kilo et autres ingrédients pour la cuisson.

Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter des sacs de riz, des packs de savons petits et grands modèles et des assaisonnements.

Les bénéfices, elle les utilise en partie pour augmenter son épargne et soutenir son mari dans les charges scolaires des enfants.
texts.en:
The Sobouldé group was created on the 17th of May 2011 on the occasion of the official opening of their village bank. At the heart of this group are a number of good and honest women who wish to improve life for their household. They all live in the same village. There is true solidarity between the women. Their principal activity is the production and local commerce of traditional soap.

Mrs. Seybatou (who is sitting on the far left with her hand raised), is the star borrower of the group. She is married with five children of which two boys, and is much respected within the group. She sells soap and rice. Her work is to buy soap packs at 6 500 F CFA at the local market which she then sells retail for 200 FCFA each soap bar, to buy bags of rice at 15 000 F CFA to sell retail for 350 F CFA a kilo and the same for other cooking ingredients.

With this loan she plans to buy bags of rice, packs of small and large soap bars and condiments.

She uses the profits partly to increase her savings and partly to assist her husband in paying their children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice, packs of small and large soap bars and condiments.

loans.name: Al-Zahra Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Zahra. It is made up of five members who work together in different areas. This is a group of women with initiative, values, and good business sense. Together, they have requested a loan in the amount of 115,000 YER from AMB. 

Basma, age 24, is the leader of this group. She lives in Taiz. To earn an income, she sells food, clothes, and perfumes. She buys her merchandise from distributors and stores where the prices are cheaper. Basma is very grateful to her neighbors who have supported her over all these years. 

At the present time, her business doesn't bring her as much profit as she would like due to the bad situation in Yemen. She has therefore applied for a youth loan in the amount of 25,000 YER from AMB, which she will use to acquire food, clothes, and perfumes to offer for sale. She will sell these to her customers at a profit, thus giving her the opportunity to improve her business income.

loans.use: to buy food, clothes, and perfumes to offer for sale

loans.name: Nagina's Group

texts.en: Nagina lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of three children. Her husband owns an electrician's shop which is the only source of income for the family. Her husband wants to purchase electric wires, bulbs, switches, and other items for the shop. Therefore, Nagina's two-person lending group has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. She is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for the business. With the profits expected from this loan, she intends to purchase dresses for her family for Eid al-Fitr.

loans.use: to purchase electric wires, bulbs, switches, and other items for the shop.

loans.name: Seleazar Alnacer

texts.es:
Seleazar es una joven de 26 años de edad, casada y madre de 2 hijos la cual tiene un grado de educación primaria no completado cursado hasta el 3 grado dedicada a los oficios domésticos y a la agricultura en lo que es el cultivo de café, maíz y frijoles. Ella tiene mucha experiencia ya que desde muy pequeña se ha dedicado a este rubro y fueron sus padres los que le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra y agradece a los mismos porque fueron ellos quienes le heredaron un pedazo de tierra para que ella pudiese comenzar con el negocio de la familia que por tradición es la agricultura. 

Ella ha solicitado a la cooperativa COMIXMUL un financiamiento para dar mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café y evitar que sean dañados por la roya entre otros comprando fertilizantes, abono, urea, etc. productos que evitan el deterioro de sus cultivos. 

Sus metas son las de proteger sus cultivos al máximo y evitar que sean dañados y contagiados con la roya entre otras plagas que lo puedan dañar para poder sacar una excelente cosecha y re-invertir en sus cultivos, apoyar a su esposo e ir formando un respaldo para el crecimiento, estudio y demás necesidades de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Seleazar is 26 years old, married and a mother to two children.  She completed only the first three years of primary school and now splits her time between looking after the home and working in farming, growing coffee, corn and beans.  Seleazar has a lot of experience as, from a very young age, she has worked in this area and her parents taught her how to work the land.  Saleazar is grateful to her parents as it was them who left her a plot of land.  This land was for her to start a business, which, in family traditional, would be in the agricultural sector.

Seleazar has applied for a loan from "COMIXMUL" in order to maintain her coffee crops and to avoid damages such as rust and other dangers.  She will buy urea, fertilisers, manure and other products that will prevent her crops from deteriorating.

Seleazar's goals are to protects her crops as best as possible, and to avoid dangers and diseases, such as rust and other problems that can prevent having an excellent harvest.  Seleazar will reinvest in her crops, support her husband and continue to support her children's growth, studies and other needs.

loans.use: to buy supplies for maintaining her coffee plants.

loans.name: Hennie

texts.en:
Hennie, age 54, runs a general store to earn an income. In addition, she earns PhP 10,000 per month by running a piggery business, raising piglets to offer for sale. She lives with her husband and child in Villaflor, Oroquieta City. 

Hennie has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 20,000 from GDMPC micro-finance, which she will use to buy rice and corn grits to offer for sale. 

In the future, Hennie intends to expand her business in order to generate more income to meet the family's needs.

loans.use: to buy rice and corn grits to offer for sale
